loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 60-year-old married woman and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to her husband's low social and financial status, she started a grocery shop 11 years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is a lovable woman and has a good reputation among her customers inside the camp, she works hard to develop her business. She requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers during this winter season. 

She hopes to  provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her  merchandise with new products.

loans.name: Zion Group

texts.es: Zion es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por Carolina una joven de 20 años de edad con espíritu de superación, acompañada y madre de dos hijo, quienes son su mayor fuerza de superación, ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio, además comercializa cosméticos, este negocio lo impulsó hace dos años con ayuda financiera de su abuela, es primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM e invertirá en cosméticos perfumes para damas y caballeros AVON, además en carne de res, plátano verde, plátano maduro, etc., de manera que le permitirá cubrir con la demanda que tiene de los servicios ofrecidos. Otra de las integrantes es Blanca de 31 años de edad propietaria de una panadería desde hace diez años en su domicilio y Fátima de 39 años de edad quien comercializa ropa de segunda mano en su domicilio desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
Zion is a solidarity group made up of three hardworking women.  The group is coordinated by Carolina, who is 20 years old and has a desire to succeed.  She is married and the mother of two children.  They are her greatest drivers to succeed.  

She works selling food from her home and also sells cosmetics.  She started this business two years ago with financial help from her grandmother.  This is her first loan with ADIM and she will invest in Avon cosmetics and perfumes for women and men, as well as beef, green plantains, ripe plantains, and other items so that she can meet the demand she has for her services.

The other group members are Blanca, 31 years old, who has owned a bakery in her home for ten years, and Fátima, 39 years old, who has sold secondhand clothing from her home for three years.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and kitchen supplies in order to offer quality products.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is applying for her second loan. She used her previous loan to add children's clothes to the other accessories that she sells at home. Suzan finds that she is making better income with the clothing. She now wants to add women's clothing items and blankets for this winter.

Suzan is insisting on expanding the business since she could not find a suitable job for her diploma degree, and she feels that it is destructive for a person to stay at home with no activity to do. She is a 34-year-old married woman with no children.

loans.use: to add women's clothing and blankets to her other items to sell this winter

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a widow that lives in Hueyapan, Morelos. Ever since her husband passed away, Beatriz works selling fruits and flowers in the market, just as her husband did. Beatriz has been saving for the last couple of months to install proper windows in her home and a door to her bedroom. She has been working hard and sees this investment in her home as a reward. Beatriz is asking for a loan to finish the payment of the materials needed. She has no access to other type of credit because of her age and because her job is informal. Beatriz will receive technical supervision and training so that she can properly do the job, also her neighbor will help her with the heavy lifting. Beatriz wishes to take the plastic away from the window space and replace the bedsheet that divides her room from the rest of the house.

loans.use: to buy materials to install proper windows and a door

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is a retired man he is 70 years old and lives alone paying rent since 5 years ago he has two adult sons and they have their own families and expenses Eduardo requires a loan to buy sugar that he will resell 

He discover that business thanks to his daughter who sells sugar since a couple of months that business has lots of perspectives and it will help Eduardo to improve his situation Eduardo thanks Kiva that they considered his case to be published The picture depicts Eduardo at his small grocery store
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 70-year-old retired man who lives alone and has paid rent for 5 years.  He has two adult sons and they have their own families and expenses.

Eduardo requires a loan to buy sugar.  His daughter started a business to  sell sugara couple of months ago.  Her  business has lots of perspective clients and it will help Eduardo to improve his situation.

 Eduardo thanks Kiva that they considered his case to be published.  Eduardo is pictured at his small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sugar.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 60 años, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos (todos son independientes), su esposa es una dedicada ama de casa trabaja como administrador financiero, la pareja vive en La Paz.

La casa donde viven es antigua y tiene problemas de construccion, en este caso la cañeria que pasa por el medio de la casa esta humedeciendo la parte inferior, por lo que Juan solicita credito para reestructurar el piso, remover la cañeria y arreglar las filtraciones de agua
texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old. He is married and has 3 children (all of whom are independent). His wife is a dedicated housewife and he works as a financial administrator. The couple live in La Paz.

The house where they live is old and has construction problems. In this case the piping that goes through the middle of the house is dampening the lower part, so Juan is asking for a loan in order to restructure the floor, remove the piping, and fix the water leaks.

loans.use: restructure the floor, remove the piping, and fix the water leaks

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es una persona que busca prosperidad para su hija y su esposa tiene una hija de 5 años, vive junto con su esposa en una comunidad de Sololá. Él tiene 31 años de edad. 

Francisco para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y entre otros productos que son vendibles en la comunidad. La experiencia de Francisco para montar su negocio lo adquirió con personas de su comunidad, ya que el anteriormente trabajo como empleado para otras tienda. 

Francisco quiere mucho a su familia y cada día lucha por darles lo necesario, la meta de Francisco es comprar un terreno, ya que eso lo serviría para darle de herencia a su hija cuando sea grande,  para poder realizar esta compra, necesita hacer un préstamo, así poco a poco va pagando con las ganancias que genera su tienda, Francisco no cuenta con otro ingreso él gracias a la venta que realiza en su tienda sostiene  a su familia. El es una persona que atiende con amabilidad a su clientela.
 
El sueño mas grande de Francisco es atender bien a su clientela, y con las ganancias de la primera tienda puede poner un segundo negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco is a person who seeks prosperity for his daughter and his wife. He has a 5 year old daughter. He lives with his wife in the community of Sololá. He is 31 years old.

Francisco is dedicated to selling groceries and other products that are in demand in the community to generate their income and support his family. Francisco learned to run this business from people in his community when he worked in another store as an employee. 

Francisco loves his family and works hard everyday to give them what they need. Francisco’s goal is to buy land to serve as his daughter’s inheritance when she grows up. To make this purchase, he needs this loan. He will gradually save the money with the profits generated from his store to repay his loan. Francisco has no other income. Selling in his shop supports his family. He is a person who kindly serves his customers.

Francisco’s biggest dream is to take good care of his customers and use the profits from his first shop to put towards a second business.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of assorted cereals

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 44 years old and married to Annah. They have been blessed with three children ages 16, 10 and 5 years old. Peter has had a motorcycle transport business for 10 years, and he also has a profitable retail shop. He will use this loan to expand his retail shop by buying more goods to sell such as sugar, rice and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to continue to buy more goods to sell. This is Peter's third loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his retail shop by buying stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Deysi Olinda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Deysi, tiene 37 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
Doña Deysi es maestra en un colegio de la localidad pero para generar sus ingresos extra ella también se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, edredones y almohadas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su lugar de trabajo a madres de familia, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas y edredones. Sus sueños son seguir adelante logrando mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés ["The San Andrés Credit Group"] meets every 15 days at the Leonidas Proaño citadel in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited anytime of the year and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions.

Here lives Deysi, a 37 year old woman. She is single and lives with her parents. She has been in the credit group from the start and she likes it for the help that the credit can provide.

Deysi is a teacher in a local school, but to generate extra income she is also involved with commercial trade, selling sheets, comforters, and pillows. She sells door to door and also sells to mothers in the place she works. She gives credit to her customers and collects every week. She has been doing this for over four years, which began with one of the loans she received from the group. 

This loan will be used to purchase sheets and comforters.  Her dreams are to keep moving ahead and improving her life.

loans.use: to buy sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es: Eveling: Es una maestra originaria de Waspam, tiene 28 años de edad, casada. Su casa es de madera y  actualmente se encuentra bastante deteriorada.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para reparar su vivienda. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa bonita de cemento, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y ambiente para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Eveling is a teacher from Waspam.  She is 28 years old and married.  Her house is made of wood and currently quite deteriorated.

That is why they are requesting a loan to repair their house.  With the loan, she is going to buy planed lumber, studs, nails, and pay for labor.

She and her husband dream of having a nice cement house with better safety conditions and atmosphere for their whole family.

loans.use: To repair her house made of straw and wood.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian es una mujer de 43 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad y un sobrino de 12 años de edad que también vive con ellos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que sale a ganarse la vida desde muy temprano vendiendo plantas ornamentales de forma ambulante, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años y que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Mirian siempre busca lo mejor para su familia, es por ello que desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que no cuenta con este servicio, por lo que desea aprovechar un proyecto para realizarlo, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pago de derecho, caja térmica, tomacorriente, alambre y mano de obra para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Mirian is a 43-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her 2 children aged 10 and 16 and a 12-year-old nephew who also lives with them. She is an entrepreneurial woman who goes out to earn a living very early in the morning selling ornamental plants as a street vendor. She has done this work for 10 years and it allows her to move her family ahead. Mirian is always looking for the best for her family, and that is why she wants to install electrical service in her house, since it does not have it. She wants to take advantage of a project in order to do it. For this she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to pay for a permit, fuse box, outlets, wire, and labor to install electrical service in her house.

loans.use: to pay for a permit, fuse box, outlets, wire, and labor to install electrical service in her house

loans.name: Erika Arely

texts.es: Erika de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella desde muy temprano inicia su jornada recorriendo los cantones aledaños y el centro del municipio para ofrecer las plantas ornamentales para poder de esta forma llevar el sustento a su hogar. Erika sabe que en su cantón se llevará a cabo la instalación de energía eléctrica, por lo que ella desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para poder invertir en: alambre, derecho de instalación, caja térmica, tomacorriente, etc. Para poder instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda y así poder disfrutar de este servicio.
texts.en:
Erika, 32, lives in her own home with her husband and her two children, 12 and 5.  She starts going around very early in the morning to nearby cantons and the center of town to sell ornamental plants so she can support her household.

Erika knows they're going to install electricity in her canton.  She wants to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in wire, installation fees, a circuit breaker box, outlets, etc. so she can install electricity in her home and be able to have that service.

loans.use: to invest in wire, installation fees, a circuit breaker box, outlets, etc., so she can install electricity in her home

loans.name: Marcelo Simon

texts.es:
Marcelo es un hombre de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo, y su negocio es la confección de cortinas, estores y material de decoración.
Él es independiente, generoso, amable, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en un área comercial, especialmente de frutas, verduras y carne. Vendedores informales reciben la fruta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para comercializarlas en el lugar hasta altas horas de la noche. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 7-15 grados centígrados.
Marcelo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, la familia vive en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de cortinas, estores y decoración de interiores como cojines y otros. “Las nuevas cortinas no son pesadas ni hace falta que te rompas la cabeza con un diseño que combine con toda la decoración. Elige telas ligeras de texturas más modernas en diseños lisos o semi-lisos. Y siempre en colores neutros y claros: beiges, blancos, topos, grises, etc…” comenta. Su sueño es expandir su taller de costura, comprar más máquinas y contratar trabajadores para así incrementar su producción. Él desea realizar la compra de material de confección de cortinas como; telas, estores, rieles y otros, por mayor, para contar con material de trabajo y producir constantemente. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando este trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelo solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para elaborar cortinas, estores y cojines para la decoración de interiores.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a 39-year-old man, lives with his partner, has a child, and his business is making curtains, blinds and things for decorating.  He is independent, generous, friendly, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in a commercial area, especially with fruit, vegetables, and meat. Informal salespeople get the fruit in the early hours of the morning to sell them in that place until late at night.  It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 7-15 degrees centigrade. 

Marcelo has olive skin, short black hair, is short, has a robust figure, his native language is Aymará and he speaks Spanish from school and for his business. He shares his live with his partner, who works in the same business, and with his son who goes to school. The family lives in a rented house made of brick, which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. His business is making curtains, blinds, and objects for interior decorations such as cushions and more. "The new curtains are not difficult and they don't make your head hurt with a design that combines all the decorations. You pick light fabrics with more modern textures in smooth and semi-smooth designs. And always in neutral and light colors: beiges, whites, taupes, grays, etc...." he says. His dream is to expand his sewing shop, purchase more machines and hire workers to increase his production. He wants to purchase materials to make curtains such as fabric, blinds, rails, and others, in bulk, to have work material and produce constantly. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 8 years that he has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Marcelo asks for a loan to purchase working material to make curtains, blinds and cushions for interior decoration.

loans.use: to purchase work materials to make curtains, blinds and cushions for interior decorating.

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es:
EL SR. NORLAN DE  TREINTA Y DOS ANOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, DE TRES Y SEIS AÑOS ES ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA,  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDO ESTUDIAR POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS, DEDICÁNDOSE A SU NEGOCIO POR HERENCIA DE FAMILIA, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA SACAR ADELANTE EL NEGOCIO CRECER EN EL MERCADO, MANTENER SU CLIENTE Y SOBRE TODOS PODER BRINDARLE LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, EMOCIONAL, A SU FAMILIA.
GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA ELABORACIÓN DE ESTRUCTURAS METÁLICAS,  EL NEGOCIO LO DESEMPEÑA DESDE HACE CATORCE AÑOS, Y LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE, EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE EQUIPO DE TRABAJO PARA TENER MAS CLIENTES Y REALIZAR TRABAJOS MAS GRANDE POR CONTRATOS.  SUS SUEÑOS Y SUS METAS ES SEGUIR MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE ESTA FORMA BRINDARLE ESTABILIDAD A SU FAMILIA. NORLAN AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Norlan is 32 years old and is married with two younger children, aged three and seven. He is originally from Managua. He characterizes himself as hard-working, responsible, and dedicated to becoming successful. Unfortunately he was not able to go to school because he lacks the financial resources, instead devoting himself to his business for the future of his family. Currently he is fighting to move his business forward and grow within the marketplace by maintaining his client base and above all bring financial and emotional stability to his family.

Thanks to his drive and desire to get ahead he's found work in fabricating metal structures. He's been in this line of work since he was 14, selling out of his home and door-to-door. To object of this loan is to invest in the purchase of equipment for his work so that he might obtain more customers and achieve larger contracted jobs. His dreams and goals are to continue improving his house and provide stability for his family. Norlan would like to thank Kiva for the help that these investments bring to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may achieve a dignified means of life.

loans.use: for the purchase of metal working equipment.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 54-year-old widowed woman with five grand children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She grows and buys cocoa. She is the bread earner of the family and strives to meet the basic needs of the family.  Her challenge is unpredictable weather conditions.

She wants a loan to buy more cocoa to resell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul, 52 years old, is married and has 6 children aged between 5 and 28, all attending school. Jean Paul is a farmer who has been farming for 20 years. He would like to use the loan from Kiva to buy more fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow maize to sell

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Shitu and Magaji.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Hannatu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to purchase storage for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Zakariya Bala

texts.en:
Zakariya Bala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Zakariya Bala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Sule, Obadiah and Leatu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakariya Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakariya Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Zakariya Bala  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Rhoda Habila

texts.en:
Rhoda Habila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rhoda Habila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Happy, Amos and Samaila.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rhoda Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rhoda Habila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rhoda Habila  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to purchase storage for her crops.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion lives in San Martin, Puebla. She is a single mother with two kids and works managing her own gift store. As a single mother Concepcion has overcomed a number of hardships, so she knows that through hard work she will have a lot of opportunities. Concepcion has been building his house step by step,. She now needs to complete the roof. She has a small amount saved but is asking for a loan to complete the amount needed to buy the materials. Concepcion has no access to credit from other institutions or organizations given the informality of her job. Concepcion will receive technical training and supervision to ensure that the construction complies with all quality and safety measures. Concepcion is looking forward to adding a roof to the home she has been building for the last years so that she and her children can soon move in to their own house and have their own space.

loans.use: buy materials to build a roof

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comales de barro desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en el mercado municipal, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de barro arenoso por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 48 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her two children. She has made and sold clay griddles for several years. She sells her products in the municipal market. She is asking for a loan in order to buy wholesale sandy clay in order to continue with her work and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sandy clay

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more desks and computers for the business

loans.name: Mare

texts.en:
Mare is a 58-year-old married villager who has been practicing agriculture for 20 years. Before the collapse of the previous regime, all people who worked in the agriculture sector were part of the government system, thus, once they reached the retirement age, they received a fixed retirement pension. However, after the collapse this changed altogether; for all those people in the rural areas who don’t claim income, they are not entitled to any retirement pension. Thus, the majority of them have retired  but with no income, because they did not meet the coverage  payments.
 
Mare is a married woman with three children who wants to pay for the pension coverage.

loans.use: to pay for the retirement pension coverage of 20 previous years.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Graciano

texts.en:
Graciano lives in the rural area of Nyakabingo. He is a 4-year-old married man with seven children and nine dependents. The dependents are his brother's children, who died in a motor accident. 

He is a farmer and  sells agricultural products. He requested 1,000,000 UGX to  buy  manure and fertilizers for his coffee plantation in order to increase yield.  His major problem is raising enough money for tuition to educate the children and dependents. 

Fertilizers bought using the loan will help him increase yield on his coffee plantation and therefore increase sales and profit.  He will then have enough money to raise tuition for his children. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy  manure.

loans.name: Diadone

texts.en:
Diadone is a 40-year-old married with five children living in Kasese Uganda.

Diadone has sold new clothes for two years and earns additional income from teaching. 

Diadone wishes to buy land and build a house. Diadone is faced with a challenge of low and delayed salary payment and seasonal customers. Diadone wants money to buy land for his home.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal is 49 years old and has three school-aged children who are 17, 15 and 13 years old. 

For the past almost eleven years, he hasn’t paid the monthly pension retirement  contribution.  He requests 150,000 ALL  from Kiva lenders is for this purpose. The sooner he pays this coverage, the better it is because he won’t face a  penalty. 

Pal has been operating his little village store  for some time and has 90 beehives. He sells to processing factories roughly 900 kg of raw honey a year, between the months of June and October.

loans.use: to pay the monthly retirement coverage contribution.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is a 37-year-old married man with a 3 and 6 year old.  Both children attend school. He has farmed for 10 years and will use the loan to buy  fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alhaji Danjuma

texts.en: Alhaji Danjuma is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alhaji Danjuma, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Isiyaku expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Markus is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children Rufus, Yakubu and Yusuf are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer from Makada village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Dantine

texts.en: Dantine is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dantine would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dantine can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Dantine is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Veronica is a 20 year old seamstress that lives with their parents She is a hardworking person that makes "polleras" (the andean or typical skirts and mini skirtsof bolivian native woman) and she is working for a lady that requires constantly her services to make customs for traditional celebrations Veronica learned her work thanks to her mother lessons many years ago Veronica is the oldest of five children at her house and she needs a loan to buy more fabrics to make more "polleras" Veronica has to help in her home so she will apreciate a lot the help from kiva
texts.en:
Veronica is a 20-year-old hardworking seamstress who lives with her parents.  She makes "polleras"  which are the typical skirts and mini skirts of Bolivian native women.  She  works for a lady who requires her services to make costumes for traditional celebrations.

 Veronica learned her work thanks to her mother's lessons many years ago. Veronica is the oldest of five children and she needs a loan to buy  fabric to make more "polleras".

Veronica has to help at home and appreciates  Kiva's help.

loans.use: to buy  fabric to make more "polleras".

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un escritorio para su agencia de viajes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member still works in her travel agency.  She wants to make progress through her business.  She's an enterprising and determined woman.  Her dream is to expand her travel agency.

She's requesting the loan to buy a desk for her travel agency.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a desk for her travel agency

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 32 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad. Ella siempre ha salido adelante con su propio esfuerzo, por lo que actualmente se apoya en su venta de tortillas para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. En el cantón de Norma se llevará a cabo un proyecto de instalación de energía eléctrica por lo que ella desea aprovechar para realizar dicha instalación en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomacorriente, derecho de instalación, caja térmica, alambre, etc. Para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home along with her children, aged 7 and 4. She has always been able to get ahead with her own effort. For this reason, she currently supports herself by selling tortillas in order to bring the daily sustenance to her home. 

In Norma’s settlement, an electricity installation project will be carried out. For this reason, she wishes to take advantage of this opportunity to complete this installation in her home. To do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in a power outlet, installation fees, a circuit breaker box, wire, etc. to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to invest in a power outlet, installation fees, a circuit breaker box, wire, etc. to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Priscila Patricia

texts.es: Priscila tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos viven en Ventanas provincia de los Rios, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para poder sembrar y mejorar en la produccion, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para aumentar los sembrios y tener ganancias para solventar a su familia  en su tiempo libre le gusta ver la TV.
texts.en: Priscila is 37 years old, is married, has four children, and they live in Ventanas, in Los Rios province. She asks for the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to plant and improve her production. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land to increase her crop and have earnings to pay off the family debts. In her free time, she likes to watch TV.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que todos los días sale a recorrer las calles de su municipio y los aledaños para ofrecer la variedad de plantas ornamentales que vende para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Margarita desea instalar balcones en las ventanas de su vivienda, además desea colocar duralita en el techo de su vivienda ya que el actual se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: balcones, duralita, polines y pines para instalar los balcones y colocar duralita en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Margarita, 32 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and her two children, ages 12 and 10. She is a tenacious woman who goes out every day through the streets of her town and the surrounding area, offering a variety of decorative plants that she sells to support her household.

Margarita wants to install bars on the windows of her home. Additionally, she wants to put Duralita sheeting on the roof of the house, because the current roof has deteriorated. Therefore, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: window bars, Duralita, poles, and fasteners to install the balconies and Duralita roofing on her home.

loans.use: to buy bars, Duralita sheeting, poles, and fasteners to install window bars and new roofing on her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es: Una mujer luchadora es lo que define a Maria Simona, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de perfumes, ropa y zapatos junto a su esposo y su hija han logrado salir adelante. Siempre con el entusiasmo que la define solicita un nuevo crédito para incrementar su inventario, necesita comprar perfumes, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. De esta manera podrá obtener mejores ganancias y seguir incrementando el negocio.
texts.en: A determined woman is how to describe Maria Simona. She has a small business selling perfumes, clothing and shoes with her husband and their daughter; they have managed to get ahead. Always with the enthusiasm that defines her, she asks for a new loan to increase her inventory. She needs to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, clothing and shoes. In this way, she will be able to have more earnings and continue expanding the business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Antonia Graciela

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 42 años tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad es madre soltera vive en Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.


Ella se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas y para el alquiler del terreno ya que no cuenta con uno propia, gracias al credito podra mejorar las siembras y obtener mayor rendimiento, su sueño es comprarse una casa, y en su tiempo libre le gusta leer.
texts.en:
Antonia is 42 years old, has a 7-year-old child, is a single mother, and lives in Ventanas, in Los Rios province.

She works in agriculture and asks for the loan to purchase agricultural supplies and to rent the plot of land since she doesn't have her own. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her plantings and get a better result. Her dream is to buy a house, and in her free time, she likes to read.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lluvia está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, que luchan por el bienestar de su familia, la coordinadora es Lorena de 41 años, soltera, y se dedica a palmear y vender tortillas  y frijoles en su domicilio desde hace doce años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, sacos de frijoles, carbón, leña, utensilios de cocina como trastes, limpiones, etc. Con los financiamientos anteriores ha logrado mantener y aumentar las ventas satisfaciendo la demanda en su localidad. La segunda socia es la señora Zoyla de 42 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de ropa y la tercera socia es Flor de 45 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de hielo, helados y pan.
texts.en: Lluvia (Rain) is a loan group composed of three hardworking women who strive every day for their families’ wellbeing. Lorena is their coordinator: she is 41, she is single and she engages in preparing and selling tortillas and beans in her house. She has been engaging in this activity for two years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy corn, bags of beans, coal, firewood, and kitchen tools such as dishes and cleaning cloths. Thanks to her previous loan, she has succeeded in carrying on and increasing her activity, meeting the requests of her community. The second member is Zoyla, aged 42, who engages in selling clothes, and the third member is Flor, aged 45, who engages in selling ice, ice cream and bread.

loans.use: To buy corn, bags of beans, coal, firewood, and kitchen tools such as dishes and cleaning cloths.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is 58 years old, has 3 children and lives in Gwitembe A village in Kuria East, Kenya. Gwitembe A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Gichingani spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Esther and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Esther works as a commercial farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Esther and 2 other promoters in her community, Rael and Rebecca, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Esther will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Esther wants to be a promoter because she believes that chlorine kills germs in water and makes it safer for drinking.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Esther’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water her community

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose has 3 children, is 30 years old and lives in Migingo village Kuria East, Kenya. Rose works as a health practitioner for a living. Where Rose lives, her community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their drinking water from a local water spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Migingo community had a way to treat their drinking water, there could be fewer cases of water-borne diseases, keeping Migingo community at school and work.

This is why Rose is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of her community. Rose was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people of her community on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Rose wants to be a promoter because she envisions a community free from water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rose’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof in Osogo village in Ndhiwa, Kenya with his family which includes 10 children. The community of Osogo village collects their drinking water from Ngarabach borehole  because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Osogo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Osogo, 28 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Peter has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 4 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Rose, Lilian, Hellen and Clarkson.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Peter’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water his community

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Robert lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor and an iron roof in Nyaigutu B village in Kuria East, Kenya with his family which includes 3 children. The community of Nyaigutu B village collects their drinking water from a local well because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases often making Nyaigutu B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser program offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. Robert has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 2 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Christine and Joseph. 

Nyaigutu B community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Robert believes that the dispenser will it will help reduce water-borne diseases and make people be safe in his community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Robert’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino: Es un maestro miskito que trabaja en una escuela rural en el municipio de Waspam Río Coco, es casado, tiene 7 hijos: Tres son mayores de edad y 4 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Desde  hace 30 años habitan en una casa construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para cambiar la madera de la pared y los postes de madera, y comprar también clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. El y su esposa sueñan con tener en un futuro una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Rufino is a Miskito teacher in a rural school in the town of Waspam Río Coco.  He is married and has seven children.  Three are older and four are teenagers who are in secondary school.  For 30 years they have lived in a house made of wood and tambo, which currently needs repair.

That is why they are requesting a loan to change the wood of the walls and the wooden post, and also to buy nails and to cover the costs of labor.

He and is wife dream of having a future house made of concrete that would have better conditions for their children and especially better security.

loans.use: To change the wood of the walls and the wooden posts, and also to buy nails and to cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, has 7 children, and lives in Ogwenyore B village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Joseph works as a business owner for a living. His community of Ogwenyore B village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Joseph is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected promoter by his village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer promoter, Joseph represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community and how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser. Joseph and 3 other promoters in his community, George, Patricia, and Geafrey need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Joseph wants to be a promoter because he  believes that the chlorine will prevent water borne diseases making his communty healthy, especially for children under 5 years of age.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joseph’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina has 5 children, is 36 years old and lives in Bokerankomo village, Kenya. Regina works as a subsistence farmer for a living. The community of Bokerankomo village does not have access to clean and safe drinking water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases like cholera and typhoid. Regina is a friendly member of the community and has been elected promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer promoter, Regina represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser. Regina and 3 other promoters in her community, including Samuel, James, and Daniel need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Regina wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine is a good preventive measure against water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Regina’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma: Es originaria de Waspam; es una señora amable y emprendedora, tiene 55 años de edad, casada con 10 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace dos años estableció en su vivienda de madera una pequeña pulpería, con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, huevos, detergentes, gaseosas, sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es llegar a  tener un negocio prospero que le permita tener mejores ingresos y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Vilma, originally from Waspam, is a friendly and enterprising woman.  She is 55 years old and married with 10 children who are older and independent.  Two years ago she established in her wooden house a small general store, with the objective of having her own source of income and to support the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, detergents, soft drinks, instant soups, among other products.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business that allows her to have better income and thus be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, detergents, soft drinks, instant soups, among other products.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a conservative woman who asked her daughter, Samah, to appear in the photo in her place. Khadija is a 45-year-old mother of four children. Her oldest has graduated from university, majoring in Civil Engineering, and the remaining three are still university students. Khadija has managed to pay for two of her children from her retirement salary but had to apply for this loan to cover university fees for her daughter, Samah, who is majoring in business administration.

loans.use: to cover university fees for her daughter Samah, who is majoring in business administration.

loans.name: Mürvet

texts.en:
Mürüvet is a married woman with two children. She works in a company's kitchen and earns extra income selling Tupperware and Ersağ cleaning products. She sells to her friends at work. 

She will use this second load to buy products to sell. Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Yakubu Aikau

texts.en: Yakubu Aikau is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yakubu Aikau joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Chris, Samaila and Dauda.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu Aikau would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu Aikau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yakubu Aikau  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer from kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Isiyaku, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Rhoda Ephraim

texts.en:
Rhoda Ephraim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rhoda Ephraim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Kazabiran and Shayet.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rhoda Ephraim would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rhoda Ephraim can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rhoda Ephraim  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to purchase storage for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine he needs in his aluminum workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, polo shirts, leather jackets and blouses.

loans.name: Nely De Los Angeles

texts.es: Nely de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando con su apoyo. Ella desde hace 20 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra cosechando productos como: güisquil, rábano, perejil, cilantro y berro, productos que luego vende en el mercado central, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Nely siente que su vivienda es muy pequeña por lo que desea construir un cuarto que le permita vivir más cómodamente a toda su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nely, who is 42 years old, lives in a residence of her own together with her husband and two children ages 19 and 16 who are currently studying with their support.  For 20 years, she's earned her living farming the land, harvesting products such as pear squash, radishes, parsley, cilantro and watercress, products which she later sells in the central marketplace.  This business has allowed her to get her family ahead.  

Nely feels that her residence is very small, and wants to build a room that would allow her whole family to live more comfortably.  To this end, she's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room in her residence.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room in her residence

loans.name: Lovely Joy

texts.en:
Lovely Joy  has earned a living  selling fresh fish  to her community for 2 years.. She is 33 years old and has four children. Her oldest child is 11 and the youngest is 9 month old.   She lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol.

Lovely Joy  requests 3,000 PHP to  buy  fresh fish and ice.  These supplies will  help her family, sell more fresh fish, and increase her income. She wants to provide her children with a nutritious diet and continue to send them to school.

Lovely Joy  wants to improve her current business.  She wants to be successful and  start of her new  journey and make progress in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and ice.

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS GERANIOS” está conformada por 05 mujeres dedicadas al comercio minoristas. Corina tiene 41 años de edad es casada. Ella se dedica a la venta de de productos de belleza hace 10 años. A ella le gustaría obtener un exhibidor donde pueda mostrar todos sus productos. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de más productos de belleza por campaña navideña perfumes para damas y caballeros joyas en fantasía fina. De esta manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Corina viste polo a rayas de color celeste y blanco.
texts.en: The “LOS GERANIOS” group is made up of 5 women who work in small businesses. Corina is 41 years old and is married. She has worked selling beauty products for the past 10 years. She would like to get a display case where she can show all her products. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products for the Christmas season, such as perfumes for women and men and fancy costume jewelry. In this way, she can support her husband with the household expenses. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Corina is dressed in a white and light blue striped shirt.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty supplies.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernan is 59 years old and he is the father of 4 All his offspring are independent Hernan is working as a taxi driver since 5 years ago he works 8 hours a day Hernan requires a loan to repair his car that needs a new engine an spare parts Hernan is thinking about security above all so he needs a car in excellent conditions Besides, Hernan has to work hard because he needs to save money for his retirement
texts.en:
Hernan is 59 years old and he is the father of four.  All of his offspring are independent. Hernan has been working as a taxi driver for five years, and he works eight hours a day.

Hernan requires a loan to repair his car, which needs a new engine and spare parts. Hernan is thinking about security above all, so he needs a car in excellent condition. Besides, Hernan has to work hard because he needs to save money for his retirement.

loans.use: to repair his car that needs a new engine and spare parts

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: Froilán tiene la edad  de 49 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y una hija que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de manguera y utensilios para poner un sistema de riego a una plantación que esta iniciando y además comprar fertilizantes, fungicidas para  aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Froilán, 49, is married and lives with his wife and a daughter, who are his main priority.

With his loan he plans to buy a hose and tools to put in an irrigation system on a farm he's starting.  He also wants to buy fertilizer and fungicide to make the most of the good fertility of the soil and the climate conditions.  With these improvements to his crop he hopes to earn a little more profit so he can improve his family's living conditions.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn't had any previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a hose and tools for an irrigation system

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.en:
Bobojon is a handsome man. He was born in 1995. He lives in a rural area with his family. Bobojon is married, and both he and his wife are students. 

Bobojon is a goal oriented man. He helps his parents at home. He studies at university, and is an educated and responsive person. His attendance is good at the university. 

Bobojon tries to make his day better then yesterday. He is the best student in class, and teachers are recognizing him as the best student. Bobojon has to pay the university tuition, but he does not have enough money. He is in need of financial support to pay the university tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia de 34 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella vive con un familiar, en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras , se dedica desde hace 07 años  al negocio de venta de pan de todas las clases.
Doña Lesbia sus clientes le prefieren por su amabilidad y buenos precios en sus productos, su clientela son los empleados de la empresa de camarón todos los días viaja en taxi para poder vender el pan a la hora de salida de los empleados.
Doña lesbia es una mujer emprendedora que está luchando por tener un buen negocio, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de harina, maíz, leña, huevos, manteca, etc. Para elaborar su producto espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo pueda salir adelante y aumentar más su patrimonio.
 Su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Lesbia, 34 years old, is single and does not have children that depend on her.  She lives with a family member in the San Lorenzo community in the south of Honduras.  For seven years she has been working in the business of selling all kinds of breads.

Doña Lesia's customers prefer her for her kindness and good prices on her products.  Her clientele are employed in the shrimp business.  Every day she travels by taxi to be able to sell the bread at the leaving time of the employees.

Doña Lesbia is an enterprising woman who is striving to have a better business.  She is requesting the loan to buy flour, corn, firewood, eggs, butter, etc.  to make her products.  She hopes that with the support of this loan, she can get ahead and further increase her assets.

Her dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December of 2014

loans.use: To buy flour, corn, firewood, eggs, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, clothing, cosmetics, and more.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es: Doña Hilda comenzó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad, a los 17 años inicio con un pequeño negocio de quesera, es una mujer con deseos de salir adelante actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y pulpería por las noches vende comida. Tiene tres hijos que aun están a su cargo porque asisten a la escuela ellos siempre la han apoyado en su negocio. Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa en general, zapatos y chinelas. Confía que el crédito le ayudara a tener mayor inventario y de esa manera aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos. Dentro de sus metas próximas está ampliar su casa y apoyar a su hija para que termine sus estudios.
texts.en: Hilda began to work at a very young age. At age 17, she began with a small cheese business. She is a woman with desires to get ahead and currently works selling clothing and has a grocery store where she sells food in the evenings. She has three children who are still in her care since they go to school. They always have helped her in her business. She asks for a loan to purchase general clothing, shoes, and slippers. She is confident that this loan will help her to have a better inventory and, in this way, increase her sales, and get more income. Among her next goals are to expand her house and support her daughter so that she can finish her schooling.

loans.use: to purchase general clothing, shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina, in search of a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, decided to start farming. According to her, farming will give her everything she has always dreamed of. Selina is a smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. She owns a one-acre farm where she practices mixed farming. On the farm she keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. 

Selina is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. 

Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations, such as Juhudi Kilimo, support farmers like Selina. Through a group of 10 members called Kaimuge self-help group, Selina has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. 

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholder farmers, both unskilled and semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Selina, because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

Support Selina so that she can continue with her farm work.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Angel Leonel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 45 años de edad vive con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.
Solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para sembrar maiz y poder mejorar las siembras gracias al credito va a comprar lo necesario para sembrar, su sueño es comprarse un carro ya que le hace falta para salir a vender el producto, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es que caiga alguna enfermedad en las siembras. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel is 45 years old and lives with his children in Ventanas in Los Rios province.

He asks for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn and to be able to improve his crops. Thanks to the loan, he will purchase what he needs for planting. His dream is to buy a car since he doesn't have one to go out and sell his products. The challenge he confronts is that a disease might infest his crop. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies such as cement and bricks to build an extra room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies such as cement and bricks to build an extra room.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
In Rabuor Kitanda village in Ndhiwa, Kenya, Lilian has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Lilian is a friendly member of the community with 2 children. Lilian lives with her family in a house made of concrete walls, a concrete floor, and an iron roof.

Rabuor Kitanda village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a communal spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Lilian’s family and the 13 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area.  

Lilian has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Lilian volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community reducing the number of cases of diarrhea. There are also 4 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: John, Kennedy, Jane, and Consolata.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Lilian's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide her community with free access to chlorine to treat drinking water

loans.name: Damaris' Group

texts.en:
In Omweny B village in Ndhiwa, Kenya, Damaris has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Damaris is a  member of the community with 4 children. Damaris lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Omweny B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Komoro well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Damaris’s family and the 20 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Damaris has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Damaris volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community to fight water-borne diseases. There are also 2 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Benson and Maren.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Damaris’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide her community with access to safe water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Wikomimo village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Charles works as a peasant farmer for a living. Where Charles lives, his family and his community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from Wikomimo water pump. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Wikomimo had a way to treat their water, they could improve the health of their community, keeping children at school and parents at work.

This is why Charles is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of his community. Charles was elected to represent his community as a volunteer promoter. He is not only representing his community on Kiva, but also volunteers his time to educate the people in Wikomimo village on the importance of safe water, and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at Wikomino water pump. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Charles wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Charles’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide his community with access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Ezekie's Group

texts.en:
Ezekie is 60 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Kagenja village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Ezekie works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Where Ezekie lives, his family and his community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from Ka-Chaulo borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Kagenja had a way to treat their water, they could improve the health of their community, keeping children at school and parents at work.

This is why Ezekie and 3 other promoters in his community, namely Noel, Dorothy, and Benard are requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of their community. Ezekie was elected to represent his community as a volunteer promoter. He is not only representing his community on Kiva, but also volunteers his time to educate the people in Kagenja village on the importance of safe water, and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at Ka-Chaulo borehole. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Ezekie wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser will help reduce diarrhea cases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink.
