Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Ezekie’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve his community's health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Norah's Group

texts.en:
Norah is 52 years old, has 7 children, and lives in Got Adundo A village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Got Adundo A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Nyandira well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Norah and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Norah works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Norah and 3 other promoters in her community,  Florence, Michael, and Lavin need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Norah will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Norah wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will kill bacteria and prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Norah’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide her community with safe water by accessing chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home, which is made of wood and stilts.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama 8 de diciembre está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien en su última encuesta de eliminación mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en un nivel medio. La Señora es docente, pero también se dedica a la venta de elementos de limpieza, y a través de esto tiene los medios para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de limpieza para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group is called 8 de Diciembre and is in season number 3 with the women's committee's program. They are doing a poverty elimination survey that will enable them to better understand the living standards of each person, and work on improving them accordingly. One of the members is Sonia, who demonstrated level two poverty in her last poverty elimination survey, which means that she's in the middle range. She is a teacher, but she also works selling cleaning supplies, and through this she acquires the means to support her family. She's requesting this loan to be able to purchase cleaning supplies to sell, so that she continue with her sales just the way she's been doing.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning supplies to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es un hombre de 31 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que ha instalado un pequeño taller de reparación de teléfonos celulares en su vivienda desde hace 5 años, en el cual también vende aparatos electrónicos y sus accesorios. Él es soltero y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos desde hace 6 años. Miguel desea surtir su negocio ya que cada día salen nuevos productos y el desea ofrecer a sus clientes la mejor tecnología que pueda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: accesorios, repuestos y teléfonos celulares para surtir su negocio y ofrecer la mejor variedad a su clientela  y lo último en tecnología.
texts.en:
Miguel, 31, is an enterprising man who set up a small telephone-repair shop in his home five years ago.  He also sells electronic appliances and accessories.  He's single and has lived in his own home with his two children for six years.

Miguel wants to stock his business because new products come out every day and he wants to offer his customers the best technology he can.

He's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in accessories, parts, and mobile phones to stock his business and offer his customers the best selection of the latest in technology.

loans.use: to invest in accessories, parts, and mobile phones to stock his business

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 32-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She has four children and they are all attending school. 

Oliver deals in cocoa buying and selling when it is the season, but her main business is a retail shop. She has improved her business since she got the former loan which she paid off well. Oliver is hard working and loves her business. She is affected by seasonal factors and competition. Oliver wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with seven children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She deals in the tailoring of clothes and she earns money from this business. She is very hardworking and this is why her business is growing steadily. 

She has a cocoa garden as another source of income. She hopes to build a permanent house though she is faced with high competition. Grace wants a loan to buy cloth material for sewing.

loans.use: to buy cloth material for sewing.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La'azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azarus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Gidiyan, Nashemiya and Saloman.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, La'azarus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nura would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nura can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Nura is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Gambo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Rifkatu, Asabe and Danjuma.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Gambo spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis es un señor  preocupado por el bienestar de su familia, es casado, con tres hijo , y con uno a su cargo, labora en un centro de salud de la zona donde habita, desempeñándose en el área de epidemiologia con 28 años de laborar para dicho ministerio de salud.
Actualmente este señor visito la oficina ceprodel para solicitar el credoto numero seis , ya que tiene la necesidad de repellar las paredes de su vivienda , dicho financiamiento lo  invertiria en la compra de materiales de contrucion  tales cemento, arena,piedrin,bloques y pago de mano obra  los cuales los utilizaria para repellar su casa y hacer una division a un cuarto y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida en su seno familiar
texts.en:
Luis is a man concerned for his family's well-being. He is married, has three children, and one of them is in his care. He works in a health center in the zone where he lives, working in the area of epidemiology with 28 years of working for the ministry of health. 

Currently, this man visited Ceprodel's offices to ask for his loan number six, since he has the need to replaster the walls of his house. This loan would be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, concrete blocks, and pay labor costs which he will use to replaster his hosue and divide a room and in this way improve his conditions and level of living in his family home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, concrete blocks and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación que tiene el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en La Paz, Wilfredo trabaja desde hace más de 10 años como chofer asalariado y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos. Wilfredo recientemente ha sufrido un choque y es reponsable de la movilidad, si no hace que la reparen el propietario del vehiculo le entregará a otro la movilidad y wilfredo puede perder su trabajo, por eso necesita un credito. Wilfredo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda.
texts.en: Wilfredo is single and has a child who is school age. He lives in his mother's home and occupies a single room with a dirt floor. The house is located in La Paz. Wilfredo has been working for 10 years as a salaried driver and with his income he has to pay for food, schooling, and utilities. Wilfredo experienced a car collision recently and he's responsible for the vehicle. If he doesn't get it repaired the vehicle's owner will give it to somebody else and Wilfredo might lose his job, that's why he needs a loan. Wilfredo is the only source of income in his household so he needs your help.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Javier Humberto

texts.es:
Javier, de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, la situación económica de sus padres no le permitieron seguir estudiando, está casado, su esposa se dedica al cuido de la casa.- Javier, es padre de cinco hijos, de los cuales solo dos depende de el, uno de ellos esta estudiando 5ª grado, el otro ya trabaja.

Javier, vende medicina desde hace 12 años, este negocio lo aprendió de un amigo, de esta manera Javier, lleva el sustento para su familia.- 

Javier, vender medicinas en cantones serca de donde el vive, el recorrido lo hace en motocicleta y lo realiza de 5:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.

Javier, invertirá el crédito para comprar más productos como vitaminas, antialérgicos, pastillas anti estrés, entre otros productos.- Esto ayudará a poder ofrecer distintas clases de medicina a sus clientes con diferentes problemas de salud y tambien, tener más ganancias en su negocio.

Javier, sueña con aprender más acerca de la medicina y poner una farmacia en la comunidad en donde vive, para poder ayudar a más personas de su cantón y otros cantones inmediatos.
texts.en:
Javier is 43 years old, he studied through the fifth grade as his parents’ economic situation did not allow him to keep on studying. He is married, and his wife is a housewife. Javier has five children, but only two of them depend economically on him: one is attending the fifth grade and the other goes to work.
Javier has been selling medicines for 12 years, an activity he has learned from a friend, and this is how Javier provides for his family.
Javier sells medicines in the cantons close to where he lives, reaching them by motorbike, and working from 5 am to 6 pm.
Javier will invest the loan in the purchase of more products such as vitamins, antihistamine medications, anti-stress pills among other products. This will help him offering different kinds of medicines to his customers who suffer from different health problems, as well as to increase the earnings of his activity.
Javier dreams of learning more about medicine, and of setting up a pharmacy in the community where he lives, in order to help more people both in his canton and in other cantons nearby.

loans.use: To buy vitamins, antihistamine medications, anti-stress pills.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abubakar joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sagiru, Suleiman and Aminu.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Abubakar spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana de 26 años de edad vive al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 7 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos para poder apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Ana siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos, es por ello que hace poco tiempo termino de construir su vivienda, la que por falta de liquidez económica ha construido con el apoyo de su compañero de vida poco a poco, pero no han logrado instalar balcones y puertas, por lo que sienten no cuenta con la seguridad necesaria para habitar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas y balcones para instalar en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 26, lives in her own home with her life partner and her child, 7.  She's a hardworking woman who offers housekeeping services to help her companion with the household expenses.

Ana's always looking for ways to improve the quality of life of her loved ones.  Recently she finished building her home, which she built with the help of her companion little by little because she lacked financial liquidity.  They haven't been able to install window bars and doors, though, and they feel they're lacking the security they need to live there.

She's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in doors and window bars to install in her home.

loans.use: to install doors and window bars in her home

loans.name: Benezeri

texts.en:
Benezeri is a fifty-one-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise. He is a hardworking man who loves his business and has been in this business for six years. He also has coffee and cocoa gardens to supplement his income from the business.

He is affected by limited capital but hopes to construct a residential house. He wants a loan to buy merchandise to sell, like cooking oil, soap and others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop, like cooking oil, soap and others.

loans.name: Lado

texts.en:
Lado is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Lado joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: John, Haruna and Cecillia.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Lado spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” está conformada por socios dedicados a prestar servicios y al comercio minoristas. Juana tiene 54 años de edad es casada con hijos independientes. Ella dedica a la venta de bebidas gelatinas chupetes y golosinas en su quiosco. Y a la vez presta servicios de lavado de carro. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más bebidas gelatina y golosinas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Juana es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” group is made up of members who work providing services and in small businesses. Juana is 54 years old, married, and with independent children. She works selling drinks, jellies, lollipops, and snacks in her kiosk. She also offers car wash services. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more drinks, jellies, and snacks. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Juana is the first person sitting on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Aminu is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rebecca joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Jeonipah and Precious.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rebecca would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rebecca can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rebecca spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 40 años de edad tiene 5 hijos y es madre soltera vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.
ella solicita el credito para comprar de materiales para el salon de belleza como planchas para cabello, secadaro, esmaltes, y para arreglar el local. gracias al credito podra mejorar  su salon y dar una buena atencion a sus clientes, y aumentar su ganancias asi poder cumplir con las metas propuestas. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer bailo terapia.
texts.en:
Mirian is 40 years old, has 5 children, and is a single mother. She lives in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. 

She asks for the loan to purchase materials for the beauty salon such as flat irons, dryers, nail polish, and to do some repairs to the space.

Thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her salon, provide good customer service, and increase her earnings. And, in turn, she will be able to achieve her proposed goals.

In her free time, she likes to do dance therapy.and

loans.use: to purchase some materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Gunda village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido lives with several generations of his family on his farm, where he raises cows, works on a large field to produce forage to feed them, and produces cheese. His main motivation when he decided to invest in a large Sistema Biobolsa biodigester was to reduce his operating costs, as he used to purchase large quantities of expensive fossil fuel-based LP gas to supply his home and farm. 

From now on, he will be able to use his cows' manure as a resource to produce his own renewable energy: biogas. Further, the biodigester also transforms manure into a nutrient-rich and potent fertilizer, which nourishes the soils and will increase the yield of Candido's field in a natural way, without adding any chemicals. Candido's farm will become more sustainable as contamination will be avoided, and he will also save money. With his savings, he plans to buy more cows and expand his cheese production capacity to diversify his income sources.

This loan represents 30% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Facundo

texts.en:
Facundo is a small Mexican farmer; he owns a few cows and a plot of land where he cultivates corn and oats for his family's own consumption. His main source of income is the sale of milk, and he was looking for a way to reduce the operating costs on his farm when he found out about Sistema Biobolsa. He was very enthusiastic about the idea of turning his animals' manure into a resource to produce his own renewable energy and supply his home with biogas to cook and heat water, therefore displacing the expensive LP gas, as well as the wood his wife used to cook, through which she inhaled the toxic smoke on a daily basis. The bacteria inside the biodigester also transform the manure into a potent organic fertilizer, which will allow Facundo to eliminate chemical fertilizers and increase the yield of his field in a natural way with this nutrient-rich product. 

Facundo decided to invest in Sistema Biobolsa to increase his farm's productivity, while improving his wife's health and protecting the environment by treating his animals waste and eliminating external fossil fuel-based inputs on his farm.

This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Kigija Tukorere Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Edith is married and has three children. 

She has devoted her life to supporting her brother, and took the responsibility for her nephew's education. Her nephew obtained this year his title of Teacher of Primary Education.

Edith has had three years of receiving loans from UGAFODE; most of them have been invested in her agriculture to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, improved seeds, and tools. 

This year she will use her credit to buy organic fertilizer.

Edith is the treasurer of her group, and urges all women to begin income generating activities to break the dependence on men. 

She is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando raises cows and hogs, and sells their meat for a living. He manages the whole production process until the sale, and was looking for opportunities to increase his production of beef meat. By purchasing his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will generate economic savings through the production of his own biogas, allowing him to displace expensive and fossil fuel based LP gas. In addition to the production of methane-rich biogas, the biodigester also transforms animal manure into organic fertilizer. 

Armando cultivates corn on a plot of land, for which he used to buy chemical fertilizers. From now on, he will spread the nutrient-rich biofertilizer on his field, saving money and increasing the crops' yield in a natural way. The cows' and pigs' waste will be treated and turned into a productive resource, strongly reducing greenhouse gas emissions and soil contamination. 

With the savings he will make, Armando will be able to buy more livestock and expand his production capacity, while protecting the environment. He is pictured here on the day his biodigester was installed.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 20 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Santalat

texts.ru: Санталат, 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Санталат высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она уже 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Санталат, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 1 корова и 30 овец. Санталат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади и овец для откорма и реализации, что поможет ей накопить средства на ремонт сарая для скота и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Santalat is 54 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 5 children. Santalat has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 10 years. Thanks to her persistence, drive and hard work, today her farm contains 1 cow and 30 sheep. Santalat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a horse and sheep for fattening up and resale, which will help her to save money in order to repair her livestock barn and buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy a horse and sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 27 лет, замужем, есть годовалый сын. Три года назад она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки двух овец, благодаря своему упорству и целеустремленности Айнура достигла хороших результатов, и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 1 корова, 10 овец. На арендованном участке мерою 1,20 Га она выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. На доходы от кредита Айнура планирует и дальше развивать свое хозяйство и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Ainura is 27 years old, married and has a one-year-old son. She got involved in animal husbandry and farming three years ago, starting this business with a purchase of two sheep. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Ainura achieved good results and today has 1 cow and 10 sheep on her farm. She grows barley for sale on 1.20 hectares of leased land. In order to increase her livestock headcount, Ainura requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep. Ainura plans to continue developing her business and building barns for the livestock using the earnings from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help the villagers purchase ducklings as well as high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a dairy farmer; he raises cows and sells their milk for a living. He also owns a few horses and cultivates corn and oat on a small plot of land close to his house. He used to buy tanks of LP gas and chemical fertilizers on a regular basis, which was significantly reducing his available income and unsustainable. 

By purchasing his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will proactively use his animals' manure as a resource to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer, thus becoming more self-sufficient and improving the carbon footprint on his farm. Indeed, Juan Manuel will not only save money, but also input the waste in the biodigester, avoiding greenhouse gas emissions and the contamination of underground watersheds. He will not depend on fossil fuel based external inputs, but close the natural cycle on his farm, transforming waste into a productive resource. 

With the savings he will make, Juan Manuel plans to expand his milk production capacity to start elaborating cheese, as well as buy more livestock.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Tha Meik Htaw Kone Tan Group 2

texts.en:
Located in Tha Meik Htaw Kone Tan Village in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, the community consists of 15 village customers and includes 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members leading the loans in this certain area.

This loan will help the villagers from Tha Meik Htaw Kone Tan Village Group 2 purchase ducks as well as good-quality feeds (a packet costs $30 and provides 6 days feed for 100 ducks). More eggs will enable them to increase their income.

Most of the villagers are farmers and farm twice in a year, in both the winter and the rainy season. Some villagers, as well, plant seasonal foods such as carrots, cucumbers and roselle, which they sell at the town market in the morning. They also raise hens and pigs as livestock.

The picture above shows the CBO committee members from this group, namely U Taw, U Aung, Daw Hte, U Than and U Sant.

Included in the picture is U Taw (first from right). He is 22 years old and is a student. He is now in his second year in Math, which he has taken via distance education. At other times, he works in the family business, with its 11 acres of crop farms, as well as takes care of 101 ducks and pigs. He lives together with 6 members of his family, the parents and his sister's family. With the loan, he will buy more ducks as well as good feeds for them.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feeds.

borrowers.first_name: Tha Meik Htaw Kone Tan Group 2

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 36 years old; she has owned a grocery store for the last 10 years, and describes herself as very responsible. She likes to honor her commitments, and being able to look people straight in the eye. She likes to run and also to read, but mostly she spends the day working at her store.

Beatriz is asking for a loan to buy groceries and restock her store. She says that, fortunately, her store is at a great location near a market and in the middle of a very crowd neighborhood. 

Her goal is to open a second store and keep growing her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 28-year-old single woman, and she lives with her parents in El Alto in a house that belongs to her family. Alejandra sells blouses and T-shirts; she is an itinerant saleswoman. She has been doing this since some years ago, and she has experience.

She needs a loan to buy more T-shirts and blouses to resell. Alejandra receives help from her parents, but she wants to be independent and to have a little store to sell the products she purchases.

She is healthy and will appreciate a lot the help from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more T-shirts and blouses to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's backpacks wholesale

loans.name: Jesus Genaro

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años y su negocio es la llantería.
Él es emprendedor, generoso, comprensivo, paciente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ un lugar céntrico, caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante el transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte a zonas alejadas del Alto, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura constante entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Jesus es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en la familia, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se encarga de cuidar a su bebe y también colabora en el negocio, y con su pequeño hijo que ya camina. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de adobe que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable, gas y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la llantería, él se encarga de cambiar las llantas a vehículos de todo tipo, como; automóviles, minibuses, micros, camiones, etc. También realiza el parchado de llantas pinchadas y aumento de aire, labor que realiza durante todos los días de la semana en su taller ubicado en su mismo domicilio. “empecé mi trabajo como ayudante de llantero, luego vino el nacimiento de mi hijo y me tuve que independizar…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su taller y realizar cambio de aceite. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una compresora de aire para inflar llantas, la que utiliza actualmente se encuentra dañada, eso le resta clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Jesus solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina compresora de aire para inflar llantas y continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 24-year-old man who lives with his partner and has one 2-year-old child. He has a tire repair business.

He is entrepreneurial, generous, understanding, patient, responsible, and hardworking. He carries out his work in an area called “cruce villa Adela,” which is a central location known for connecting various areas of the city through public transportation. From this location, one can get transportation to faraway areas of El Alto. The area has a cold, dry climate and a constant temperature between 4-12ºC (39-54ºF) all year. The area is at an altitude of 3800 meters above sea level.

Jesus has dark skin, short black hair, a short stature, a slender physique, and dark eyes. His native language is Aymará, which is what his family speaks, but for business he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his partner, who takes care of their baby and also helps with the business, and with his small child who already can walk. They live in a rented house that is made of adobe and has electricity, potable water, gas, and plumbing. He has a tire repair business. He changes the tires of all kinds of vehicles such as automobiles, minibuses, buses, trucks, etc. He also patches flat tires and puts air in tires. He carries out his work every day of the week in his workshop, which is located in his home.  

“I started my work as an assistant to a tire-repairman. Later, my son was born and I had to become independent…” he comments. His dream is to expand his workshop and do oil changes. He hopes to invest in his business by buying an air compressor to inflate tires. Since the one he uses is currently broken, he is losing customers. This is the first loan he requests from the institution in the 2 years that he has been working in this occupation independently. 

It is for these reasons that Jesus is requesting a loan to buy an air compression machine to inflate tires and continue his work.

loans.use: to buy an air compression machine to inflate tires and continue his work.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is originally from the Dominican Republic and has lived in the U.S. since 1999. He opened Ydalia’s Hair Design in 2006, with an experienced hairstylist as his partner. The salon offers the full range of hairstyle services, from coloring to extensions to keratin treatments. The business also offers retail products.

Sandy’s work supports himself and his three sons.

Given how hard the hair salon business is, Sandy is most proud of being in business for eight years. Sandy would like to finish renovating his salon and will use this loan to buy furniture. Sandy looks forward to helping his children through a stable, well-respected salon business.

loans.use: to finish renovating his salon

loans.name: Wilberfoce

texts.en:
Wilberfoce lives in Hoima Uganda. He is 50 years old and a hardworking married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children, all of whom attend school. 

He runs a depot selling mainly sodas and beers. This is supplemented by income from rentals. He desires to expand and develop his business as well as educate his children; however, inadequate capital hinders the achievement of his desires. 

He will use the loan facility to buy more crates of beer to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday, a primary teacher in Bundibugyo, Uganda, is a 25-year-old single man with two children. He has served for two years now, and he still loves his job. He joined this profession because he had love for teaching children. He hopes to study and get a bachelor's degree. 

He is currently pursuing a diploma in education and wants a loan to pay school fees for his studies.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Jioconda Esperanza

texts.es:
Jioconda es una señora muy esforzada y luchadora , de profesion maestra de educacion primaria, soltera con un hijo a su cargo al que esta apoyando en su formacion profesional , a demas que tiene a   su hijo a su cargo tambien tiene  a sus padres que ya  son muy ancianos, debido a que sus padres depende de ella y los cuida no ejerce sus profesion desde hace 10 años por que sus padres necesitan de mucho cuido, Esta señora busco otra al alterantiva economica para sobre vivir con sus padres e hijo puso una pequeña venta de frijoles y  de  leña desde hace 10 años de tener este tipo de negocio  con lo que ha mantenido sus `padres .
Actualemente esta señora visito a Ceprodel Para Solicitar el segundo financiamiento el que lo utilizararia para compra de frijoles y leña , los que le servirian para ampliar y mejorar su negocio.
ya que esta es  una forma de subsistir  , ayudandoles a sus padres en la manustencion de medicamentos  y a su hijo a formarlo profesionalmente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jioconda is a lady who is very hard-working, with a fighting spirit.  She is a primary school teacher by profession, and she is a single mother who is responsible for her son, whom she supports in his vocational training.  

In addition to being responsible for her son, she also has her parents, who are very old.  Because she takes care of her parents, who depend upon her and need a lot of care, she has not practiced her profession for 10 years.  

This lady sought an economic alternative in order to survive with her parents, and she opened a small business, selling beans and firewood.  She has had this type of business for ten years, with which she has supported her parents.

She visited Ceprodel to request a second loan that she will use to purchase beans and firewood.  This will help her to expand and improve her business, as it is a means of survival, of helping her parents maintain their medications, of helping her son to become a professional, and of improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beans and firewood.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Iman is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Yamon, a village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband and four kids, two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.

Two years ago, Iman opened a beauty salon in the city. She has a good experience from her previous job.

Iman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new tools and some beauty products she uses in her salon. By taking this loan, Iman will be able to improve her business and attract more clients. Iman appears in the photo in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new tools and some beauty products she uses in her salon

loans.name: Banco Comunal Victoria De David Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN LA VICTORIA DE DAVID ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y TRES HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE VEINTE HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE , LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN.  ESTAS PERSONAS SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER LUCHADORAS, TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES,  CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, TODOS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS. POR LA CUAL LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA BRINDARLES ESTABILIDAD A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES GLADYS  Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE, A CLIENTES Y POR ENCARGOS , LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNAS OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. ELLA DOS VECES POR SEMANA TIENE ENCARGO DE CERDOS A CLIENTES QUE  DESTANSAN PARA LA VENTA DEL PRODUCTO COMO CARNE, FRITO, CHICHARRÓN,  ADOBADO, ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.  LA VICTORIA DE DAVID AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en: The Victoria De David association consists of 10 members, seven women and three men, the responsible mothers and fathers of twenty minor children. They're natives of Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the region. These people are known for being hard-working, determined, responsible, and having the desire to get ahead. They all have different financial activities that they work hard at every day, to provide stability for their children. Thanks to their desire to get ahead, Gladys is the coordinator and her financial activity is the raising and selling of pigs for customer orders. This woman's work schedule is eight hours daily, selling her products. Twice a week she receives orders from her customers for pigs that are butchered to be sold as products such as pork, fried pork, pork rinds, and marinated pork, etc. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that she can increase her income in the near future. Victoria De David is grateful for the help given by Kiva lenders to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have respectable employment.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of pigs to sell products such as: pork, fried pork, pork rinds, and marinated pork.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is an active woman with multidisciplinary skills, working at the same time with animals on the farm and as an assistant nurse in her village. She and her husband own a few cows and poultry, but are often constrained by their farm's operating costs, which mostly consist of expenses for LP gas and chemical fertilizers. 

By purchasing her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Maria wants to reduce her dependency on external and fossil fuel-based inputs, and take advantage of her animals' manure to produce her own farm's biogas and biofertilizer. She will displace the expensive LP gas and improve the yield of her crops by spreading the nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer on her fields to nourish the soils in a natural way. Her animals' waste will no longer contaminate underground water sources, nor emit dangerous greenhouse gases. 

With the savings Maria will make, she wants to invest in complementary productive projects on the farm, such as the production of cheese from her cows' milk. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 14 cubic metre waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a retired teacher who has always owned a few cows and lived on his farm. Since he retired, he is able to focus more on his farm and on his milk production. He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to reduce the operating costs of the farm (mostly LP gas) by producing his own biogas from his cows' manure. This will increase his available income, while also improving his family's quality of life. Indeed, his wife used to spend a few hours per week looking for wood in the surroundings to cook with, and was then inhaling the toxic smoke while she was cooking. 

With the biodigester, she will be able to cook with the clean blue flame produced from her cows' waste. Further, the biodigester is producing an organic, nutrient-rich fertilizer that the family will use to naturally increase the yield of the vegetables and other crops they grow in the backyard, thus displacing chemical fertilizers. As his farm becomes more environmental-friendly and he generates savings, Francisco is looking forward to expanding the farm and diversifying his livestock by buying sheep and pigs, as well as improving the overall infrastructure.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Aizel

texts.en:
Aizel works hard to support her parents. She is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish to sell.

Aizel has been in this business for one year now. In the future, Aizel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amy works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amy is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of hotdogs, chicken, ham, nuggets, etc. for her frozen foods business.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to improve her living and her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of hot dogs, chicken, ham, nuggets, etc.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof in Nyamwa C village in Ndhiwa, Kenya with his family which includes 3 children. The community of Nyamwa C village collects their drinking water from Agutu stream because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Nyamwa C’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Nyamwa C, 20 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Michael has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 2 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Rebecca and Ann.

Nyamwa C village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Michael believes that the dispenser will kill bacteria in water making it safe to drink, and therefore making the community have healthy and productive lives.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Michael’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Nyaung Hnit Pin Group 2 villagers to purchase ducklings as well as high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
Andrew is 46 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Maram village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Maram village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Maram borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Andrew and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Andrew works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Andrew and other promoters in his community, including Isca, Elizabeth, and Mary need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Andrew will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Andrew wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser will improve the community's health so that people can work hard and children can go to school.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Andrew’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that his community has access to safe drinking water by installing chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Priscah's Group

texts.en:
Prisca is 40 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Pala Lower village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Prisca works as a business owner for a living. Where Prisca lives, her family and her community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from Kabura well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Pala Lower had a way to treat their water, they could improve the health of their community, keeping children at school and parents at work.

This is why Prisca is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of her community. Prisca was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people in Pala Lower village on the importance of safe water, and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Prisca wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will kill bacteria making water safe for drinking.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Prisca’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow her community to treat water using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José is a small dairy farmer, who earns a living from selling his cows' milk and cultivating corn for his family's own consumption. He spends a significant proportion of his revenue on LP gas and chemical fertilizers, and has decided to invest in a biodigester to both reduce these costs and turn his farm into a more sustainable place. 

Instead of piling his cows' manure up outside his farm, which contaminates underground water sources and leads to significant greenhouse gas emissions, he will now turn the manure into a productive resource by inputting it into the biodigester. The biogas produced will be used to cook and heat water in the house, displacing the expensive LP gas, while the organic fertilizer will be spread on the fields to improve their productivity in a natural way. 

José plans to use his savings to produce more milk and to start making cheese in order to diversify his revenue sources. He also aims to buy more cows.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic metre Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Lucy Mayin

texts.es:
La socia Lucy Mayin se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de tejidos y telares,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora,el sueño de la socia es abrir otro negocio de venta de tejidos y telares.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tejidos y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Lucy Mayin is continuing to work in her business selling weavings and knitted items. Through this business she wants to succeed in life. She is an enterprising and determined woman. Her dream is to open another business selling weavings and knitted items. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To purchase weavings and knitted items.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three young children ages two, nine and sixteen. Emma is living with her children in Albuera, Leyte. Her husband is away, working in another country to provide for them.

For ten years now she has been raising hogs while also selling trendy and affordable clothing locally known as RTW (Ready To Wear). She would like to also sell frozen products like sausages and hot dogs.

Emma is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets, trendy clothes, Spanish sausage and hot dogs. She hopes that someday she and her husband can be together again and find a sustainable business so he will not have to go back abroad.

Her income will be for the school fees of her children and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, trendy clothes, Spanish sausages and hot dogs

loans.name: Costa

texts.en:
Costa is a 46-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has three children, and they are all attending school. He is a nursing assistant in a government health center. 

He is a hardworking man who loves his job and has been in this service for 12 years. He hopes to educate his children, though he faces challenges of long working days and the high enrollment of patients. Costa intends to use the loan to complete his house by roofing it.

loans.use: to complete his house by roofing it.

loans.name: Clecencio

texts.en:
Clecencio is a 37-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and also deals in a transport business to earn extra income. He started this business to generate funds and meet the family demands. He hopes to build a good residential house; however, his main challenge is high transportation costs.

He is requesting a loan to improve his coffee gardens by pruning them and buying more bags of coffee for sale.

loans.use: to improve his coffee gardens by pruning them and buying more bags of coffee for sale.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana tiene 25 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres es San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y frejol, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes agricolas para sembrar y mejorar la producción, realiza las compras cada semana en San Miguel.
Su sueño es realizar una granja completa y producir diferentes productos, en su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Diana, 25, is single and lives with her parents in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar in the community of Salado Chico.  She belongs to San Francisco Communal Bank.

She earns a living in agriculture growing corn and beans.  She's requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizer to improve her production.  She makes her purchases in San Miguel every week.

Her dream is to have a complete farm and grow different products.  In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Milton Alcides

texts.es:
Milton, adquirió material para la marmolería, comenta que recupero la inversión con mejores ganancias, las que le han servido para pagar la deuda, cubrir necesidades de su hogar y gastos de escrituración de su propiedad.
Su negocio tiene más popularidad y sus demandas están creciendo, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar mármol, lapidas, cemento, etc., para cubrir los nuevos pedidos y continuar trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en: Milton acquired material for his marble shop. He says that he recovered the investment and had better earnings, which have helped him to pay off the debt, cover household necessities and expenses for the legalization of this property. His business is more popular and his demand is growing, so he sees the need to request a new loan in order to buy marble, headstones, cement, etc., in order to cover new orders and continue working to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy marble, headstones, cement, etc., in order to cover new orders and continue working to get ahead in life.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en: Drita is seeking your financial help again, this time to do some home repairs.

loans.use: to make some home improvements

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 22-year-old single man. Hamad goes to the university to study to become a teacher. He is in his fourth year now.

Hamad works after school in farming to make money that would cover his school fees, but recently he had a car accident that made him use the money he saved to fix the car. He decided to apply for a loan to help him pay for the semester fees, and will pay back the loan from his work on the land.

loans.use: to help him pay for the semester fees

loans.name: Alh. Hudu

texts.en:
Alh. Hudu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alh. Hudu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ibrahim, Mohammadu and Sani.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Hudu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Hudu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Alh. Hudu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Perezi

texts.en:
Perezi started his business of buying and selling maize and beans in Hoima, Uganda using his previous loan. He supplements his business by farming and keeping animals. 

Perezi requested this loan to buy more maize to sell. He hopes to grow and expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Barbara is 46 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Barbara has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like pork, beef, rice, spices, chicken, etc.

Barbara has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Barbara would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like pork, beef, rice, spices, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell business.

Blesilda has been in this business for five years. She also earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a Mexican small farmer, who is very curious about environmental technologies. When he found out about Sistema Biobolsa, he was above all interested in the opportunity provided by this waste-to-energy system to reduce his operating costs, while protecting the environment. 

Indeed, Abel will now be able to input his animals' manure into the biodigester, letting the natural methanisation process turn it into biogas, and the bacteria inside the system will transform into a nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer for his fields. He will displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers he used to buy, reducing his dependency on these fossil fuel based products. Further, the waste will be treated, eliminating bad smells, flies, and protecting underground water sources. Abel's farm will become a cleaner and more comfortable place to live, while also improving its cost-efficiency and productivity in line with natural cycles.
 
This loan represents 24% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is an experienced farmer who owns cows, a horse, goats, sheep and poultry. He produces cheese and also cultivates vegetables and other crops which he sells at the local markets and uses for his own consumption. The diverse activities on his farm used to rely on important external inputs, such as LP gas and chemical fertilizers, while his animals were producing useless waste that was only contaminating watersheds and producing greenhouse gases. 

Through the purchase of his biodigester, Pedro will turn his farm into an increasingly self-sufficient, sustainable, productive and cost-effective place. Indeed, he will use his animals' waste as a resource to feed the biodigester, and use the methane-rich biogas to cook and heat water in the house, thereby displacing LP gas. His vegetables and other crops will grow healthier in richer soils once the potent organic fertilizer produced by the bacteria in the system is applied to the fields, eliminating the need for any chemical fertilizer. Pedro will save money while improving his living conditions and protecting the environment.

This loan represents 38% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 cubic metre Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia Mery se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace platos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Mery, continues her business of selling food. She hopes to get ahead with this business. Mery makes dishes such as roasted chicken and soups, among others. Her dream is to grow her business selling food. Mery is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.

Mery is happy because of the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gilda works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Gilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell for her buy-and-sell frozen foods business.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide and secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Lucia has been in this business for four years. She also earns more income from a restaurant. Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y vive con sus padres es San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santo Cristo, Ella se dedica a la agricultura y la cria de animales, solicita el credito para comprar cerdos y gallinas para criarlos y venderlos tambien para hacer una chanchera por que le hace falta para los chanchos, realiza las compras en San Miguel cada semana. Su sueño es que mejore el negocio y en su tiempo libre le gusta realizar actividades con cosas recicladas como cofres entre otras.
texts.en: Mariana is 31 years old and single. She lives with her parents in San Miguel in the Bolivar province in the Santo Cristo community. She works in agriculture and raising animals. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs and hens to raise and sell them, as well as to make a pig pen since she doesn't have one for the pigs. She does her shopping in San Miguel each week. Her dream is to improve her business. In her free time, she likes to do activities with recycled things such as chests, among other things.

loans.use: to buy pigs and hens.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: El oficio de comerciante lo lleva en la sangre Doña Cándida, ella ha logrado mantener su negocio con la ayuda de su familia y los préstamos obtenidos con MiCrédito este es el tercero que solicita ya que le han sido de mucho beneficio en su negocio. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos tales como: Arroz, Azúcar y aceite también bebidas gaseosas. Los productos que vende le ayudan a obtener ganancias y así ha logrado mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, obtener cerdos para engorde y ampliar su pulpería. Su meta próxima es solicitar otro préstamo para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Being a merchant runs in Mrs. Cándida's blood. She has maintained her business with the help of her family and loans obtained with MiCrédito. This is the third loan she is requesting, since they have already been very beneficial to her business. Mrs. Cándida is requesting a new loan to buy staple foods such as: rice, sugar, and oil, as well as soft drinks. The products that she sells help her to earn profits and be able to improve the infrastructure of her house, get pigs to fatten, and expand her grocery store. Her next goal is to apply for another loan to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, such as: rice, sugar, and oil, as well as soft drinks.

loans.name: Alozio

texts.en:
Alozio is a 77-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He farms to earn income. 

Alozio hopes to increase his farming output and is therefore requesting a loan to pay for labour on his farm.

loans.use: to pay for labour on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more inventory to increase business activity

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, hoy en día tiene un negocio con mayor variedad de productos de consumo y en la pupuseria ha logrado incorporar nuevas especialidades de pupusas, estos beneficios positivos son gracias a la ayuda de préstamos y a su buena administración, María ha cambiado el nivel de vida familiar y poco a poco ha cancelado sus deudas.
Con el propósito de continuar mejorando su negocio solicita más capital para comprar aceite, leña, gas propano, bebidas, harina, quesillo, golosinas, etc., serán de utilidad para tener la tienda bien surtida y seguir elaborando la venta de pupusas.
texts.en:
Now María has a business with a greater variety of consumer goods.  In her pupuseria (where she makes and sells traditional "pupusas", or stuffed tortillas) she has managed to incorporate new pupusa specialties.  These positive benefits are thanks to the help from loans and her good management.  Maria has changed her standard of living and little by little she has settled her debts.

With the goal of continuing to improve her business, Maria asks for a loan to buy oil, firewood, propane gas, drinks, flour, soft cheese, candy, etc. This will be useful to keep her store well-stocked and to continue making her pupusas.

loans.use: to buy oil, firewood, propane gas, drinks, flour, soft cheese, candy, etc.

loans.name: Mariter

texts.en:
Mariter is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell for her buy-and-sell frozen foods business.

Mariter has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Naty Ruby

texts.en:
Naty Ruby is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Naty Ruby has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell.

Remia has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una mujer de 28 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos una niña de 10 años y  2 varones de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se encarga de cuidar su cultivo de hortalizas actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años y gracias a la cual mantiene la economía de su hogar. Marina desea construir una pared en el corredor de su vivienda ya que actualmente solo cuenta con un pasamanos, y ella desea ampliar su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared en el corredor de su vivienda que le permita ampliar un poco más su casa. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina is a 28-year-old woman who lives in her own home together with her partner and their three children: a 10-year-old girl, and two boys who are two and five years old.  She is in charge of taking care of her vegetable crops; a job she has done for six years and thanks to which she maintains the household finances.  

Maria wishes to build a wall in the corridor of her home because right now she only has a handrail.  She also wants to increase the size of her home. This is why she asks for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron in order to build a wall in the corridor of her home which will allow her to increase the size of her house a little bit.  She is grateful for the support she received in the past to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron in order to build a wall in the corridor of her home.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Esfuerzo del Mañana lo integran cuatro mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan a ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios por cuarta vez, quien lo coordina es la señora Luisa de 55 años de edad, casada y dedicada a la comercialización de calzado y leña en su domicilio desde hace un año, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de flete de leña, zapatos cerrado, sandalias altas, sandalias bajas, zapatos de niños, ya que con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar los productos ofrecidos lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Yessenia de 32 años de edad propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio con tres años de experiencia, Jessika quien tiene la edad de 32 años dedicada a la comercialización de cosméticos, calzado y ropa en su comunidad y trabajadores de una zona franca cercana a su comunidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años, y Ruth una joven de 21 años de edad comerciante de ropa y calzado en la municipalidad y en la capital desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
These four enterprising women belong to the group Esfuerzo del Mañana. They are seeking a loan for their businesses from ADIM for the fourth time.

The coordinator of the group is 55-year old Sra. Luisa who is married and has earned her living selling footwear and firewood from her home for the last year.  She is seeking a loan to buy a load of firewood, high heeled shoes, sandals with heels, flat sandals, and children’s shoes. With her previous loans she was managed to increase inventory which in turn allowed her to improve her income.

The other woman are 32-year old Yessenia who is the owner of sewing business that she runs out of her home, a business she has had for three years; 32-year old Jessika who sells cosmetics, footwear and clothing in the community and to workers in a nearby duty-free zone, a business she has also had for three years; and 21-year old Ruth who has sold clothing and footwear in the municipality and the capital for three years.

loans.use: buy firewood and clothing

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Zenaida has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to expand her business and improve her living.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 35 years old, married, and works hard to support her family. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her rice farming business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 56 años de edad tiene 6 hijos y vive en Ventanas provincia de Bolivar.


Ella solicita el credito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y todo lo que sea neccesario para sembrar maiz ya que quiere hacerle producir al terreno que tiene y asi poder mejorar su economia y solventar los gastos de su familia. su sueño es comprarse un carro y en su tiempo libr le gusta descansar
texts.en:
56-year old Mariana has six children and lives in Ventanas in the province of Bolivar.

She is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer--everything she needs to grow corn on the piece of land that she owns. In this way Mariana hopes to be able to improve her financial situation and pay for her family’s expenses. Her dream is to buy a car. In her free time she enjoys relaxing.

loans.use: buy farming supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos owns cows, sheep, and a plot of land where he cultivates corn. He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to reduce his expenses linked to the purchase of LP gas, which partly covers the energy needs of his farm and house. In addition to LP gas, he used to buy important amounts of wood to cook, and heat water in the bathroom.
