Not only was this contributing to deforestation, but also burning wood was filling the house with toxic smoke, which the whole family was inhaling on a daily basis. 

With his biodigester, Marcos will turn his animals' manure into a precious resource to produce his own biogas, which will supply the house and farm in a renewable and safe energy source to cook and heat water. The animals' manure is also transformed into a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer by the bacteria inside the biodigester, which Marcos will spread on his cornfield to improve the yield in a natural way. By displacing LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizers, Marcos will save money he plans to reinvest in the purchase of additional animals, and the improvement of his farm's infrastructure, to create better living conditions for his animals.

This loan represents 45% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marilou has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling crabs. Myrna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs etc.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Don Silvio desea darle a su esposa y a sus hijos las mejores de condiciones en su vida y una de ella es también priorizar su vivienda, el tiene una pequeña Panadería en su casa y con las ganancias y la de su esposa quien trabaja pagos los gastos del hogar, solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para la realizar la construcción de un Muro Perimetral, remodelacion de techo y peso y tener mas seguridad en la vivienda.
Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado ya que con mucho esfuerzo a salido adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvio wants to provide the best living conditions possible for his wife and children, and this includes prioritizing their home. Silvio has a small bakery in his home and with these and his wife's earnings, they pay for the costs of their household. 

Silvio is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to carry out the construction of a boundary wall, to remodel the roof and to have a more secure house.  

Thanks to the support that Kiva and Afodenic have offered him, and with a lot of effort, Silvio will get ahead, alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials in order to increase her production and sales of nacatamales.

loans.name: Milanie

texts.en:
Milanie is 39 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Milanie has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Helen is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her vulcanizing shop business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy aditional materials for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Heide works hard to support her family. She is a rice farmer in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Heide has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan and wants to further build her businesses.

Heide is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farm and business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college. Heide also want to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is 19 years old and married with two children. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from food vending. Angelyn has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She works hard to provide for her family.

Angelyn is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other products to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is an experienced farmer who raises cows and sells their milk for a living. By investing in a waste-to-energy system, he will be able to transform his cows' manure into biogas and biofertilizer, allowing him to displace the expensive and fossil fuel based LP gas and chemical fertilizers. Indeed, the natural methanisation process taking place inside the biodigester, as well as the bacteria in the system, will treat and transform waste into renewable energy connected to the house and nutrient-rich organic fertilizer for the field. Felipe will reduce his operating costs and protect the environment by limiting greenhouse gas emissions, preventing the contamination of underground water sources by the manure and reducing his dependency on fossil fuels. There will be no swarms of flies around his farm anymore, nor bad smells, thus progressively turning his farm into a comfortable and sustainable place to live.

Felipe is requesting a loan to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. His loan represents 44% of the total cost of the biodigester. The remaining part will be covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to print new marketing materials and purchase a computer for her design business.

loans.name: Nenas De Los Angeles Group

texts.es: Nenas de los Ángeles es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres exitosas en su vida laboral, quien lo coordina es la señora Luz Marina que tiene la edad de 48 años, acompañada, cuenta con una experiencia de veintidós años en la comercialización de ropa íntima en el mercado más populoso de la capital, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de bóxer de mujer de microfibra, bóxer de mujer de algodón, brazier, blúmer, bikini, bóxer para caballeros, tobilleras, etc. Otra de las integrantes es Jenny que tiene la edad de 43 años y se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace tres años, y la señora Santa Genoveva quien tiene la edad de 42 años y comercializa frutas en el mercado de Granada.
texts.en: Nenas de los Ángeles is a support group made up of three women who are successful in their work lives. It is coordinated by Luz Marina, who is 48 years old. She is married and has twenty two years' experience selling clothes in the busiest market of the capital. She is asking for the present loan to buy women's microfiber boxers, women's cotton boxers, braziers, bloomers, bikinis, men's boxers, braces, etc. Other members are Jenny, who is 43 and has bought and sold harvests in the city market for three years, as well as Santa Genoveva, who is 42 and sells fruit in the market of Granada.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise to cover the demand that she has for these products. This will allow her to continue contributing to the family budget.

loans.name: Jenly

texts.en:
Jenly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell of vegetables business.

Jenly has been in this business for two years. Jenly earns more income from buying and selling crabs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Geovany Edemilson

texts.es:
Geovany, de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, a temprana edad se dedicó a trabajar la agricultura junto a su papá, está acompañado, decidió formar su hogar a la edad de los 24 años, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y como madre también está al pendiente de sus hijos. 

Él se dedica a vender pan dulce y francés, tiene más de cinco años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual aprendió dedicándole tiempo.- Un amigo de Geovany fue quien le consiguió trabajo, porque la panadería necesitaba otro vendedor y él, aprovecho la oportunidad.

Anteriormente trabajaba en la agricultura; no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique. El recorrido que realiza es un promedio de 30 km en cada jornada, ya que realiza dos, una en la tarde de 2:00 p.m. a 6: 00 p.m. y la otra por la mañana de 5:30 a.m. a 9:00 a.m. su medio de transporte es una motocicleta.  

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta nueva, ya que la que tiene está en mal estado y ocupa bastantes  reparaciones y le genera muchos gastos.

Los sueños de Geovany son,  trabajar duro para poder pagar la moto, también  desea que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales que ayuden a nuestro país.
texts.en:
Geovany is 33 years old and has a fifth grade education.  From an earlier age, he started working in agriculture with his father.  He is now married, having decided at the age of 24 to start a family.  His wife devotes herself to housework and caring for their children.  He works selling sweet bread and french bread.  He has worked in this business for five years, and he has learned the ins and outs of the business through time.  A friend of Geovany's is who got him the job because the bakery was in need of another salesperson, and he took advantage of the opportunity.  Previously, he worked as a farmer.  He does not have any other jobs. 

On average, he travels about 30 kilometers during the work day.  He runs two routes, one in the afternoon from 2pm to 6pm, and one in the morning from 5:30am to 9am.  He makes his route on a motorcycle.

The loan he is seeking will be used to purchase a new motorcycle because the one he currently has is in bad shape and needs a lot of expensive repairs.  Geovany's dreams are to work hard so that he can pay off the motorcycle, and for his children to attend school and be professionals so that they can help their country.

loans.use: purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela is 28 years old and she is a single mother of 4 children She lives in La Paz at a nice house that belongs to her Angela is a butcher  and she wants a loan to purchase more meat Since christmas is comming she is planning to sell pork about other stuff Angela is the only support at her house she is alone and she will appreciate a lot the help from kiva At least she is healthy and she expects you can help her to be more prosperous
texts.en:
Angela is 28 years old, and she is a single mother of four children. She lives in La Paz in a nice house that belongs to her.  

Angela is a butcher, and she wants a loan to purchase more meat.  Since Christmas is coming, she is planning to sell pork and other stuff.  Angela is the only support at her house; she is alone, and she will appreciate the help from Kiva a lot.   

At least she is healthy, and she expects you can help her to be more prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase more meat

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a 27-year-old young woman from the village of Kvibisi. She has five family members, and her father-in-law is employed. Specifically, he works at a railway and generates 380 GEL monthly. Teona is a hardworking person who does her best to make financial stability for her family. She works at a private bakery, where she bakes traditional Georgian bread. Also, in her spare time, she sells various kinds of clothing in her community.

However, she gets really insignificant income from the bakery and has great desire to start her own business. She requested a loan of 1,000 USD for purchasing a stock of products and all merchandise for opening a general store in her village. She has already found a place for the store, and now requires financial support. 

The new business will become the main source of income for the family, and Teona will have her own loyal customers, which she has already got for her nice and kind attitude toward the clients she has had from clothing sales.
 
Teona relies on the goodwill of Kiva lenders, and will highly appreciate your help and kindness.

loans.use: To start her own business and open a general store

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Adamu expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide the family with food and clothing, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 52 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijas, y su negocio es la confección de fundas para vehículos.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chamoco Chico’ ubicada en el sector noroeste de la ciudad; esta zona es como muchas otras que está asentada sobre la falda de un cerro, por ello se puede decir que las casas están colgadas una sobre otra (al menos esa es la apariencia que se tiene desde el centro de la ciudad). Sólo autos con gran potencia se atreven a llegar por la parte de arriba, porque por abajo es imposible, los habitantes por siempre tendrán que llegar caminando a pie para llegar a las casas del barrio.
Armando es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en su familia, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio, y sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia, construida de ladrillo y parte de adobe, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de fundas para vehículos de todo tipo y también a medida, los materiales que utiliza son; nylon, carpa, polipiel y otros. Su anterior actividad era la carpintería, debido al aserrín de la madera se enfermó de los pulmones y tuvo que cambiar de actividad. “mi ventaja es que por la calidad de mi trabajo tengo clientes constantes de sindicatos de transportes y algunas líneas de radiotaxis…” comenta.
Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y confeccionar fundas para asientos y otros. Él desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la refacción de un cuarto para la instalación de su nuevo taller de costura. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Armando solicita un préstamo para la refacción de un cuarto para la instalación de un nuevo taller de costura.
texts.en:
Armando is a 52-year-old man who is married, has two children, and has a business of making covers for vehicles.  He is a good father, an entrepreneur, and is persevering, active, responsible, and hard-working.  He does his work in the "Chamoco Chico" area located in the northeast of the city.  This area is like many others in that it sits at the foot of a hill, which is why it can be said that the houses are hanging one above the other (at least this is the appearance it has from the center of the city).  Only cars with a lot of power dare to reach the top because from below it is impossible.  The inhabitants will always have to go by foot in order to get to houses in the neighborhood.  

Armando has a dark complexion, a short stature, and short dark hair.  His mother language is the Aymará that his family speaks, but for work he speaks Spanish.  He shares his life with his wife who makes a living in the same business.  Their daughters are in school, and they all live in their own home, which is built from brick and adobe, and has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.  His business is making covers for vehicles of all kinds and to measure.  The materials he uses are nylon, canvas, and imitation leather among others.

His previous work was in carpentry, but due to the sawdust his lungs got infected and he had to change jobs. "My advantage is that with the high quality of my work I have constant customers from transportation unions and various radio taxi lines," he says.

His dream is to have a much larger workshop and to make covers for seats and other things. He hopes to realize the expansion of his business through the refurbishment of a room in order to install a new sewing workshop. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in the seven years he has been doing this business. 

It is for these reasons that Armando is asking for a loan to refurbish a room in order to install a new sewing workshop.

loans.use: to refurbish a room in order to install a new sewing workshop.

loans.name: Juana Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una señora que por muchos años a impartido clases de educacion primaria , con 56 de edad,y 36 años de impartir clases,  mostrando buenas relaciones con los niños y compañeros de trabajo, es casada con 3 hijos los cuales ya son independiente, es casada. Esta señora es jubilida por su edad  ahora busco otra alternativa economica para sobre vivir  como  es la venta  de mercaderia escolar por tal motivo se acerco  A Ceprodel para solicitar el decimo financiamiento con que fue mejorando sus vivienda y salud.
Dicho financiamiento lo utilizaria para la compra de mercaderia escolar tales como camisetas, calcetas, cuadernos, mochilas para aprovechar la epoca de regreso a clases.
texts.en:
Norma is a woman who for many years, has taught elementary school classes.  At the age of 56, with 36 years of experience in education, she has proven her good relationships with her students and coworkers.  She is married and has three children who are independent.  Norma is now retired given her age, but she is now looking for a new career opportunity in selling school supplies.  For this reason, she approached Ceprodel to request her tenth loan so that she can improve her home and health.

This loan will be used to purchase school supplies such as shirts, socks, notebooks and backpacks to take advantage of the back-to-school season.

loans.use: purchase backpacks, notebooks, gowns, socks, etc.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yahaya, Nagip and Mustafa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yakubu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and eventually hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Titi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Titi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Mika and Janet.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Titi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Titi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Titi  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: La Paz Centro Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario La Paz Centro la integran cuatro socios emprendedores, que solicitan por quinto ciclo el financiamiento de ADIM para sus negocios. Quien lo coordina es Anielca, una mujer laboriosa, acompañada y que a sus 37 años de edad, se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas, tamal pisque y nacatamales, cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá y tiene cinco años de experiencia en la realización de estos productos, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la producción de su negocio lo que la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, marca de leña, hojas de chagüite, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate, etc. el resto de los integrantes son el señor Wilber de 31 años de edad dedicado a la agricultura desde hace cinco años, Marta una mujer de 47 años de edad quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas y güirila desde hace veinte años y Johana quien tiene la edad de 30 años,  y comercializa tamales hace tres años en Granada.
texts.en:
Four entrepreneurs make up the membership of the "La Paz Centro" lending group.  The members are seeking their fifth loan for their businesses through ADIM.  Anielca is the group's coordinator.  She is a hardworking, married woman who at the age of 37 works making and selling tortillas and various types of tamales.  Her mother helps her, and she has five years of experience making these products.  With her previous loans, she has been able to increase her business's production, which is why she has motivated her to continue seeking loans.

She will use this new loan to purchase a bushel of corn, an order of firewood, banana leaves, onions, green peppers, etc. The other members of the group are Wilber, 31, who has worked as a farmer for five years, Marta, 47, who has worked making and selling tortillas and güirila for 20 years, and Johana, 30, who has worked selling tamales in Granada for three years.

loans.use: purchase a bushel of corn, an order of firewood, banana leaves, onions, green peppers, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos, los cuales viven con ellos.

Cecilia, tiene una tienda, en la que vende todo lo necesario para la cocina, también tiene una granjita de pollos que engorda, para luego venderlos, ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad.- La necesidad la llevo a iniciar una fuente de ingreso extra, por lo que decidió poner la tienda como una fuente de ingreso adicional, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique, el negocio lo tiende en su casa, el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. 

Cecilia, anteriormente había solicitado un crédito para financiar algunos de estos proyectos y su estilo de vida ha cambiado después de ese crédito.

El préstamo será invertido para la graduación de su hija, ya que está terminando su nivel básico y desea continuar estudiando.
	
Los sueños de Cecilia son, que su tienda crezca y con eso tener mejores ingresos, el préstamo le ayudará a satisfacer sus necesidades. Además, Cecilia desea apoyar a su hija para que continúe estudiando, ya que el deseo de su hija es ser profesional.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old. She went to school up to the seventh grade. Her spouse works in agriculture. They have two children who live with them. 

Cecilia has a store where she sells everything needed for cooking. She also has a little poultry farm where she fattens chickens to later sell. She has been doing this activity for three years. It was necessity that brought her to start a new source of income. That is why she decided to open the store as a source of additional income. She has no other activity and she has the business in her house. Her hours of service are from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. 

Previously Cecilia asked for a loan to finance some of these projects and her lifestyle changed after that loan. This loan will be invested in her daughter's graduation, because she is finishing the basic level and she wants to continue her education. 
	 
Cecilia's dream is for her store to grow and to have better income. The loan will help her to meet these needs. In addition, Cecilia wants to help her daughter continue her education, because she wants her to graduate from college.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's graduation. She is finishing the basic level and she wants to continue going to school.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José es un hombre tranquilo, trabajador, carismático y servicial que toda su vida ha estado rodeado y bendecido por la naturaleza, sus antepasados construyeron una finca en las montañas y se dedicaron a la producción de leche, manteniendo hoy en día esta tradición.
Es un hombre casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años, el cual ama y vela por que tenga una buena educación, alimentación, vivienda y en un futuro estudie esa carrera universitaria que tanto desea que es veterinaria. 
Para José estos tiempos se han tornado muy difíciles y todo recae en la devaluación del precio de venta de la leche, golpeando su economía y obligándolo a buscar alternativas que le permitan mantener en  pie los sueños para su familia. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de dos vacas lecheras, la razón del monto es que las quiere comprar preñadas para poder ordeñarlas, con la ayuda de este crédito aumentara su producción de leche buscando un equilibrio de ingresos para seguir con la sostenibilidad de su negocio y la ilusión de salir adelante con su familia y estar en unos años aplaudiendo a su hijo recién graduado.
texts.en:
José is a calm, hardworking, charismatic, and obliging man who has been surrounded and blessed by nature his entire life.  His ancestors built a farm in the mountains and earned their living producing milk, a tradition that endures for him today.

He's married and has a young six-year-old son whom he loves and watches over so he can have a good education, nourishment, a home, and a university education in the future so he can be a veterinarian, something he wants so much.

This has become a very difficult period for José.  Everything rests on the devaluation of the price of milk sales, battering his budget and requiring him to look for alternatives so he can keep on track with his dreams for his family.

José is requesting a loan to buy two dairy cows.  The amount is because he wants to buy them pregnant to be able to milk them.

The loan will help him increase his milk production, trying for a balance in income to keep his business sustainable.  He wants to get ahead with his family and, in a few years, be congratulating his son on his recent graduation.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to stabilize his finances because the devaluation of the price of milk has him on the brink of bankruptcy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business of preparing various foods by buying fruits, firewood, corn, and a semi-industrial stove in order to continue forward with her economy

loans.name: Enrique Javier

texts.es: Enrique es residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla, tiene 26 años de edad y está dedicado a su negocio de venta de minutos y recargas a todos los operadores de celular, alquiler de sillas, mesas y servicio de buffet para celebraciones, el emprendió este negocio con el propósito de ser un trabajador independiente y de generar sus propios recursos. Aprendió de unos amigos que se encuentran vinculados a este mismo oficio y con los consejos y recomendaciones, le enseñaron como hacer prosperar su negocio. Con tres años de experiencia y con una enorme dedicación, todos los días a partir de las 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m. Enrique atiende sus negocios.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará sillas para alquilar en las festividades navideñas y accesorios para celulares.  Esta inversión promete generar excelentes ingresos y mayor rentabilidad.  Enrique desea continuar creciendo en sus negocios, y a nivel personal formar una familia, comprar su casa propia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enrique is a resident of a neighborhood located in the municipality of Barranquilla. He is 26 years old and makes a living working in his business selling  cell phone minutes of all phone operators; renting seats and tables; and hosting a buffet for the festivities. Enrique opened this business in order to be an independent worker and to generate his own resources. He learned from some friends who work in similar businesses. With their advice and recommendations, they taught him how to prosper in his business. With three years of experience and enormous dedication, Enrique works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. each day tending to his businesses. 

Currently, Enrique is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy chairs to rent out during the Christmas festivals, as well as cell phone accessories. This investment promises to generate excellent income and be very profitable. Enrique hopes to continue growing his business, and on a personal note, to start a family, buy a house, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs to rent during the Christmas festivals, as well as cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Margarita Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Margarita, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 10 años que vende ropa de todo tipo en su casa. Vende blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, ropa interior, camisas y ropa para niños. Ha decidido solicitar el tercer ciclo de préstamo en la institución, que es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fardos de ropa variada de blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas etc. para poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y vender mas en esta temporada de fin de año y obtener mejores  utilidades. Su meta es crecer con el negocio y darles mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Doña Margarita is 53 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. For 10 years she has been selling clothing of all types in her home. She sells blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, underwear, shirts, and clothing for children. She has decided to apply for her third loan with the institution, which is for 15,000 lempiras, in order to buy bundles of various clothing -- blouses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc. -- in order to offer variety to her customers and to sell more in this season at the end of the year and obtain more profits. Her goal is to grow in her business and offer a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of various clothing to sell in this season

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is an experienced farmer who owns several cows, and lives from selling their milk and meat. He used to just pile up his animals' manure outside his farm, which was smelling bad, attracting flies, contaminating underground water sources and liberating greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. With the purchase of his biodigester, Agustin will treat his waste and use it as a productive resource by inputting it in the biodigester, which will produce methane-rich biogas and a potent organic fertilizer. Agustin will be able to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers he used on his fields, replacing them by his own sources of energy and fertilizer. With the savings he will make, Agustin plans to improve his house, and also save a part of it in order to improve his living standards. 

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Mai'unguwa Ayuba

texts.en: Mai'unguwa Ayuba is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mai'unguwa Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mai'unguwa Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mai'unguwa Ayuba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer from Nassarawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Haruna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rosalba Elena

texts.es:
Rosalba, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado por falta de recursos economicos, esta acompañada y su compañero de vida trabaja en un hotel de playa realizando oficios varios, es madre de tres hijas de los cuales solo dos viven con ella, la otra está casada y vive aparte.- Además de sus hijas, su mamá tambien vive con ella.

Rosalba, se dedica a oficios del hogar, pero cuando es tiempo de la cosecha de caña, trabaja como cortadora en los cañales pero además de eso, trabaja como empleada dómestica en una casa que está a dos kilometros de distancia de su casa, ella tiene que caminar alrededor de 8 a 10 minutos para llegar a este lugar y su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 10:00 am.

Rosalba, está solicitando el crédito para comprar lamina, cemento y pagar la mano de obra para reparar su vivienda, ya que nesecita de algunas reparaciones, esto le ayudará a tener una vivienda mas segura y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.

Rosalba, espera pagar su crédito sin ningun problema y seguir trabajando para poder construir una casa más grande y bonita para que sus hijas vivan cómodas y seguras.
texts.en:
Rosalba, 42 years old, studied up until the 7th grade because of financial hardship. Rosalba is married. Her husband works in a hotel by the beach doing various jobs. Rosalba has three daughters, of which only two live with her. Her oldest daughter is married and lives separately. Besides her daughters, Rosalba also lives with her mother. 

Rosalba primarily takes care of the housework, but when it is time to harvest sugarcane, she works in the fields cutting down the sugarcane. In addition, Rosalba also works as a domestic servant in a house located two kilometers from her house. She walks about 8-10 minutes to commute to work and she works from 5 a.m. to 10 a.m. 

Rosalba is requesting this loan in order to buy sheet metal, cement, as well as to pay workers to do some needed repairs on her home. This will help make her home safer and improve the quality of life in the house.

Rosalba hopes to pay off her loan without problem and continue working to be able to build a big, pretty house so that her daughters will live comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, cement, and to pay for laborers to repair her home.

loans.name: Cindy Raquel

texts.es: Cindy tiene 28 años de edad y habita junto a su hija de 6 años de edad. Cindy es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad por su integridad y responsabilidad. Cindy se dedica a la venta de variedad de medicamentos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su  hija lo necesario. Con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas e ingresos ha tomad la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de medicamentos (jarabe para la tos, pastillas para el dolor, algodón, etc.) y así poder lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Cindy is 28 years old and lives with her 6-year-old daughter. Cindy is a woman who is well-known in her community for her integrity and responsibility. She has made a living selling medicines for a long time. This is how she provides for her daughter. With the goal of increasing her sales and income, Cindy has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of medicines (cough syrup, pain pills, cotton, etc.) and, in this way, be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of medicines (cough syrup, pain pills, cotton, etc.).

loans.name: Bramwel's Group

texts.en:
Bramwel is a 68-year-old proud father of 12 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Bramwel has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Bramwel described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Bramwel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mary, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 44 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 14 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.  She is married and has one child.

Mary is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Mary says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Mary will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of five solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's Group is formed by six farmers in Teso District and is being represented by Hellen, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, is married and has three children. Hellen has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Hellen isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Hellen will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Hellen's Group will purchase a total of five solar solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Karla

texts.en: Karla is 22 years old and recently married. She works in a restaurant that is her family business. She is asking for a loan to refurbished and improve the image of the restaurant, and she believes that these improvements will help gain more clients and grow the business. She describes herself as credit-worthy and says that her biggest accomplishment is helping to grow a business that started small and has been increasing in size and revenue.

loans.use: to refurbish and improve the image of her restaurant.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la crianza de pollos desde hace 2 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Ana está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para los pollos ya que le ha ido bien con las ventas y asi poder generar buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and two children. She has been raising chickens for two years and sells her products in the neighborhoods surrounding her community.

Ana is requesting another loan so that she can buy vitamins and concentrated feed for her chickens. She is doing well with her sales and generates a good income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlita has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингул, 31 год, замужем, есть 5 детей, сын учится в школе, 3 дочери дошкольного возраста. У Эркингул- высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она работала в школе, сейчас в декретном отпуске и занимается животноводством и полеводством. По хозяйству помогает супруг. У Эркингул в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 15 овец, 4 лошади и 1,4 Га собственной земельной доли, где она выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркингул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Увеличение поголовья позволит развить ее бизнес и увеличить доходы семьи. Доходы от кредита Эркингул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Erkingul is 31 years old, married and has five children. Her sons go to school and the three daughters are of pre-school age. Erkingul has higher education. As a main source of income for her family, she works at a school. 

Erkingul is currently on maternity leave and is engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Her husband helps her with the farming. Erkingul has three cows, 15 sheep and four horses on her farm. She also has 1.4 hectares of land, where she grows barley for selling. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Erkingul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. Increasing the number of livestock will allow her to develop her business and increase the family's income. Erkingul plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Isidro Santiago

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 43 años de edad vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.
El se dedica a la cria de animales y a la agricultura, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas y mejorar la produccion para asi poder solventar a su familia, su sueño es comprarse un terreno grande para seguir sembrando, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Isidro is 43 years old. He lives in Ventanas, which is located in the Los Rios province. 

He makes a living in agriculture. He also raises cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to improve production so that he can support his family. His dream is to buy a large piece of land and to continue cultivating. In his spare time, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Pablo Elmer

texts.es: Pablo es un hombre de 24 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 4 meses de edad. Él se gana la vida con sus cultivos de ejote, mora y espinaca, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años y que le permite sostener a su familia tratando siempre de darles lo mejor. Pablo desea darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, por lo que ha decidido construir un cuarto de ladrillo y cemento para cambiar el de lámina ya que siente que este no cuenta con la seguridad necesaria para habitar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto de ladrillo y cemento para vivir con su familia. Agradece el apoyo recibido en el pasado.
texts.en: Pablo is a man of 24 years of age who lives in his own house along with his life companion and their four-month-old daughter. He earns a living with his crops of green beans, blackberries, and spinach, an activity that he has been doing for 6 years and that allows him to support his family, always trying to give them the best. Pablo wants to give better living conditions to his family, and so he has decided to build a brick and cement room in order to replace one of metal sheeting, since he feels that this doesn't have the necessary security to live in. For this reason, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a room of brick and cement for his family. He is grateful for the support he has received in the past.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a brick and cement room for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and outriggers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en: Jeanny is a 42-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines.  She is married and has eight children. Jeanny supports her husband in their fishing business. For more than 20 years now, fishing has provided them the income that they need. She also earns additional income through her hog raising. Jeanny is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional piglets to raise. With a loan, she will be able to improve her business, thus augmenting her profit and income.  Jeanny’s future plans include the expansion of their fishing and hog raising businesses. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 15 years. Arlene also earns income from fishing. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old and married with four children, who all attend in school.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Gemma aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Li

texts.es: Ayudar a las personas en sus problemas de salud así como brindar atención humanista e integral a las mismas ha sido el motivo por el cual Flor eligió su carrera, siente vocación por dar lo mejor de ella a los demás, estudia los sábados el cuarto año de Enfermeria. Tiene 21 años de edad y esta soltera. Se siente satisfecha con su carrera porque está poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en los hospitales de su ciudad, al igual que se siente agradecida con el apoyo recibido de sus padres. Además de asistir a la universidad y realizar sus prácticas da clases comunitarias y recibe ayuda por parte del ministerio de la familia. Solicita el crédito para el pago de sus módulos y así poder obtener su título universitario porque toda la vida ha soñado ser alguien que aporte mucho a la sociedad. Con el título en manos lograra insertarse en el campo laboral. Su plan futuro una vez culminados sus estudios es tener un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Helping people with their health problems and to provide humanistic and holistic attention to them has been the reason why Flor chose her career.  She feels her vocation is to give the best to others.  She is studying nursing every Saturday.

She is 21 years old and is single. She is satisfied with his career because she is putting into practice the knowledge acquired in hospitals in the city.  Equally she is grateful for the support received from her parents. Besides attending college and doing her internship, she gives community classes and receives help from the Ministry of the Family.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her courses and thereby obtain a college degree because all her life, she has dreamed of being someone who contributes much to society. With the diploma in hand, she will enter the workplace. Her future plan upon completion of her studies is to have a decent job.

loans.use: to pay for her courses.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old and married with three children, who are all in school.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Edna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a second hand business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, pants, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve

loans.name: Cruz Amparo

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos d 13 y 6 años de edad viven en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y abonos para sembrar maiz para mejorar la producción para obtener mas ingresos para sus hijos, Su sueño es realizar un galpon de gallinas, es su tiempo libre se dedica a su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is 34 years old and a single mother with two children, ages 13 and 6. They live in San Miguel in Bolivar Province. She is a member of the San Francisco Communal Bank.

Cruz works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost so that she can plant corn. This will improve her production so that she can generate more income for her children. Her dream is to build a henhouse. In her free time, she enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for planting corn.

loans.name: Dharani Group

texts.en:
Dharani is a Self Help Group of 10 active and energetic women from Dumerbahal village of Khariar Block of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. This group was formed in Nov. 2014 with the purpose of raising the income level of their families by development of their existing small enterprises. The featured member, Jajnaseni, is one of them. She is 33 and standing in the middle raising her hand in the photo. She lives with her husband and two sons. Boith her sons are attending school.
 
Jajnaseni has been maintaining her family by doing a small business of making sweets and selling them with the help of her husband for the last 15 years. She especially makes a locally popular sweet named “Khudma” (fried dough dipped in sugar syrup). Her husband supplies the product in the local market with his moped every day to the wholesalers as per their orders. She also supplies sweets for social functions in their village as per the order of the customer. Jajnaseni and her husband cook for six hours in an open fire every day making 50-60 kg of sweets with a daily expenditure of Rs 2,500/-. From this business, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR, which is not enough to meet the regular expenses and to think of the future. She says that the prices of raw materials are changing very frequently and that she has been a victim of the price rise many times due to her frequent replenishment cycle. To safeguard from price fluctuation, the present loan will be used by Jajnaseni to buy raw materials like dough, oil, sugar, and firewood in bulk and store them. This will also help her to save the repeated transportation and purchasing costs. Jajnaseni dreams of repairing her old house with an extension and giving a better education to her children. So she and her husband are working very hard to save money to materialize their cherished dream. The other nine members of the group also have small enterprises like selling sweet items, tailoring, running a Tiffin stall, repairing bikes and cultivating vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like dough, oil, sugar, and firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 48 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Flordeliz works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Flordeliz has been in this business for 26 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Flordeliz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан, 59 лет, замужем, воспитала 5 детей. Токтокан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Токтокан имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 15 овец. На зиму заготовлено 200 тюков сена, ячмень и пшеница, в качестве корма для скота. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Токтокан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 59 years old, married and has raised five children. As a main source of income for her family, Toktokan started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in 2010. 

Thanks to her persistent work, Toktokan currently has three cows, one horse and 15 sheep on her farm. She has prepared 200 bales of hay, barley and wheat as livestock feed for the winter. The business brings in a monthly income for 25,000 som (KGS).

Toktokan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two bull-calves. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy two bull-calves for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Yoni Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Yoni Maribel se sigue dedicando al negocio de salon de belleza,la soci por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia es una mujer emprendedora,el sueño de la socia es abrir otro salon de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tintes y tijeras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yoni Maribel continues to manage her beauty salon business. As a result, she is able to move forward. She is an enterprising woman who dreams of opening another beauty salon.

Yoni Maribel is requesting a loan in order to buy dyes and scissors. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Darihan

texts.ru: Дарихан 62 года, вдова, есть взрослый сын и трехгодовалый внук. У Дарихан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2010году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Дарихан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 10 овец и земельный надел мерою 0,45 ГА, где она выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание внука. Поэтому Дарихан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) для закупки семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Дарихан намерена свои доходы от кредита направить на воспитание любимого внука.
texts.en:
Darihan is 62 years old and a widow. She has a grown-up son and a three year old grandchild. Darihan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having started this business in 2010. 

Thanks to Darihan's persistent, purposeful and hard work, she currently has 10 sheep and a plot of land of 0.45 hectares, where she grows wheat and sweet corn. The monthly income from the business is around 5,000 som (KGS). Catastrophically, this money is not enough for a decent life and raising her grandchild. 

Therefore Darihan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) to purchase potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. Darihan intends to spend the income from the loan on education for her beloved grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow organic vegetables and increase her income

loans.name: Nurkan

texts.ru: Нуркан 42 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Нуркан среднее образование, она работает в больнице санитаром. С 1994 года занимается животноводством, мастер в своем деле. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Нуркан есть 1 корова. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Нуркан составляет 10,000 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 15,000 сом(KGS) на покупку 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Нуркан направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurkan is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children. Nurkan has secondary education. She works as a medical orderly. Since 1994 she has also worked with livestock breeding, and is a master of her trade. Her family actively helps her with the farm. Currently Nurkan has one cow. Nurkan's combined monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to increase the number of cattle, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow. Nurkan will spend the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es: Nelson es un joven de 25 años de edad quien tiene muy buenas referencias personales sobre su integridad y responsabilidad en su comunidad. Nelson es un joven que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y dar a su familia mejores condiciones. Ha tomado la decisión de terminar de construir su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de polines, teja, puertas, madera, cemento, arena, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder finalizar su vivienda y dar a su familia mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Nelson is a young man, just 25 years old, who comes with very good personal references concerning his integrity and responsibility in his community. Nelson is a youngster who has put forth much effort to get ahead and provide his family with better living conditions.

He has made the decision to finish constructing his home and, therefore, he is requesting this loan through FUSAI to invest in purchasing rafters, tile, doors, wood cement, sand, etc.

Nelson hopes he can count on this financing to be able to finish his house and offer his family greater stability.

loans.use: to buy rafters, tile, doors, wood cement, sand, etc. to finish his house.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis de 35 años de edad es soltero y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre responsable y trabajador desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de electricista con el cual se ha sabido ganar la vida desde hace 14 años, además cultiva la tierra para cosechar frijoles y maíz para el consumo de su hogar. Luis ha observado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, ya que en época lluviosa sus pocas pertenencias se vieron afectadas por las lluvias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is 35 years old, single and lives in his own home with his 3 children aged 14, 12 and 6 years old. He is a responsible and hardworking man.

From a young age, he learned the trade of electrician and this is how he has made a living for 14 years.  He also cultivates the land to harvest beans and corn for home consumption.

Luis says that the roof of his house is damaged.  During the rainy season, their few belongings were damaged by the rains.  This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, nails and wood to replace the roof of his home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, nails and wood to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first prepay microgrid.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: Salvador tiene 56 años de edad, es residente de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla, inició su negocio de alquiler de sillas, mesas y manteles en el año 2004, su idea de negocio surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos puesto que se encontraba sin empleo, decidió comprar inicialmente unas sillas y con las utilidades adquirió unas cuantas mesas y manteles, de esa manera amplió los servicios para ofrecer en las celebraciones. Sus principales clientes son colegios, salones de eventos, habitantes del sector y de barrios aledaños al sector, a quienes les ofrece el servicio los fines de semana y días festivos.  Este negocio maneja un buen flujo de caja, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual renovará las sillas que se encuentran en mal estado y comprará nuevas mesas para cubrir la demanda. Esta inversión permitirá dar una mejor presentación a su actividad y con ello lograr la preferencia ante los clientes.  Salvador tiene como meta de negocio a futuro incorporar el alquiler de platos, vasos y servicio de decoración de fiestas, pese a su escaso capital su gran desafío es acelerar el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Salvador is 56 years old. He is a resident of a neighborhood located in the city of Barranquilla. He started his business of renting chairs, tables, and tablecloths in the year 2004. 

His business idea arose from a need to generate income because he found himself unemployed. He decided initially to buy some chairs; with the profits, he acquired a few tables and tablecloths. That's how he expanded his services to offer them for celebrations. His main customers are schools, event halls, and residents of the area and of nearby neighborhoods; he offers them his service on weekends and holidays. This business maintains a good cash flow. 

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Santo Domingo. With it, he will refurbish the chairs that are in bad condition and buy new tables to meet demand. This investment will allow him to better present his business and gain his customers' loyalty. Salvador's business goal is to incorporate rental of plates and glasses and party decorating services in the future. Due to his scarce capital, his great challenge is speeding up the growth of his business.

loans.use: he will refurbish the chairs that are in bad condition and he will buy new tables to meet demand

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various household merchandise including noodles, canned goods, bottled soy sauce, sugar, coffee, biscuits, soft drinks and toiletries. She is married and has three children ages 15, 12 and 4 years old, respectively. She is a 38-year-old woman  and a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. Her husband earns an income by means of fishing. He is a fisherman.

Myrna is asking for a loan to buy additional grocery items like chips, seasonings, noodles, canned goods and fishing materials like fishing net.  These materials will be very essential in filling her store with various stocks, thus attracting more customers to shop and purchase. This is also a big help for her husband to increase his catch.
 
In the future, she is hoping that she can handle her current livelihood successfully to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items like chips, seasonings, noodles, canned goods and fishing materials like fishing net

loans.name: Maripa

texts.ru: Марипа, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей- школьников. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она в 2005 году начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Марипы на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 3 лошади, 20 овец, также 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает чеснок и пшеницу для реализации. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марипа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Maripa is 42 years old, married and the mother of two children of school age. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS). 

Maripa currently has three cows, three horses and 20 sheep on her farm. She also has 1.0 hectares of own land, where she grows garlic and wheat to sell. The combined monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Maripa turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Secundina

texts.es: Secundina es una mujer humilde de 55 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que al lado de su esposo siempre ha trabajado la tierra sosteniendo la economía de su hogar con el cultivo de güisquil, espinaca, ejotes, frijoles y maíz los cuales vende para obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia. Secundina desea cambiar las láminas de las paredes y el techo de su vivienda ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas del techo y las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Secundina is a humble woman of 55 years of age.  She lives in her own home with her husband and son. She is an enterprising woman.  Along side her husband, she has always worked the land to sustain their family income.

She does this by growing greens, spinach, green beans, beans and corn which she sells for the income needed to raise her family. Secundina wants to replace the sections of the walls and ceiling of her home as these are damaged.

For this reason she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to replace the sections of the ceiling and walls her home.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to replace the ceiling and walls of her home.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos ya mayores de edad que le apoyan con la economía de su hogar. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar la tierra actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 10 años. Luis desea reparar la cocina de su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para reparar la cocina de su vivienda y poder contar con un lugar más adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old. He lives in his own house with his life companion and their two adult children, who contribute to the household finances. He is a hardworking man who learned to cultivate the land from a very young age. This activity has allowed him to support his family for the last ten years. 

Luis would like to repair the kitchen of his house, as it has deteriorated, as the photograph shows. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire in order to repair the kitchen of his residence and to be able to have a more appropriate place to prepare their food.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire in order to repair the kitchen of his residence

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Narcizo es un hombre de 56 años de edad, casado, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie.
Narcizo es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello gris, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado; él realiza la compra de ganado vacuno, lo alimenta, se ocupa de ponerle las vacunas necesarias, y una vez gordo y grande lo vende. También realiza la venta de leche, sus clientes son productores queseros que lo buscan constantemente para ordeñar sus vacas. Ambas actividades relacionadas ocupan todo su tiempo de la semana. “en invierno debido al frío y al escaso forraje, el ganado no produce la suficiente leche, en verano es época buena para el engorde porque las lluvias alimentan los pajonales…’ comenta. Su sueño es construir un establo más grande dónde pueda acoger mayor cantidad de ganado. Él desea realizar la compra de un terreno para plantar pasto y contar con alimento para el ganado en invierno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Narcizo solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno, forraje, pago de vacunas y con los beneficios ampliara su establo.
texts.en:
Narcizo is a man of 56. He is married, with independent children, and his business is selling livestock.

He is entrepreneurial, independent, reliable, responsible, and hard-working. His business takes place in the community of Batallas, which is located in the vicinity of Lake Titicaca. It is an agricultural area where livestock such as cattle and sheep are raised. The population lives from fishing and also from vegetables of the area, such as quinoa, dried potatoes, beans, potatoes, etc. The area is characterized by a cold climate where rays from the sun strike the surface forcefully.

Narcizo has a dark complexion, short stature, and gray hair. His mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in the area. For business, he speaks Spanish. He lives with his wife, who works in agriculture. They live in a house made of adobe that has electricity and well water. His business is selling livestock. He makes the purchase of cattle, he feeds them, he takes care to give them the necessary vaccinations, and once they are large and fattened, he sells them. He also sells milk. His customers are the cheese producers who constantly seek milk from his cows. Both related activities occupy all his time during the week. "In winter, due to the cold and the scarce forage, the cattle don't product sufficient milk. In summer, it is a good time to fatten them because the rains nourish the scrublands," he comments. His dream is to build a bigger stable where he can shelter a larger number of cattle. He wants to make the purchase of a plot of land to plant pasture and have feed for the livestock in winter. This is his first loan with the institution in the 25 years that he has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Narcizo is applying for a loan to purchase cattle, fodder, and vaccines, and with the earnings he will enlarge his stable.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, fodder, and vaccines, and with the earnings he will enlarge his stable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Amada works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Amada is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: renovate her sewing machine.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of five children, from Iloilo, Philippines.  She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now. Fishing is her source of income. Julieta is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and a new boat engine. Julieta believes that this loan will help her improve her fishing business.  Julieta hopes to expand her fishing business if everything turns out well in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and a new boat engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, purlins, and cement to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 31-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She has one child.  Elsie works with her husband in their fishing business.  Fishing is a very good venture in their place. Elsie and her husband have been earning an income through fishing for more than six years now. Elsie is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. With a boat, Elsie and her husband will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. Elsie hopes to improve their livelihood and save money for the future schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy  a new fishing boat

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is a 59-year-old fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is married and a father of three grown up children. Rene has been in the fishing business for more than 30 years now. Fishing is a lucrative business. Rene is asking to take a loan to buy a new motor engine for the fishing boat. With a loan, Rene will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Rene hopes of expanding his fishing business and making it a successful one.

loans.use: to buy a new motor engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 43-year-old married woman with eight children. Seven of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.
