Arlene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es una mujer de 49 años de edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijos de 32, 31, 25 y 21 años y su negocio es la producción y venta de queso artesanal.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, buena madre, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de ‘Higachi’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie.
Alicia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su hijo menor que se dedica a la agricultura  porque el resto de sus hijos ya son independientes. Viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal; ella se encarga de producir leche bajo los parámetros exigidos en una explotación ganadera lechera, y espera lograr una producción de entre 4 y 6 litros/vaca/día de leche, dependiendo si es criolla o mejorada. En sus inicios toda su producción se destinaba a la venta de leche fresca, posteriormente perfeccionó sus procesos y la transformó en queso. La venta la realiza al menudeo en la feria de la comunidad los días sábados desde las 4 de la madrugada, y durante la semana ofertando en cada domicilio de su comunidad y a visitantes y/ó turistas. “el problema más común que enfrentamos es la escases de la leche especialmente en temporada de invierno, esto hace que el precio del queso suba porque la leche es escasa…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con un establo amplio y pajonales abultados para realizar su trabajo sin problemas. Ella desea realiza la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar la elaboración de queso. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Alicia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para mejorar su producción de queso.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 49 year old widow with 4 children, aged 32, 31, 25 and 21 and her business is the production and sale of artisan cheese.  She is independent, enterprising, a good mother, steady, responsible and hardworking. Her business is  located in the community of 'Higachi' characterized by its proximity to the sacred Lake Titicaca.  This is an agricultural area where cattle are raised as well as sheep.  People also make their living from fishing and planting, such as quinoa, potato flour, bean, potato, etc.   The area is known for its cold weather, with temperatures ranging daytime 1-12 degrees Celsius and where the sunshine is also strong.

Alicia is dark-complected, with long braided black hair.  Her dress is traditional (hat, blanket and skirt),  Her native tongue is Aymara  though she speaks Spanish in the workplace. Her life is shared with her younger son who works in agriculture because the rest of her children are independent. They live in a house built of adobe with a thatched roof.  It has electricity and well water.  Her business is the manufacture and sale of artisan cheese.  She is in charge of producing milk based on the output of the dairy farm, and hopes to produce between 4 and 6 liters of milk per cow per day, depending on the breed.  At its inception entire production was destined for the sale of fresh milk, then she perfected her process for making cheese. 

The sale (of cheese) is made at the markets in the community, Saturdays, from 4 in the morning, and during the week, she sells door-to-door in her community and to visitors and tourists. "The most common problem we face is the shortage of milk especially in winter.  This makes the price of cheese rise because milk is scarce ..." she says.

His dream is to have a large and sturdy stable to carry out their work smoothly. She wants to make the purchase of dairy cows to increase their milk production and improve the production of cheese. This is the 3rd round of loans with the institution in the 16 years that she has been engaged in this activity independently.  It is for these reasons that Alicia is requesting a loan for the purchase of dairy cattle to increase their cheese production.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle to increase her cheese production.

loans.name: Yhanita

texts.en: Yhanita is a food vendor from Iloilo, Philippines.  She is 36-years-old, married, and has four children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is two.  Yhanita is a very hardworking woman. She wants to give her best to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.  Yhanita sells snack foods to the people in her place.  She has been in the business for more than  a year now. Yhanita is asking to take a loan to buy ingredients for food selling such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers. In the future, Yhanita hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save some of her earnings for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food selling such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hull for the boat and floaters.

loans.name: Sopheas's Group

texts.en: Sopheas’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sopheas works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bunthean's Group

texts.en: Bunthean’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Bunthean makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Julieta is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en: Vorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller by selling sugar juice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Inn's Group

texts.en: Inn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Inn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Charry

texts.en: Charry is a 45-year-old fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is a married and has been in the fishing business for more than seven years now. Charry is asking to take a loan to buy fishing materials such as nets, outriggers and a new boat engine. With a loan, he will be able to improve his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Charry hopes to make his business of fishing more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, outriggers and a new boat engine

loans.name: Maritchil

texts.en:
Maritchil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Maritchil has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams that she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business. She successfully repaid her three previous loans and is requesting this loan to further build her businesses.

Nonita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 45-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She has three children. Gina runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Gina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Gina wants to expand her business and make it a success. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Hazilyn

texts.en: Hazilyn is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, from Iloilo, Philippines.  Hazilyn helps her husband in their fishing business. Fishing is their source of making a living. Hazilyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With a loan, Hazilyn and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  Hazilyn hopes to improve her fishing business in order to generate more revenue. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Patricia has been in farming activities as her source of income, and earns a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is 54 years old, married to Bonface and blessed with five children.

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, and intends to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs to improve farm yield.

Patricia will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and get good money to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 44-years-old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juvilyn has a rice selling business in the Philippines. Juvilyn has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Juvilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Juvilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Evangeline is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ulfiana

texts.en:
Ulfiana is 42-years-old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

Ulfiana is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ulfiana requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables.

Ulfiana has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ulfiana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 46-years-old, married and has five children. Two of her children are in school.

Lilia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lilia has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mizel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mizel works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed plantation business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling meat. Mizel is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for her seaweed plantation business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mizel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: A los 32 años Karla comenzó su negocio ya que quería independizarse para ser su propia jefa, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos etc. con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora es un negocio pujante y sólido. Su familia la ha apoyado en todo momento, esta soltera y no tiene hijos. Sus expectativas son crecer, prosperar y ampliar el negocio hasta convertirlo en una mini tienda. Solicita el crédito para comprar Camisas, Pantalones, Zapatos, Cosméticos entre otros. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que la temporada es buena y quiere aprovecharla. Dentro de sus planes futuros está comprar un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Karla began her business at age 32 because she wanted to become more independent and be her own boss.  She works selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.  With time, her business has grown and now it is a booming, solid business.  Her family has always been supportive of her.  She is single and doesn’t have any kids.  

Her hope is to grow, prosper, and expand her business until she can convert it into a small store.  She is asking for a loan to buy shirts, pants, shoes, and cosmetics, among other items.  The loan will be a big help to her because this season is good and she wants to take advantage of it.  Among her future plans is buying a stand in the market.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shoes, and cosmetics, among other items.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 25 years old and is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $60.00. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, oils, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, and water. She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past five years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, oils, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, and water

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana has been involved in business activities since 2010. She started her business with her own working capital of $500. She is requesting a loan of $1,000.00 from Kiva partner Tuba Rai Metin in order to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more secondhand clothes including  trousers, shorts, shirts, jackets, children's clothes, long-sleeved shirts and other things to sell. She is very hopeful that with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her management of her business. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, shirts, jackets, children's clothes, long-sleeved shirts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Đoài Đạo Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Tuyến works in agriculture raising livestock. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tuyến is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn Đoài Đạo xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. In 2013, Tuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyến has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Tuyến hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 63 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo de 29 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Él es independiente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Pedro es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, ojos marrones, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hijo que cursa estudios técnicos en agropecuaria. Viven en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la sastrería; dónde su creatividad y experiencia se ajustan a la medida de los clientes. Entre paños, linos, agujas y moldes han transcurrido los últimos 20 años, él confecciona pantalones y chaquetas a medida y también modifica todo tipo de prendas según el capricho de sus clientes, consiente de la importancia del buen vestir, disfruta tanto de su trabajo que hasta se siente diseñador y sugiere a sus clientes, con creatividad, sobre la ropa que pueden usar. Él tiene una mesa de corte, donde comienza la aventura; con agilidad, precisión y rapidez, cualidades a las que le suma esmero y dedicación, esas manos ven el resultado: una prenda de vestir hecha a la medida. “confeccionamos uniformes para la escuela del lugar, también overoles para los agricultores, el único problema es la tela, que debemos traer desde la ciudad…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con un taller grande, él desea abastecer su negocio mediante la compra de tela por mayor para contar con material de trabajo. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pedro solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para abastecer su negocio y contar con material de trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 63-year-old man who is married and has one 29-year-old son. His business is tailoring.

He is independent, persevering, active, responsible, and hardworking. He runs his business in the town of Batallas, which is known for its proximity to sacred Lake Titicaca. It's an agricultural area where livestock are raised (cattle, sheep, and camelids). People live off of fishing and also the local vegetables, like quinoa, potato flour, broad beans, potatoes, etc. The town is known for its cold climate, with daytime temperatures ranging from 2 to 12 degrees Celsius and intense rays of sunshine striking its surface.

Pedro has brown skin, short black hair, medium stature, and brown eyes; his mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for business. He shares his life with his wife, who works in the same business, and his son, who is studying agriculture in a technical school. They live in a house built of adobe that has drinkable water, electricity, and sewer service. 

In his tailoring business, he custom matches his creativity and experience to his clients' needs. He has spent the last twenty years among cloth, linen, needles, and patterns. He makes pants and jackets to order and he also alters all types of garments according to his clients' wishes, aware of the importance of dressing well. He enjoys his work so much that he even feels like a designer, making creative suggestions to his clients about the clothing that they might wear. 

He has a cutting table, where he begins the adventure. With dexterity, precision, and speed—qualities joined by conscientiousness and dedication—those hands can see the result: a custom-made garment. "We sew uniforms for the local school, as well as overalls for the farmers. The only problem is the fabric, which we must bring from the city," he says. 

His dream is to have a large workshop. He would like to supply his business through the purchase of fabric at wholesale in order to have work materials. This is his second round of loans with the institution in the 20 years that he has been carrying out this activity.

These are the reasons that Pedro is requesting a loan for the purchase of wholesale fabric in order to supply his business and have work materials.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale in order to stock up his business and have work supplies

loans.name: 03.04.63 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lý operates a food stall selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to resell.

Lý is 35 years old and she is married with two children.

Lý is the group leader of the  03.04.63 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years.

The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

loans.name: 03.07.09 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Dung is 22 years old and she is married with one child.

Dung is the group leader of the  03.07.09 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Dung has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a room rental business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business.

Marissa has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business.

Alma has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 44 years old and married with four children—three children are currently in school. Amor works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, canned goods, sugar etc. Amor has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Amor would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, canned goods, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 46 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her general store. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds, canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Analou

texts.en:
Maria Analou is 32 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for three years. Maria Analou has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Maria Analou would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 44 years old and a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Daisy has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

Marjorie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her fruit stand.

She has been in this business for six years now.

Marjorie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are all attend in school. 

Jojie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jojie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nancy has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from vegetable vending.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell beauty products business in the Philippines.

Nanette requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of beauty products to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for five years now.

Nanette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Tarasio

texts.en:
Tarasio is a 54-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, alongside farming and rentals, to earn extra income. He started this business so as to generate income to meet family demands. He hopes to buy a lorry for business, however his main challenges are price fluctuation and high transport costs. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of coffee, maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee, maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a salary earner, and at the same time he is a tea grower. He hopes to  have a good-looking and fully-furnished house. He meets challenges of seasonality changes and delayed salary payment. Geofrey needs a loan to buy ceiling materials for the house he is constructing.

loans.use: to buy ceiling materials for the the house he is constructing.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo engages in a rice vending business. He buys and  sells rice on a retail basis to the people in his community. He is a 36-year-old married man from Mcarthur, Leyte. He is a father of three children aged 9,5 and 1 year old respectively. 

Nilo  is asking for a loan in order to buy additional sacks of rice to resell. These will help Nilo sell more quantity of rice to his respective customers. In this way, his income will improve and he could now start to pay his obligations. He can afford to buy nutritious foods for the whole family.

Nilo hopes to expand his business to support the needs of his growing children. He also wants his children to finish their studies to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a primary school teacher in Bundibugyo, and he works so hard to maintain his job. He has been in this service for six years and is very happy with it. He hopes to get more assets that can generate income due to the fact that he complains of low salary payment. James wants a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than two years now.  Fishing is their main source of livelihood. Jovita is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new boat engine. With a loan, Jovita and her husband will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, Jovita hopes to improve the sustainability of their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new boat engine

loans.name: Roggers

texts.en:
Roggers is a 35-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has three children and he is a primary school teacher. He is a hardworking man and has stayed in the service for eight years. He looks after his family and also takes care of his mother and uncle. He hopes to build and complete his house. 
Roggers will use the loan to construct his house by buying building materials like sand and timber.

loans.use: to construct his house by buying building materials like sand and timber.

loans.name: Esmiralda

texts.en:
Esmiralda is 36-years-old, from the village Arsarvani. She lives with her husband and both family members are involved in an agricultural business. Esmiralda takes care of milking the cow, producing milk-products for local trading and for family use also. They cultivate a plot of agricultural land, where potatoes are grown, which is also used for seasonal trading.

In spite of their activity, the family finds it hard to meet all their basic needs and cover everyday expenses. As it becomes harder to earn a living, Esmiralda decided to expand her business. She requested a loan to a local financial institution for business start-ups and was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start their own activities. 

With the requested loan amount of 2,000 GEL she plans to cover all expenses that are connected with the preparation of hay and after this she will sell at good prices locally. The demand is high and she will generate a significant amount of money from this new initiative. 

Esmiralda and her husband will be really grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide.

loans.use: To prepare hay for selling and get a seasonal income

loans.name: Grupo No Me Olvides Group

texts.es:
Desde la carretera que conduce a la localidad rodeada de caña de azúcar se puede apreciar un grato paisaje, pero una vez que inicia el período de corte, las casas quedan al descubierto. En este lugar se creó el grupo No Me Olvides que está conformado por: 

Julia - Venta De Pollo
Lucia y Mena - Venta De Antojitos
Aurelia - Venta De Refrescos
Gregorio – Venta De Pizza Y Calzado
Lorena y Sara - Venta De Dulces
Maura - Venta De Hot-Dog
Marina - Venta Abarrotes

Doña Lucía tiene 48 años de edad, estudió hasta 5 año de primaria y está casado con Jesús, actualmente sólo un hijo depende de ellos. Hace tres años Doña Lucía inició con la venta de antojitos (empanadas, tacos dorados, tostadas, picaditas) chicharrones, cacahuates que ofrece de lunes a viernes afuera de una escuela y los fines de semana en el campo donde los habitantes juegan béisbol o fútbol y ella aprovecha para divertirse. Al iniciar su actividad no tenía en mente nada más que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, además de que le gusta sentirse útil y productiva. 

Doña Lucía se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana para preparar, primeramente el lonche de su esposo y después los antojitos que vende. El sazón de su comida, el trato a los clientes, en su mayoría estudiantes, y los precios son los factores que han permitido que su negocio continúe adelante. 

Lucía ha utilizado sus ganancias y los préstamos anteriores para comprar los ingredientes y materiales que más utiliza en su negocio y así tener la posibilidad de seguir trabajando. En esta ocasión necesita comprar platos desechables, aceite, papel de estraza, carne y una nevera para que la comida se conserve caliente. Más adelante le gustaría invertir en un pequeño techo para poder colocarlo en el lugar donde vende y protegerse del sol. 

Su  principal reto ha sido conservar los clientes, continuar vendiendo como hasta ahorita lo ha hecho.

"En una ocasión al pasarle el plato de comida a un alumno el plato se cayo y la comida cayo sobre mi, los jóvenes no dejaban de reír, Pedir y fiar arruinan la amistad pues hay quienes le pidieron en su momento comida fiada y ahora no le hablan"

El grupo agradece a cada una de las personas que han hecho posible se les otorgue un préstamo para invertirlo en sus actividades y prosperar día a día.

*La fotografía fue capturada en el parque del municipio al que pertenece la comunidad, las clientas quisieron salir cerca del árbol de navidad. Doña Lucía viste una falda negra y blusa rosa.
texts.en:
From the road that leads to the town, surrounded by sugar cane, one sees a pleasing landscape—but once harvest time begins, the houses are revealed.  The group, No Me Olvides [Forget Me Not] was created here. It comprises Julia, who sells chickens; Lucia and Mena, who sell antojitos (traditional corn-based dishes); Aurelia, who sells soft drinks; Gregorio, who sells pizza and footwear; Lorena and Sara, who sell sweets; Maura, who sells hot dogs; and Marina, who sells groceries.



Doña Lucia is 48 years old, and she studied until the 5th year of primary school.  She is married to Jesús, and currently only one child depends upon them.  Three years ago, Doña Lucia started selling antojitos (empanadas, fried tacos, and tortillas), fried pork rinds, and peanuts. She sells them outside a school Monday through Friday, and on weekends, at the playing field where the local people go to have fun playing baseball or soccer.  When she started out, she had nothing more in mind than helping her husband with the household expenses.  Also, she liked feeling useful and productive.


Doña Lucia gets up at 5 in the morning. First, she makes her husband’s lunch, and then she makes the antojitos that she will sell. The flavor of her food, the way she treats her customers—primarily students—and her prices, are the things that have allowed her business to grow.

Lucia has used her earnings and the previous loans to purchase the ingredients and materials that she uses the most in her business, thus making it possible to continue working.  On this occasion she needs to purchase disposable plates, oil, brown paper, meat, and a cooler to keep the food hot.  In the future, she would like to invest in a small canopy that she could place where she sells her food, so that she can protect herself from the sun.

Her principal challenge has been to keep her customers and to continue making sales, and so far she has done so.  She relates that on one occasion, a plate of food dropped and spilled on her when she was passing it to a student, and the kids couldn’t stop laughing.  She also says that requesting and giving credit can ruin a friendship, as some people have asked for food on credit at the time, and now they don’t speak to her.

The group thanks every person who has made it possible for them to receive a loan, so that they can invest it in their occupations and prosper day by day.

The photograph was taken in the community’s municipal park, as the group wanted to be near the Christmas tree.  Doña Lucia is wearing a black skirt and a pink blouse.

loans.use: to purchase disposable plates, oil, brown paper, meat, and a cooler.

loans.name: Divinas Y Famosas Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento DIVINAS Y FAMOSAS está compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones, todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios todas ellas se conocen entre si ya que viven por la misma zona.
La presidenta del banco es la señora Ana (en la foto la de solera rosada) es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos de 8 gemelos, 5 y 3  años, y su actividad es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, buena madre, emprendedora, y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona del plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, un área popular caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas, de clima tropical con una temperatura entre 27 – 32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Ana es de tez trigueña, cabello largo, su lengua materna es el español,  Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción los mayor está iniciando la escuela y los menores se encuentra a su cuidado. Su actividad es la venta de comidas típicas del lugar, como; Locro de gallina (sopa; pollo dorado, arroz, papas picadas), Majadito (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito y huevo), zonzos en pacumuto (yuca molida con queso a la parrilla), todo acompañado de refrescos tradicionales como; Chicha (preparada en base a maíz) y Somó(similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz). Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que lleva con esta actividad. Su sueño es tener un restaurante, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "Divinas y Famosas” is made up of eight members, six of whom are women and two of whom are men.  They work in a variety of jobs such as: car upholstering, juice and smoothie sales, cell phone cover sales, juice sales, perfume sales, beverage sales, and clothing sales.  In order to ask for a loan and expand their businesses, they have gotten together, because they all live in the same area.

The bank president is Ana (wearing a pink tank top in the photo) is a 24-year-old woman.  She lives with her partner.  She has four children: eight-year-old twins, a five-year-old, and a three-year-old.  Her business is selling meals.

She is independent, hardworking, enterprising, and very responsible, and she is a good mother.  She does her job in the Plan 3000 neighborhood of the city of Santa Cruz, a popular area known for its commercial growth in all areas.  It has a tropical climate with a temperature that ranges from 27 to 32 degrees Celsius all year long.

Ana is olive-skinned and has long hair.  Her native language is Spanish.  She lives her life with her partner who works in construction.  Her oldest children are starting school, while the younger ones are under her care.  Her job is selling local, traditional foods such as “Locro de gallina” (a soup made of chicken, rice, and chopped potatoes), “Majadito" (dehydrated meat, rice, fried plantain, and egg), and “Zonzos en Pacumuto” (ground yuca with grilled cheese).  All of these are served with traditional drinks such as Chicha (a drink made with a corn base) and Somo (similar to Chicha but including boiled corn).  This is her first loan cycle with this institution in two years of being in this business.  Her dream is to have a restaurant, and she wants to expand her business by purchasing tables and chairs to take better care of her customers.  It is because of these reasons that Ana is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs, in order to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is a single mother of one son. She and her family live in El Alto. Rosario has a liquor store, and she needs a loan to purchase more wine, beer, and other beverages in order to increase her income. Rosario is a responsible businesswoman who treats her clients very well, and she is healthy. She will greatly appreciate the help from Kiva. Rosario expects that in the future, she will have their own house (currently she pays rent) and a better liquor store.

loans.use: to purchase more wine, beer and other beverages.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for two years. Flordeliza earns more income from buy and sell fish and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell to customers.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Phillipo

texts.en: Phillipo is a twenty eight year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in livestock rearing alongside farming to earn him an extra income. He started this business to get money to educate his children. He hopes to be a prominent businessman, however his main challenge is inadequate capital. He is requesting for a loan to buy more goats to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more goats to add to his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm for the next season.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a forty three year old female who is married with five children and lives in Kasese Uganda. Scovia used the previous loan to buy salt for selling. Scovia has sold crude salt for sixteen years now and gets additional income from a retail shop of general merchandise. Scovia has a dream of educating her children. Scovia is faced with the challenge of weather changes. She wants money to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas is a maize farmer from Auchan village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Anas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Anas can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Anas, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Samaila is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nathan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nathan can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Nathan is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Tyopolos and Loise.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Musa  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniform,  thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL MUJERES DE FORTALEZA ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES, MADRES SOLTERAS CON QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTOR DE LECHE, QUESO,  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER RESPONSABLES, TRABAJADORAS, CON SOLVENCIA DE PAGO TODAS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS,  Y LUCHAN POR SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS NEGOCIO PARA PODER PROPORCIONARLE  A SUS FAMILIAS UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.
GRACIAS  A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES CORINA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA CRIANZA  Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE,  ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTOS, ELLA VIAJA UNA VEZ POR SEMANA FUERA A COMUNIDADES ALEDAÑAS A ENTREGAR CERDOS EN PIE A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES. El OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. MUJERES DE FORTALEZA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Fortaleza communal bank is made up of eight members—single mothers with fifteen children under their care.  They come from Sauce, a place known for producing milk and cheese.  They are known for being responsible, hardworking, with the ability to pay.  All of them have different jobs and fight to get their businesses ahead in order to give their families a better quality of life.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Corina is the coordinator.  Her line of work is raising and selling live pigs.  She does this work with a lot of enthusiasm.  Her daily routine is to work about twelve hours a day offering her products.  She travels once a week out to the nearby communities to deliver live pigs to her established and occasional customers alike.  The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that, in the not-so-distant future, she can get a better income.  

The Mujeres de Fortaleza are thankful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with limited resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a respectable means of income.

loans.use: to invest in the raising, buying, and selling of live pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ladies' and gentlemen's undergarments at wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Zenna

texts.en:
Ma. Zenna is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Ma. Zenna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, snack foods, biscuits, etc., to sell.

Ma. Zenna has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, snack foods, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Zenna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, snack foods, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 51 años de edad tiene 5 hijos viven en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.
Ella es empleada domestica y solicita el credito para arreglos de la casa como poner valdosa en los pisos, pintar, y comprar un baño, gracias al credito podra terminar su casita y vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Francisca is 51 years old and has 5 children. They all live in the Ventanas province of Los Rios. She works as a housekeeper. She is asking for the loan for home improvements, such as installing flooring, painting, and buying a bathroom. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to finish her small home and live in better conditions.

loans.use: with home improvements.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia engages in producing tuba (coconut) wine. She hails from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is 58 years old, with three children aged 16, 14 and 12. She has been into tuba vending for more than 20 years now.

She is in need of capital to venture into other source of income. Lydia requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy materials to open up a vulcanizing shop. Hopefully, this will help Lydia slowly improve her income. With this, she could roll back her capital to reinvest any possible business ventures. Thus, she could continue sending her children to school.

Lydia would like to be successful in managing both of her businesses, for a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to open up a vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna raises and sells hogs to support her family. She has been raising hogs for just a year now.  She is married and has six children. Her oldest child is 11 and the youngest is 10 months old. Her husband earns a living by being a laborer.  Aside from hog raising, she also engages in a rice retailing business.

Lorna is asking for a loan to buy additional sacks of rice, piglets and pig feed. These materials are very important in handling her livelihood again. Thus, creating more rice to sell and in the coming few months, she could raise and sell more hogs.

Lorna hopes to manage her livelihood properly to have a stable source of income and also improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Rosita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel used the previous loan to buy bulls and goats for selling. Emmanuel is a hardworking man married with ten children, living in Kasese Uganda. Emmanuel owns a butcher shop and has been in that business for twelve years. Emmanuel has a dream of educating his children and setting up new enterprises. However, he is faced with the challenge of high transport costs and debtors. Emmanuel will use the loan facility to buy bulls and goats for slaughtering during Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bulls and goats for slaughtering during Christmas season

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Simon joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Meshek, Samson and Sabatu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Simon would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Simon can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Simon spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulrahaman

texts.en: Abdulrahaman is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abdulrahaman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children:  Aliyu and Saminu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulrahaman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrahaman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Abdulrahaman spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rakiya

texts.en: Rakiya is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rakiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rakiya can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rakiya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer from Barau village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ayuba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de camarones desde hace varios años, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas camarones y comprar hieleras para cambiar algunas que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man's face has been blurred because he is 20 years old and he lives in a high-risk zone.  He has been selling shrimp for several years.  He lives in his own house with his family.  He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shrimp, and ice chests to replace some of the ones that are shown in the photograph.  In this way, he will be able to keep working in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more shrimp and ice chests.

loans.name: Claudina Janeth

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 40 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos en Ventanas provincia de Bolivar.

Ella solicita el credito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y semillas para sembrar maiz ya que no cuneta con el capital necesario para hacerlo, gracias al credito podra sembrar y obtener buenas ganancias para mantener a sus  hijos. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar mas y mejorar su situacion económica. En su tiempo libre le gusta cocer.
texts.en: Claudia is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Ventanas, Bolivar province. She is asking for the loan to buy materials, fertilizers, and seeds to plant corn. She currently does not have the necessary capital to do it; thanks to the loan, she will be able to plant and earn good income to support her children. Her dream is to buy herself land to plant more, and to improve her economic situation. In her free time, she likes to sew.

loans.use: to buy planting supplies.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy is sari-sari store owner from Iloilo, Philippines.  She is 37 years old, married and has three children. Amy has operated her sari-sari or variety store business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. Amy is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like rice, noodles, dried fish, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages, soap and detergents, toiletries, condiments and other items. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Amy wants to expand her store so that it will generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like rice, noodles, dried fish, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages, soap and detergents, toiletries, and condiments

loans.name: Rea

texts.en: Rea is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. Rea has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. Rea works hard to support her husband in their venture. Rea is requesting a loan to buy a new motor engine for the fishing boat. With a loan, Rea and her husband will be able to improve their catch, allowing them to sell more fish to the market.  In the future, Rea wants to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more income. Furthermore, she wants to save money to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new motor engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Olivia works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Olivia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Olivia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Linda Yamila

texts.es: Linda de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Linda está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Linda, 33, lives in her own house with her family.  She sells clothing on foot in different markets, and she has many customers because of the quality of the clothing and the good prices.  Linda is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale clothing so that she can continue with her sales and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a merchant from Iloilo, Philippines.  She is married and has one dependent. Jane runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Jane has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Jane is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments, soft drinks and beverages and others. With a loan she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.  In the future, Jane hopes of making her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments, soft drinks and beverages and other items.

loans.name: Morena Patricia

texts.es: Morena tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 9 años, 4 años y 2 años de edad. Morena es una mujer luchadora y comprometida con el bienestar de su familia. Morena se gana la vida por medio de la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y gracias a su carisma ya cuanta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Morena desea invertir en su negocio dado que en esta temporada navideña los clientes demandan más sus productos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo para dar a sus clientes mayores y mejores opciones.
texts.en: Morena is 38 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and her children ages 9, 4 and 2. Morena is a committed and determined woman who fights for her family's well-being.  Morena earns a living through selling beauty products by catalog.  She makes her sales as a walking saleswoman and thanks to her charisma she now has many customers who prefer her more every day.  Morena wants to invest in her business given that in this Christmas season customers need her products more. For that reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of beauty products by catalog in order to give her customers more numerous and better options.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products in bulk.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 35 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Monaliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Monaliza has been farming rice for 8 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells bread, coffee, soft drinks, canned goods and other  household items. She has a 14-year-old child. She is living in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store and supplies for the food vending business. These will be of great help for her family to fill her store with various stock and hope would start her food vending business.

She is hoping that she could manage her livelihood properly to support the needs of her growing child, including a quality education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store and supplies for the food vending business

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María es una emprendedora mujer de 58 años de edad, domiciliada en un barrio de Barranquilla, es madre de dos hijos y cuatro hijas, su meta familiar es mejorar su vivienda y con ello su calidad de vida, ella está dedicada a prestar servicios de peluquería, aprendió este arte en conjunto con una hija en una academia de belleza, en la actualidad ofrece servicio de blower, tintes, cortes, derriz, masajes capilares y tratamientos para el cuidado del cabello.  A pesar de tener solo un año en esta actividad, ha consolidado su clientela a la que ofrece sus servicios en el horario de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m. de lunes a domingo. María trabaja muy comprometida y su meta es lograr tener un local y la infraestructura de su negocio, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un espejo, una silla de peluquería, un lava cabezas y una plancha.  Esta inversión impactará positivamente en el los ingresos a recibir y el servicio que presta a sus clientes, puesto que no cuenta con las instalaciones necesarias para este formato de negocio, por lo que es acertada realizar esta inversión.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman who is 58 years old.  She lives in a neighborhood in Barranquilla, and is the mother of two boys and four girls.  Her personal goals are to improve her house and with it her quality of life.  She makes a living offering hair salon services.  She learned this art along with her daughter at a beauty academy.  Now she offers services such as blowdrying, coloring, cutting, straightening, head massages, and haircare treatment.  

Despite having only a year of experience in this business, she has consolidated her clientele to whom she offers her services between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m. Monday through Sunday.  María is very committed to her work, and her goal is to have a location and infrastructure for her business.  

Right now she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a mirror, a salon chair, a hair-washing sink, and a straight iron.  This investment will positively impact the income she receives and the service that she gives her customers. Since she does not have the necessary setup for this business format, it is fitting for her to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, a salon chair, a hair-washing sink, and a straight iron.

loans.name: Aladina

texts.en:
Aladina is 65 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aladina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aladina has been in this business for 36 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mario De Jesusz

texts.es:
Mario es un humilde trabajador de 58 años de edad, que encontró en su venta de productos, gracias a esta actividad logra ganar el sustento para su familia, vende abarrotes y granos en general. 
Las aspiraciones de Mario es seguir trabajando en este negocio, levantarlo, hacerlo más rentable y velar por el bienestar y salud de su familia.
Mario solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de abarrotes, granos y refresco, con la ayuda de este crédito podrá abastecer su negocio y tratar de mejorar su comportamiento de ventas.
texts.en:
Mario is a humble laborer who is 58 years old.  He sells products such as general grains and groceries, and thanks to this activity he is able to support his family.

His aspiration is to continue working in this field, to grow his business, to make it more profitable, and to work hard for the health and well-being of his family.  

Mario is asking for a loan in order to buy an assortment of groceries, basic grains, and soft drinks. With the help of this loan he will be able to supply his business and try to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of groceries, basic grains, and soft drinks in order to supply his business.

loans.name: Balcon 4 Group

texts.es:
Yeni es una mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos 2, 4 y 12, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola entre productores campesinos y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se ocupan de acomodar los productos en los diferentes mercados, de clima cálido, húmedo y tropical, con una temperatura que ronda los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Yeni es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro usa blusa guinda y pantalón gris). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no están en edad escolar. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para el bienestar de su familia la llevo a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas,  confección de polleras y servicio de transporte, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Majadito (de charque, de pollo y de pato, además de plátano  y huevo frito), Locro Carretero (incluye arroz, charque y plátano, papa, cebolla verde y huevo), Pipián de Pollo (lleva presas de pollo con salsa de maní y arroz blanco), Rapi al jugo ( Es carne de res cocida y acompañada con arroz y yuca), Sopa tapada (Contiene arroz batido con carne y trozos de plátano frito). Actividad que realiza durante las noches a la hora de la cena, por las mañanas se dedica a la limpieza de oficinas en un empresa de limpieza. “cuando mis hijos sean grandes me independizaré y dejaré de limpiar oficinas, solo quiero vivir de mi negocio…” comenta. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella desea estabilizar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. esta es  la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yeni solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para estabilizar su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Yeni is a 36-year-old woman.  She is married and has three children, ages 2, 4, and 12.  Her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother, with a good attitude.  She is committed to her work, generous, kind, responsible, and hardworking.  She carries out her business in the “El Torno” area, a rural region known for its agricultural trade between the farmers and the wholesale vendors who carry the products to the different markets.  It has a hot, humid, and tropical climate, with a temperature around 30 degrees Celsius year-round.

Yeni has tan skin with long, dark, tied-back hair.  She is of medium height and her native language is Guaraní.  She speaks Spanish in the community and in her work.  (She is in the center, wearing a cherry top and gray pants.)  She shares her life with her children and with her spouse, who works in construction.  Her oldest is in school and the younger two aren’t yet school-aged.  They live in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and sewage.  Her need to increase her business for the wellbeing of her family leads her to head up a bank of people with jobs in trade such as: selling furniture, selling quilts, servicing technical equipment, making leather wallets, selling meat pies, selling polleras [traditional, gathered skirts], and providing transportation services.  They gather to ask for a loan and to improve their businesses.

Yeni’s business is selling traditional foods such as: Majadito (with dried beef, chicken, or duck, as well as plantain and fried egg), Locro Carretero (includes rice, dried beef, plantains, potatoes, green onion, and egg), Pipián de Pollo (contains pieces of chicken with peanut sauce and white rice), Rapi al Jugo (beef, cooked and served with rice and yuca), Sopa Tapada (contains blended rice with meat and slices of fried plantain).  She does this work at night, around supper time.  During the mornings she works cleaning offices for a cleaning company.  “Once my children are older, I’ll be more independent and stop cleaning offices.  I want to just live off my business,” she says.  Her dream is that her children would be professionals.  She wants to set up her business with tables and chairs in order to serve more customers.  This is her first loan cycle in eight years of running her business.

For these reasons, Yeni is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs, in order to establish her food business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to establish her food business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily raises and sells hogs and poultry animals.  She is a native of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a 38-year-old married woman with four dependents.  To augment her daily income, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and soap.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for the animals and stock for the store. These will fill her store, causing it to attract more buyers to come and purchase. In the coming months, she will be selling more hogs and poultry animals. With this, she will be able to pay her obligations and other household expenses.

She hopes that she can handle her business successfully to improve her present livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy feed for the animals and stock for the store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a very industrious mother. She is an Avon products dealer. She sells lotion, body spray, talc powder, soap and other beauty products. She is a married woman with eight children. Her youngest child is 16 years old. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years already.
