She is asking for a loan to buy Avon products like lotion body spray and RTW (ready to wear) like pants, jeans and many others. These stocks are very helpful in augmenting Carmelita's day-to-day earnings. She could now have a variety of stocks to sell, attracting more buyers to purchase.

In the future, Carmelita hopes to handle her business in a more productive way to improve her status of living and attend to the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy Avon products like lotion body spray and RTW ( ready to wear) like pants, jeans and many others

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 52 года, вдова, есть сын. У Анаркан - средне-специальное образование, она занимается выпечкой и реализацией хлеба. Анаркан печет лепешки сама, невестка продает их на рынке. В доме есть собственный тандыр, топить который помогает брат Анаркан. Вся семья с радостью помогает по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 33,000 сом (KGS). Семья занимается любимым делом, но доходов катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития и расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку муки и угля для изготовления лепешек. Используя уголь вместо дров для растопки Анаркан заботится об окружающей среде. Анаркан является лидером группы "Марат", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека.  Доходы от ведения бизнеса, Анаркан будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие, чтобы накопить средства на постройку большой пекарни.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 52, widowed, and has a son.  She has the equivalent of a high school education with vocational training, and earns her living baking and selling flatbread.  Anarkan bakes it herself, and her daughter-in-law sells it at a marketplace.  She has her own tandoori oven at home, and brings it up to heat with her brother's help.  Her whole family is glad to help her run the business.  Thanks to Anarkan's persistent efforts, her monthly income is currently around 33,000 som.  

Her family does what it can to bring in money, but their income is far too low to provide a decent standard of living.  To further develop and expand her business, Anarkan has requested a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy flour and charcoal for baking flatbread.  She uses charcoal instead of wood for baking as she cares about the environment.  Anarkan is the leader of the Marat group, which has two other members aside from her.  She plans on using her business' income to expand further, with the goal of eventually saving up enough to build a new, large bakery.

loans.use: purchase flour and charcoal to produce traditional Kyrgyz flatbread

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Arlene is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 12 y 11 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de Pampa Chililaya, caracterizada por ser una área rural dedicada a la ganaderia,  de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Victoria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su familia, vive en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, Su negocio es el tejido mantas a mano y también lo realiza a máquina, las mantas son bien solicitadas por las mujeres de la localidad para cubrirse de frio y también como parte de su vestimenta tradicional, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma independiente en su domicilio, la venta la efectúa en un puesto de venta improvisado en la calle y también en feria y mercados, de forma ambulante,  “los productos de lana son muy necesarios en la ciudad porque todo el año hace frio…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de lana por mayor para tejer y  para producir en mayor cantidad y de manera más rápida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana  para así tejer  y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 48-year-old woman who is married, has two children who are 11 and 12 years old, and who makes a living weaving blankets. She is a good mother, is enterprising, independent, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is done in the Pampa Chililaya community, which is known for being a rural area dedicated to livestock, for having a cold and dry climate, and a temperature that varies during the day from 2-14 degrees centigrade. 

Victoria has dark skin and long, black, braided hair.  Her mother language is Aymará but she speaks Spanish for general use and for the work she does.  Her life is shared with her family. She lives in a brick house that has potable water and electricity. Her business is weaving blankets by hand and by machine.  Her blankets are well sought after by women in town for protection from the cold and as part of their traditional dress. This is work that she does every day of the week, independently in her home. She carries out the sales in a makeshift stall in the street, as well as at the fair and markets as a street vendor. "The wool products are much needed in the city because it is cold all year long," she says.

Her dream is to have a permanent stall for sales so she can stop walking. She wishes to make an investment in her business through the purchase of wholesale wool for weaving and producing her blankets faster and in larger quantities.  This is the first loan sequence with the institution that she has had in the six years she has been doing this work.  For these reasons, Victoria asks for a loan to buy wholesale wool for weaving and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool.

loans.name: José Abilio

texts.es:
José, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja es ama de casa, hijos no tienen, y sus padres viven con ellos.

Es empleado de una entidad gubernamental, su padre trabaja desde 1998 en la institución y fue el quién le consiguió trabajo ahí, tiene cuatro años de experiencia, se desempeña como motorista y también como técnico en el manejo de tuberías, el trabajo lo lleva a diferentes lugares, cuando son distancias largas usan un vehículo y cuando es cerca, se transportan en bicicleta, su horario de trabajo es de 24 horas seguidas y descansa 24 horas.

José, ya ha tramitado créditos anteriores con kiva, con lo que ha tenido la oportunidad de realizar muchas actividades y ha logrado salir adelante.

Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar cemento, cerámica y para pagar la mano de obra, la ayuda que el préstamo le dará, es poder concluir su construcción, con está construcción, tendrá mayor privacidad.

El sueño de José, es poder seguir trabajando para obtener sus cosas y darle mayor comodidad a su esposa y posteriormente a sus hijos, cuando los tenga.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old and has his Bachelor's degree. He is accompanied by his partner, who is a housewife. They do not have children, and their parents live with them. 

He is an employee of a government agency. His father worked for the institution beginning in 1998, and it was he who helped José to find work there. José has four years of experience. He works as a driver and also as a pipe/sewer technician. The work takes him to different places. When he goes long distances, they use a car; a bike is used for short distances. His schedule sees him working 24 hours on, and 24 hours off. 

José has had previous Kiva loans, with which he has had the opportunity to undertake various projects and to move forward. He needs this loan to purchase cement, tiles, and to pay for labor costs. This loan will help him to complete his construction. With this project, he will have more privacy. José's dream is to continue working to earn his belongings and to provide the best comfort for his wife - and later - his children, when he has them.

loans.use: to purchase cement, tiles, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Nenita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 44 years old and married with two children, who are both in school. Vivian works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for seven years and she sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: 3 De Septiembre-25 Group

texts.es:
Cinthia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’,  un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal de fruta proveniente del norte de la ciudad y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del norte, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos helados que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar. 
Cinthia es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no utiliza y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la 2 de la izquierda, camiseta blanca a rayas horizontales). Su vida la realiza con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y pasa clases de guitarra, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de chompas, venta de materiales de construcción, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería y venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional paceña, como; Chairo (sopa preparada con chuño, carne de cordero, papa, zanahoria, cebolla, habas, mote de maíz, hierba buena, wuacataya, orégano y sal al gusto), Plato Paceño (combina choclo, papa, habas, queso y se acompaña con salsa picante), Queso Humacha (tiene como ingredientes; queso, ají amarillo, choclo y papa), Jakhonta (preparado con trozos de carne, chuño, papa, hojas de repollo y cebolla), Picana (carne de cordero, vaca y gallina, zanahoria, nabo, pasas, chuño, papa y choclos). Labor que realiza en la puerta de su domicilio y al aire libre, todos los días de la semana a la hora de almuerzo. “aprendí a cocinar por herencia familiar, tuve otros negocios pero al final me quedé con este que es el que mejor realizo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande donde pueda atender a mucho clientes. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para su nuevo restaurante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Cinthia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su nuevo restaurante.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a 33-year-old single woman who has a 12-year-old son. Her business involves selling traditional food. She is generous, understanding, a good listener, supportive, strong, a good mother, responsible, and hardworking. Cinthia conducts her business in the District of Villa Fátima, a place that is known for the informal fruit trade that takes place in the northern part of the city. People living in the north have access to public transportation because of the various stops. The weather is cold and gusty because of the icy winds that come from the mountains. This area likes 3,600 meters above sea level.

Cinthia has an olive complexion, brown hair, and a medium stature. Her native language is Aymará, but she no longer uses it. Instead, she speaks Spanish so that she can integrate into the general culture and conduct business. In the photo, Cinthia is standing second to the left, wearing a white shirt with horizontal stripes. She shares her life with her son, who is attending school and also taking guitar lessons. They live in a rented brick house that receives running water, electricity, and sewage services. In order to expand her business, Cinthia formed a Communal Bank with other businesspeople who sell sweaters, sell construction materials, knit baby clothes, sell potato chips, sell sportswear, manage a neighborhood store, operate a butcher shop, and sell sandwiches. Joining together allows them to request a loan so that they can improve their businesses.

Cinthia’s business involves selling the traditional food of La Paz such as “chairo” (mutton stew with dried potatoes, carrots, onions, corn, herbs, black mint, oregano, and salt to taste), “plato paceño” (a combination of corn, potatoes, beans, and cheese, served with a spicy sauce), “jakhonta” (beef chunks, potatoes, cabbage leaves, and onions), and “picana” (lamb, beef, and chicken with carrots, turnips, raisins, potatoes, and corn). She sells her food from the doorstep of her house and out in the open. Cinthia works every day of the week during the lunch hour. “I learned to cook as part of a family tradition. I’ve had other businesses, but in the end, this is what I am good at,” says Cinthia. Her dream is to have a large restaurant where she can serve many customers. She wants to expand her business by purchasing table and chairs for her new restaurant. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender. Cinthia has been in this line of work for 15 years.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Cinthia is requesting a loan so that she can buy tables and chairs for her new restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her new restaurant.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 47 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 32,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Felisa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Maria Camilo es una adorable y trabajadora mujer de 24 años de edad que por voluntad y deseo de sacar adelante su vida, inicio su negocio de restaurante como una alternativa de ingreso para poder solventar sus gastos universitarios y hoy se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hasta el momento.
Maria Camila quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar unas mejoras locativas a su lugar, pintura, mesas, sillas están entre sus planes.
Su negocio se verá muy beneficiado pues sigue el dicho de que la comida entra por los ojos y un lugar limpio y que se vea bien atraerá más clientes lo que será muy beneficioso para ella.
texts.en:
María Camila, 24, is an adorable and hardworking woman.  Having the will and desire to get ahead, she opened her own restaurant in order to pay for her university expenses, and today she feels very proud of what she has accomplished so far. 

María Camila is requesting a loan in order to make some improvements in her restaurant—painting, tables, and chairs are among some of the things she is planning. 

Her business will benefit very much, because the way food is presented is important, and a clean location will attract more customers.  This will be very beneficial to her.

loans.use: to make improvements in her restaurant by investing in paint, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been packing beauty mask powder into sachets for the past six years to support her family. She beautifully makes sachet at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also works in a factory but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan to purchase sachets and beauty mask powder. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy beauty mask powder and sachets to sell

loans.name: Hella

texts.en: Hella is businesswoman from Iloilo, Philippines.  She earns a living through her retail sales of cosmetics, toiletries, fashion accessories, clothing and other items. This is the source of her income for more than 5 years now. Hella is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like perfume, cosmetics, toiletries, clothes, slippers and fashion accessories. With this she will be able improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Hella hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like perfume, cosmetics, toiletries, clothes, slippers and fashion accessories.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Teresita has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories like doors and windows, which are used in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories. He is out of his current stock and, due to an increase in the iron prices, he is unable to buy sufficient iron goods and welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods etc to carry on his business. 

Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband will be able to buy the described inventories for manufacturing.  

Zahida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron goods and welding material to manufacture iron accessories.

loans.name: Nhóm 03  Lớp Nghề Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mạnh has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

Mạnh is 59 years old and she is married with four children. Mạnh is the group leader of the Nhóm 03  Lớp nghề xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Mạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn Hậu Áng Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Thuận works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thuận is 57 years old and she is married with three children. Thuận is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn Hậu áng Xã Công liêm solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thuận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Angel Alberto

texts.es:
Angel tiene 38 años de edad es soltero pero tiene dos hijos a los cual mantiene vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, solicita el credito para comprar ganado e invertir, realiza las compras en San Miguel semanalmente, sus sueño es llegar hacer un gran comerciante de ganado, en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Angel is 38 years old, single, and has two children that he supports. He lives in the community of Salado Chico in San Miguel, which is in Bolivar Province.

Angel buys and sells livestock. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in order to buy and invest in livestock. He makes his purchases in San Miguel on a weekly basis. His dream is to become a large-scale livestock trader. In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sophanith

texts.en: Sophanith is a 19-year-old engineering student who lives in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. His father is a motorcycle taxi driver and his mother is a garment worker. Since he is lacking finances, Sophanith would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees for four years. This loan will help him graduate successfully and provide him with a skill to build his future. For his future job, he hopes to work in a company with a decent salary to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Blanca Carmen

texts.es: Blanca de 52 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 18, 16 y 14 años de edad. Ella siempre busca la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos, por lo que todos los días sale a vender sandalias para dama para llevar el sustento, además vende productos de belleza por catalogó para obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Blanca desea construir un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda ya que actualmente cuenta con uno que se encuentra deteriorado y provoca insalubridad en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y una taza lavable para construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 52 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their three children (ages 18, 16, and 14). She is always looking for ways to improve her family’s quality of life. Every day she goes out to sell women’s sandals in order to earn an income. In addition, she sells beauty products through catalogs as a way of generating extra money.

Blanca wants to build a bathroom in her home since the existing one is in bad shape and creating unhealthy conditions. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and a flush toilet. These materials will be used to build a bathroom for her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and a flush toilet so that she can build a bathroom for her home.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa raises chickens to earn a living. To augment her income, she also engages in the buying and selling of rice. She is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 3. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 3 years now. 
 
Marissa is asking for a loan to buy additional sacks of rice. These will help Marissa sell more rice. This stock is enough to cater the needs of her respective customers.

In the future, Marissa hopes that someday, she will prosper and her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice.

loans.name: Nhóm 09- Thôn Bắc -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hảo is 52 years old and she is married with six children. Hảo is the group leader of the Nhóm 09- Thôn Bắc -Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hảo has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hảo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hảo hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Trung 01 Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cại operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Cại is 41 years old and she is married with three children. Cại is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Trung 01 Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Cại joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cại has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cại has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cại faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cại hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Hân

texts.en:
Mrs. Hân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Hân is 29 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hân has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and ready-to-wear clothing businesses. Gloria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 49 years old. He is married and his family lives in Tuguegarao. He has been a corn farmer for over six years now. He needs additional capital to sustain his crops so they will produce a good harvest. Francisco is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP because he has insufficient funds. He will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in corn farming. With enough farm inputs, he will provide good nourishment to his crops, leading to a bountiful harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in corn farming

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Julie has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Julie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ernina

texts.en:
Ernina is a 58-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ernina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ernina has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Ernina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 23 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janice has a buying and selling of livestock business in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Janice has been in this business for two years. In the future, Janice would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 26-year-old married woman who has a son. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

Hina's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can sell the maximum amount of fruits until evening and get the maximum reward for his efforts. 

Hina applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits to resell

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
FAIDA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de d’habillements à l’image de AWA  qui est la première personne debout  de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’habillements : balle de friperie, pagne et wax. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire. 
AWA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  TIELE, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1  Balle de Friperie et une quantité importante de pagne et wax.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Faida is a group within the Benkadi association of Tiele. It gathers women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 31 years old, married with four children.

They carry out different activities such as trading clothes like Awa, the first person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Tiele, in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been in business for several years and are in high demand for their clothes-trading activities: bales of used clothing, pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and wax (a high-quality type of pagne fabric).

To satisfy the growing demand of their customers, group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. They are on their seventh group loan.

Awa, who is the group's president and very well known in Tiele, excels at selling clothes. She plans to use her loan to buy one bale of used clothing and a significant amount of pagnes and wax fabric. She stocks up from local wholesalers and in Bamako, and retails her clothes in Tiele for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She is hoping for monthly profits of 50,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and invest the remainder in her business activity.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra una humilde morena cabeza de familia, que busca iniciar su empresa de salón de belleza por lo que solicita un modesto monto pues está muy consciente del cumplimento que debe tener para el cumplimiento de las cuotas y prefiere comprometerse con poco y más que le dan la oportunidad de comprar una silla de peluquería modesta y unos implementos para iniciar su profesión.
Su mayor fuente de inspiración para trabajar es su hijo de 5 años y las necesidades que presenta en su hogar, lugar donde montara su negocio y aspira a mudarse a otro sitio.
Su sueño es poder tener un salón de belleza, generar empleo y tener la fortaleza para llevar su empresa hacia el éxito.
Con el crédito solicitado Sandra comprara una silla de peluquería, una plancha para el cabello, secador e implementos para peinar.
texts.en:
Sandra is a humble woman who has dark skin and is the head of her family. She is looking to initiate a beauty salon, for which she is requesting a modest amount of money. She is very conscious of the obligation she will have to make her loan payments, and she prefers only to commit herself to a small amount. This amount will give her the opportunity to purchase a modest haircut chair and a few supplies to initiate her business. 

Sandra's greatest inspiration for her work is her five year old son and the needs of her home. She runs her business out of her home but hopes to move it to another place. Her dream is to have a beauty salon, to generate work and to have the strength to turn her business into a successful one. With the requested loan, Sandra will purchase a haircut chair, a hair iron, a dryer and other hair styling supplies.

loans.use: to purchase a haircut chair, a hair iron, a dryer and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Maria has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en: Seyha is a 19-year-old student who is a marketing major in his second year at university in a city. He is from Kandal Province, Cambodia. Seyha also works as a marketing staff, earning USD 5 a day. Because he is short on finances to pay his second-year tuition fee, he would like to request a loan. This loan will help him to go through the second year successfully. In the future, he wants to work as marketing staff in a good company with decent salary to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay his second-year tuition fee.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Samnang is a 26-year-old single security guard at a company. He is also a first-year university student who is pursuing an associate’s degree. He is from Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia. By being a security guard, he can make approximately USD 3.33 per day. Samnang doesn’t have enough finances to pay his first-year tuition fee, so he has decided to take a loan. With the loan, he will be able to go through the first year successfully. For his plans after graduation, he is going to find another job with a good salary and save money to run a grocery store.

loans.use: to pay his first-year tuition fee

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is 49 years old, married and has three children. He is a farmer planting and harvesting corn for over 10 years. He also hires laborers who help him harvest corn. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers to use in his farming business. This will help grow crops fruitfully. He also promises to pay back his loan after his harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Thôn Trung 01 Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Loan is 53 years old and she is married with four children. Loan is the group leader of the Nhóm 12 Thôn Trung 01 Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. Loan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến works in agriculture farming food.

Yến is 34 years old and she is married with two children. Yến lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed for making incense.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.es: Ruth es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, está coordinado por la señora Yolanda quien tiene la edad de 49 años, acompañada, comerciante de frutas de manera ambulante en las calles de su municipalidad, se dedica a este negocio desde hace cinco años, anteriormente trabajaba como doméstica, ero fue con su espíritu de su superación que decidió ahorrar para luego impulsar su propio negocio y así obtener ingresos a diario mejorando sus ingresos y aportando más a los gastos familiares, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de banano, papas, chiltoma, cebolla, zanahoria, chayote, pipian, etc. uno de sus logros es que ha podido aumentar la clientela gracias a la variedad de productos que frece. En su equipo de trabajo están las señoras, Ada de 35 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su comunidad desde hace tres años, y Glenys quien tiene la edad de 31 años se dedica a la venta de cajetas por las calles de su comunidad desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
“Ruth” is a solidarity group composed of three enterprising women.  It is coordinated by Señora Yolanda, 49, who lives with her partner.  She sells fruit on foot throughout the streets of her municipality. 

She has been devoting herself to this business for five years; she worked as a housekeeper before, but with her spirit of achievement she decided to save so that she could open her own business later.  This way, she would be able to obtain a daily income, improve her income, and contribute more to paying her family’s expenses.  

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of bananas, potatoes, bell peppers, onions, carrots, chayote and pipián (two kinds of squash), and such. One of her accomplishments is that she has been able to increase her clientele because of the variety of products that she offers.  

Her working team (Ruth Group) includes Señora Ada, 35, who has been selling clothing in her community for 3 years; and Señora Glenys, 31, who has been selling caramels throughout the streets of her community for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, which will allow her to increase the products that she offers.

loans.name: Hảo

texts.en:
Mrs. Hảo operates a food stall selling fish.

Hảo is 33 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hảo has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hảo faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hảo hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en: Edmar is a corn grower in Tuguegarao. He is 23 years old, single and lives with his family. Edmar wanted to improve his farming practices and his harvest. So, he is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers to use to nourish his crops. With good nourishment for his corn, he will harvest it fruitfully and save money for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use to nourish his crops

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas works hard to support her family. Santas is married and has an upholstery business in the Philippines.

Santas requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Santas has been in this business for 17 years now.

Santas would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Roselma

texts.en:
Roselma is a separated woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselma is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Roselma has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Roselma requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Roselma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Roselma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita works hard to support her family. Anacorita is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Anacorita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell to her customers.

Anacorita has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina works hard to support her family. Severina is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Severina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Severina has been in this business for six years now.

Severina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sharame

texts.en:
Sharame works hard to support her family. Sharame is married and has a fish and seafood vending business in the Philippines.

Sharame requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and seafood to sell.

Sharame has been in this business for six years now.

Sharame would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and seafood to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 36 years old and married, with one child in school.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio un hombre de 50 años de edad, que desde los años noventa se dedica al transporte de alimentos el cual lo realiza en su camioneta que pueden ver en la foto.
Es padre de un hijo y tiene un feliz matrimonio, pero en el cual ha venido teniendo discusiones con su mujer debido al mal estado de las llantas del vehículo, pero a pesar de esto sale diariamente a trabajar exponiendo su vida pues su supervivencia depende del negocio.
Por tal razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de 4 llantas para su vehículo, dando tranquilidad y protegiendo su vida.
Antonio sueña con un día poder tener una vivienda propia para vivir con su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is a 50 year old man. Since the nineties he has been in the transportation business. He has his own truck, which you can see in the picture. He is the father of one child and has a happy marriage. Recently, however, he and his wife have been having arguments about the poor state of the tires on his truck. Still, Antonio goes out every day which risks his life, because their well-being depends on the business. For this reason he wants to request a loan to purchase four tires for his vehicle, which will give him tranquility and will protect his life. Antonio hopes one day to be able to have a house of his own for his family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase four tires for his truck.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 28 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Liezel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Liezel has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Duglas Bladimir

texts.es: Douglas de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra arroz y maiz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Duglas, 42, lives in his own house with his wife and his two children.  He has been a farmer for several years, growing rice and corn.  He sells his products in different markets, and he already has established customers.  

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, and such, and for improving the land that is shown in the photograph, so that he can continue with his work and have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, and such, and improve the land.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more spices to sell for her business buying and selling spices and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell.

loans.name: Juan Gullermo

texts.es:
Juan un joven de 22 años, maduro y responsable que ya contrajo matrimonio y del cual tiene una hija de 2 años de edad se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, actividad que heredó de su familia y le enseño su padre.
Entre sus animales favoritos están los caballos, los cuales alquila para variedad de eventos como cabalgatas y ferias de presentación, también vende y compra ganado.
Juan quiere convertirse en uno de los hombres más importantes de la ganadería  por ello trabaja diariamente 12 o más horas pues quiere cumplir su sueño a toda costa.
Juan solicita un crédito para la compra de terneros y caballos pues quiere tener una mayor capacidad para abordar eventos más grandes y suficiente ganado para cubrir un pedido o dar posibilidad al cliente de elección
texts.en:
Juan is a young 22-year-old man. He is mature and responsible and has a wife with whom he has a two-year-old child. He works in agriculture, raising livestock, a trade passed down through his family and taught to him by his father. Among his favorite animals are the horses, which he events out for a variety of events such as parades and fairs. Juan also purchases and sells cattle. 

Juan wants to become one of the most important men in ranching, and for this reason he works twelve hours or more each day. He wants to achieve his dream at any cost. Juan requests a loan to purchase calves and horses because he wants to have a greater capacity to handle large events, and because he wants to have enough cattle to cover an order or to give to a customer at will.

loans.use: to purchase horses and calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Beatrice who is married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in December 2013.

Beatrice is a maize farmer and keeps poultry. She is grateful to HiH EA for inculcating an entrepreneurial culture in her through training and mentorship courses. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to start a cereals business and purchase chicken feed. She hopes to get more profits from the sale of eggs and cereals. This will enable her to support her family's needs such as education, food and medical care.

Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy cereals and chicken feed that will improve her income.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Veronica has a general store business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, cooking oil, diapers, salt, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Veronica has been in this business for 16 years. Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, cooking oil, diapers, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 31 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Jennilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jennilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennilyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Jennilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old and a married woman with six children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susan has a buying and selling livestock business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Susan has been in this business for two years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bella is 50 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Bella has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Bella requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Bella has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 47 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Lourdes has a buying and selling of livestock business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda works hard to support her family. Brenda is married and has a medicine business in the Philippines.

Brenda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of medicines to offer for sale.

Brenda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of medicines to offer for sale

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is a 40-year-old man from Ormoc City, Leyte. He is a very hardworking man and wants to start a business in order to support the needs of the family especially for their daily consumption.

Teodoro is asking to take a loan to buy stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and other items. This loan will enable him to attract buyers in his store, thus augmenting his sales and income. In the future, Teodoro hopes to make his business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and other items

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 years old, married and has three children. Her family lives at Piat. To make a living, she operates a store selling snacks to students and the people in her village. She wanted to increase her sales, which is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy biscuits, soft drinks and breads to sell. Alice will continue selling good products and services to achieve abundant sales. The additional revenue will be saved for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, softdrinks and bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel  operates a vulcanizing and welding shop.  She caters truck and motorcycle repair services. She is a 39-year-old married woman residing in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She has five children. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 8. She has been operating a shop for more than 15 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy welding shop materials. These tools are very helpful in the operation of her shop, thus providing quality services to customers. With these, her customers will use her services, and this will cause her to gain higher earnings.

In the future, Maricel hopes to expand her business to improve her status of living and to be able to continue support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy welding shop materials.

loans.name: Leonardo Jacinto

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 26 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad vive en Ventana provincia de los Rios 
solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para asi poder aumentar los cultivos, ya que su sueño es comoprarse mas terrenos y mejorar la produccion para poder solventar a su familia, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es la enfermedades en los cultivos y perderlos, en su tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 26, is married and has a seven-year-old son.  He lives in Ventana in the province of Los Rios.  

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies so he can improve his crops.  He dreams of buying more land and increasing production so that he can look after his family.  

He has to overcome the challenge of treating the diseases that affect his crops, which sometimes lead to him losing them.  

In his free time he enjoys going to church.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 37 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. 

Her husband has been running a small printing press for many years. He also prints advertisement banners and logos on order. He belongs to a poor family and is the single person responsible for his children and his old parents. His parents, most of the time, remain sick, and he has to spend most of his income on their cure. He wants to grow his business so he can easily generate more income than in the past so he can cherish his children and can bear the medical expenses of his parents. 
 
Therefore, Safia has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy color plotters and printing material to print more advertisements. In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family. 

Safia deserves Kiva support. She hopes that the Kiva lenders will support her. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy printing material to print advertisements.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 66 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva varios años vendiendo ropa de todo tipo como ser faldas, vestidos, pantalones y calzado. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. El préstamo que ha silicitado es el cuarto ciclo con la Institución y es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas ropa (blusas, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior) y calzado para vender. La idea es aumentar el inventario y las ganancias para ahorrar y cumplir con su sueño de comprar un vehiculo para su negocio. También su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 66 years old, and he is married with 3 children.  He lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  He has always worked as a salesman, and for several years he has been selling clothing of all kinds, such as skirts, dresses, pants, and footwear.  He works on foot, and he takes orders.  

This is his fourth cycle with the Institution, and he is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras ($475) in order to purchase more clothing to sell, such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, underwear, and footwear. The idea is to increase his inventory and earnings in order to save and achieve his dream of purchasing a vehicle for his business.  Also, he wants to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell, such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, underwear, and footwear.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Un taladro, una pulidora y una maquina cortadora son las herramienta que el maestro de obra Jairo necesita para su negocio, la razón radica que para realizar un trabajo siempre necesita de esta maquinaria y le ha tocado prestarlo, incluso rechazar el trabajo por no tener disponibilidad algunos días de las maquinas.
Cansado de esta situación Jairo quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar y tener su propia maquinaria y así como independiente no rechazar un trabajo pro falta de equipo, pues de su negocio depende su esposa y su hijo de 18 años que está ingresando a la universidad.
texts.en: A drill, a polisher and a cutting machine are the tools which the master builder Jairo needs for his business. The reason he gives for needing these machines is that he always needs these types of machines to do his work and has had to borrow them in the past. He has even had to turn down work if the machines are not available on the days he needs them. Jairo is tired of this situation and wants to request a loan to purchase, and own, his own machinery. This way he will be independent and will not need to turn down work because of the lack of equipment. Both Jairo's wife and his 18 year old son, who is entering university, depend on this business.

loans.use: to purchase machinery.

loans.name: Virginia Maritza

texts.en: Virginia is married and has three children. Her husband is called Jorge and they have been together for 27 years. They live in her parents' house. Virginia works selling women's underwear and bras in a Mexico City market with the help of her children. She has been doing it for the last eight years. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to increase her sales in the season. Her biggest accomplishment is raising her kids and helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear in Mexico City markets.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kirathimo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Kirathimo Women Group in Nakuru Kenya. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.

Mary runs a shop selling household items to earn a living. With the training she got from HiH EA, she has been able to manage her shop effectively and she is now able to get more profits from the business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more stock of sugar, salt, cooking fat and tea leaves for the shop. This will greatly increase her income due to improved sales. This will enable her to meet her family's needs such as school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her kiosk such as sugar, salt, cooking fat and tea leaves that will help improve sales volume and thus, more income

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Née en Décembre 1970  à Baraouéli , Madame  Awa est une femme mariée et mère de 06 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Ziembougou Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Cette femme après mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités de vente de pagne et d’encens il y a environ 12 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre  ans. Après des prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartiers, elle est à son sixième prêt individuel commerçant (PIC).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 2 balles de pagne, 2 rouleaux de tissus et l’encens. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in December 1970 in Baraouéli, Mrs Awa is the married mother of six children, residing with her husband and children in a large traditional extended family in Ziembougou Sikasso (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After many unsuccessful activities, this woman began trading pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and incense about 12 years ago.

To better satisfy a steadily increasing number of customers, she decided four years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. After several group loans in a local women's association, this is her sixth individual merchant loan.

She will use this loan to buy two bales of pagnes, two rolls of cloth and incense. She resupplies in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) then resells as an itinerant vendor.

With this loan she intends to achieve monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs, which will be used primarily to expand her business, contribute towards family expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, 37, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Thom province. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one is in the university. For her family's condition, she grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Khmer Literature. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Khmer Literature.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Rushna

texts.en:
Rushna is a 30-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop; he generates insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy mutton and lamb from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently, he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which decreased his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. 

Rushna requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy billy goats and sheep to produce mutton and lamb. Rushna wants to provide a higher education to her children. She dreams of providing all the facilities of life to her children.
 
She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a billy goat to produce mutton.

loans.name: Maria Bertina

texts.es:
María una madre soltera cabeza de familia, luchadora, y realmente de admirar, mantener a 3 hijos no es tarea fácil y más cuando hay más gastos que cubrir y aún más cuando tienes que estar cerca de la casa para cuidar a tus hijos.
Está increíble mujer logra generar el sustento de su familia gracias a su venta de ropa, la cual la hace ambulantemente a amigos, familiares y en general puerta a puerta.
Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa de hombre y dama de diferentes tallas, esta ayuda permite que María siga luchando y peleando por lograr una mejor estabilidad y condiciones de vida para su hogar.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother and head of household. She is a hard worker and very admirable. Taking care of her three children is not an easy job, especially when she has many expenses to cover, and even more difficult when she has to remain near to home to take care of her children. This incredible woman manages to generate enough to sustain her family, thanks to the clothing she sells. She is a traveling saleswoman and sells to friends, family and door to door. Maria requests a loan to purchase clothing for women and for men in a variety of sizes. This help will enable her to continue working and fighting to gain greater stability and better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of men and women's clothing items.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 35-year-old married mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Suriya owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases cloth from the market at a low price, sews it and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warmer clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of garments to fulfill the demand. Suriya wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell from her home.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Nelia has been in this business for two years. Nelia earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and wood for the oven.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un hombre casado de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Solola. 

Felipe es una persona que le domina a la agricultura, ya que desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la siembra, anteriormente sembraba en poca cantidad, y si obtenía muy buenas cosechas,  un día se puso a reflexionar cual era la solución para poder sembrar mas, pues con su esposa decidieron buscar un préstamo y lo hayan desde ese entonces, Felipe quiere seguir trabajando con préstamos, ya que solo de esa manera él puede generar más ingresos  y obtener ganancias. 

Para Felipe los prestamos son buenos ya que a través de las ganancias uno puede prosperar en la vida tanto económico y todo lo necesario para el mantenimiento de un hogar,  él siembra Papa y zanahoria, por la experiencia que tiene Felipe el varia las fechas de siembra para que todo la temporada  durante ocho meses tenga cosechas y tener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Felipe, 48, is married and lives with his family in Solola.  He is an expert in agriculture and has been growing crops since a very early age.  He started off sowing small quantities, and saw how he got good harvests.  He started to think about how he could sow more and, together with his wife, they decided to ask for a loan.  Since then they have been growing more.  

Felipe would like to continue using the loan system, as it is the only way that he can generate more income and make a profit.  

He feels that they are important to him because they are a way for him to improve his financial situation and take care of his household.  

He grows potatoes and carrots.  He uses his experience to grow things at different times so that he has harvests for eight months which can provide him with an income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Wend Managda Group

texts.fr: Wend Managda regroupe 6 femmes battantes qui ont contracté 11 fois des prêts à ACFIME. Ces braves dames ont toujours fait leurs remboursements à temps. Djénéba, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Avec ce prêt, elle voudrait acheter du sucre, des fruits, du bissap, du citron et du gemgembre pour faire du jus pour vendre. Les bénéfices de ses ventes lui permettront de continuer ses activités et de faire face au petites dépenses de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Wend Managda is a group of six warrior women who have had 11 loans with ACFIME. These brave women have always repaid their loans on time. Djénéba, the group representative, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom go to school. 

With this loan, she would like to buy sugar, fruits, hibiscus flowers, lemons, and ginger to make and sell juice. The income she makes from her sales will allow her to continue with her business and take care of her children's expenses.

loans.use: buy fruits, hibiscus flowers, sugar, and ginger to make and sell juice.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is age 36. She is living with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years; he uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, and as a hawker, he can easily reach near the people. The people like to buy vegetables at their door instead of moving to the market. Due to his fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for vegetables has increased, and around noon, his stock comes to an end.

Farzana feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is receiving this loan for her husband so that he can buy seasonal vegetables in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. She wants to save the excess profit so that she can use these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetable for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken, beans, fresh fish, spaghetti, potatoes and meat for catering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees for her qualification as a primary school teacher.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector vive en una comunidad de Sololá tiene 33 años de edad 

Hector es una persona que le gusta prosperar en la vida, él desde hace ya varios años trabaja como agricultor, él siembra diversidad de verduras, Hector desde que empezó a trabajar con prestamos ha tenido muy buenos resultados.
