Él obtuvo un primer crédito el año pasado, con este préstamo pudo incrementar su siembra, dejándole ganancias. 

Hector este año solicita nuevamente un préstamo para tener nuevamente un capital de trabajo y  seguir invirtiendo en la compra de insumos  y fertilizantes para su agricultura. La meta de Hector en cada cosecha  con las ganancias que ele generan es hacer sus ahorros para que mas al futuro el pueda formar su propio capital de trabajo y poder comprar terrenos para tener su propio lugar donde sembrar. Hector tiene esperanza de conseguir un crédito mas.
texts.en:
Hector lives in a community in Sololá, and he is 33 years old.

Hector is a person who likes to prosper in life. For many years he has worked as a farmer; he sows a variety of vegetables. Since Hector started to work with loans he has had very good results. He obtained an initial loan last year. With this loan he was able to increase his sowing, leaving him with a profit.

This year, Hector asks again for a loan to have working capital and to continue investing in buying supplies and fertilizers for his farming. Hector's goal in each harvest, with the profits that they generate, is to save so that in the future he can form his own working capital and be able to buy plots of land to have his own place to sow. Hector hopes to get another loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow

loans.name: Ma. Nezel

texts.en:
Ma. Nezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Ma. Nezel has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from buying and selling coconut and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Nezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Hello there! The above picture presents to you Jane, who lives in the Thika area of Kenya, also known as the Home of Champions because of producing so many elite runners who have broken so many world records. Jane is the mother of three lovely children and has been doing farming for the past 20 years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce milk and eggs. Jane is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, she is able to take care of her family’s needs and wants. Although she experiences challenges in farming, her attitude keeps her going. Enjoying what she does, she has even nicknamed her cow “Blacky.” Jane is seeking a 40,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, she will be able to increase her milk productivity and increase her income levels, hence reducing the poverty level that is currently facing her. Jane’s biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of her family and increasing her income level.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Janed Jamid

texts.es:
Janed un hombre de 28 años, soltero y dedicado de lleno a su trabajo, es uno de los orgullosos caficultores colombianos que día a día desarrollan su labor para que una persona X, pueda disfrutar de un exquisito Café colombiano.
Janed no solo lo cultiva, sino que lo prepara y el mismo tiene un almacén para distribuirlo a sus clientes.
Solicita un apoyo para seguir con su noble labor  ye s muy importante poder ayudarlo ya que un aporte es un voto de confianza para que estos campesinos sigan con su hermoso trabajo de hacer llegar a cada hogar una taza de café colombiano.
Con el crédito que se encuentra solicitando invertirá en insecticidas, Herbicidas, y fungicidas
texts.en:
Janed is a 28 year old man, single, and devoted to his work. He is one of the proud Colombian coffee growers who day after day go about their work so that someone might enjoy an exquisite Colombian coffee. Janed not only grows but also prepares the coffee that he himself distributes to his clients from his warehouse.

He is requesting some support to continue with is noble work, and it would be important assistance, a contribution is a vote of confidence so that these field workers follow the beautiful work of bringing a cop of Colombian coffee to every place. With the loan he is requesting he would invest in insecticides, herbicides, and fungicides

loans.use: Requesting a loan to purchase insecticides, herbicides, and fungicides

loans.name: Libardo

texts.es:
52 años de edad, una energía y entusiasmo para desarrollar sus actividad muy alto, ese es Libardo un hombre que quiere iniciar su propio negocio de legumbrera y como se puede ver en la foto el mismo trabaja para remodelar el local con sus propias manos pues no posee capital para pagar por las actividades.
Libardo aprendió del oficio gracias a que estuvo empleado en años anteriores en legumbreras y como busca un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida para su familia conformada por sus dos hijas que son menores de edad y su pareja. 
Libardo solicita un crédito para la compra de estanterías y surtido para arrancar lo más rápido posible con su negocio.
texts.en:
Libardo is 52 years old. He has a lot of energy and enthusiasm for his business. He is a man who wants to starts his own vegetable business. As you can see from the photo, he himself is working to remodel the store with his own hands, since he doesn't have capital to pay to have it done.

Libardo learned this trade thanks to the fact he was employed earlier in his life at vegetable sellers. He is looking out for his family's wellbeing and quality of life. His family is made up of his two daughters, who are minors, and his partner.

Libardo is requesting a loan to buy shelving and merchandise so he can get his business started as soon as possible.

loans.use: to start his business; he'll buy shelving and a stock up on fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
Rodrigo un creativo, emprendedor, orgullo, entusiasta y sonriente hombre de 55 años de edad, felizmente casado y de dicho matrimonio tiene 2 hijos  se desempeña en una fábrica de calzado y bolsos de cuero que ubico en su hogar y de ella genera los ingresos para el mantenimiento del hogar, Rodrigo apoya a sus hijos brindándoles empleo temporalmente para que generen sus recursos y tengan con que comprar sus cosas.
En busca de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, ser competitivo en el mercado y sacarle provecho a la temporada de diciembre, Rodrigo quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales como cuero y moldes para szapatos.
Su mayor sueño es poder un día dejarle el negocio a sus hijos y lo que el construyo a mediados del año 2000 prevalezca durante generaciones
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a creative, entrepreneurial, proud, enthusiastic and cheerful man. He is 55 years old, happily married and he has two children from this marriage. He has a shop, located in his home, where he makes shoes and leather bags. This shop earns enough money to maintain Rodrigo's household. Rodrigo supports his children by giving them occasional jobs so that they can earn some of their own money to buy things. 

In order to increase his sales, expand his customer base, be competitive in the market and take advantage of the holiday season, Rodrigo wants to request a loan to purchase materials such as leather, and shoe molds.

Rodrigo's greatest dream is to be able to pass the business on to one of his children one day, so that the business he built in the middle of the year 2000 will prevail for many generations.

loans.use: to purchase leather materials and shoe molds.

loans.name: Mabelys

texts.es:
Mabelys es una ama de casa del sector de apartado, un lugar muy afectado por la pobreza donde escasean las oportunidades pero ellos no están solos, la corporación interactuar los acompaña y les ofrece una mano para iniciar sus propias empresas, y dicha oportunidad la quiere aprovechar Mabelys, solicitando un crédito pues quiere montar una venta de carne y una legumbrera y con el crédito solicitado comprara estantería, enfriador, un pesa y surtido de carne y verduras.
La mayor inspiración para iniciar el negocio es que Mabelys es madre de 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad que no se encuentran estudiando y busca desesperadamente matricularlos y que puedan acceder a una escuela.
texts.en:
Mabelys is a homemaker in the neighborhood of Apartadó, an area very affected by poverty and where opportunities are scarce. But they are not alone; Interactuar accompanies them and offers them a hand to help start their own businesses. Mabelys wants to take advantage of this opportunity. She is requesting a loan to buy shelving, a refrigerator, a scale, and a stock of meat and vegetables. 

The greatest inspiration to start the business is the fact that Mabelys is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are minors who are not currently studying. She is looking desperately to enroll them so they can go to a school.

loans.use: to start her business of selling meat and vegetables. She is a businesswoman with low income who wants to provide for her family.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer’s son owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. 

Her son is the only person to support his family and his old parents. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with his future expenses. Therefore, Anwer has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son.

Anwer is the mother of six children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her son will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Anwer thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her son

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is the age of 36, living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the main market and it is challenging for him to sell his products with his competitors. This competition highly effects his daily sales. To grow his business and income and abstain from the competitors, he decided to offer some additional and stylish jewelry items. Rizwana's husband hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will be attracted to his new products. Therefore, Rizwana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy some additional stylish jewelry items. She says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's jewelry sale business

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia comenzó a trabajar a la edad de 20 años en una zona Franca pero con el tiempo la empresa cerro y con la liquidación logro establecer su propia pulpería y el alquiler de video juegos fue creciendo y prosperando y ahora tiene un negocio estable que le genera ganancias. Está casada y tiene tres hijos pero solo uno tiene a su cargo. Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería de temporada como granos básicos, licor, cerveza etc. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá tener suficiente inventario para las fiestas  y dar respuesta a los clientes. Su plan futuro es comprar una caponera para aumentar sus ingresos y seguir preparando a sus hijas en los estudios.
texts.en:
Lucrecia started working at the age of 20 in a duty free area.  But the company closed and she used her severance pay to set up her own grocery store and rent video games.  The business grew and prospered and now she has a stable business generating a profit.  She is married and has three children, but only one is in her care.

The loan she is requesting is to buy seasonal merchandise such as basic grains, liquor, beer, etc.  The loan will be of much help because she will be able to stock up for the holidays and keep customers satisfied.  Her plan for the future is to buy a chicken coop to increase her income and to continue giving her daughters an education.

loans.use: To buy seasonal merchandise such as basic grains, liquor, beer, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 53 years old and married with three children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

Lydia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo es un hombre de 62 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 13, 7 y 3 años de edad.
Él es buen padre, independiente, constante, consiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘ceja de el alto’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por la tradicional feria que se realiza todos los jueves y domingos; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja de coser hasta un tractor de arado, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Amadeo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela, el menor todavía no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el comercio de calcetines, como; algodón de cobre, algodón damas, algodón de moda, medias panty, tobilleras, para bota, etc. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día. “los días de frio y lluvias, se agotan los calientitos y abrigadores calcetines, tines, calentadores y medias cómodas afelpadas y multicolores que dan cobijo a los pies…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de pagar su terreno de tierra para empezar a construir su casa. Él desea realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio como; calcetines de todo tipo y zapatillas de cholita. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Amadeo solicita un préstamo para la compra de calcetines por mayor y zapatos de cholita para ofertar a sus clientes mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Amadeo is 62 years old and lives with his partner. He has four children, ages 16, 13, 7 and 3 years old.

Amadeo is a good father. He is independent, tenacious, responsible and hard-working. He has a business in the “Ceja en el Alto” area of the city, a place known for all sorts of trades and for the traditional fare held every Thursday and Sunday. At this fare, one can find everything from sewing needles to tractors. The climate here is cold and dry and the day-time temperature oscillates between 5 and 15º Celsius throughout the year.

Amadeo has dark-skin, short black hair, and dark eyes. Quite short, his native language is Aymara but he also speaks Spanish. Amadeo shares his life with his wife, a businesswoman, and their children. The couple’s three eldest children are in school. The family lives in a rented house built with adobe bricks and with running water, gas, electricity, and connected to the sewer system.

Amadeo has a business selling all types of socks. He works every day.

Amadeo says, “On days when it’s cold and rainy, all the socks to warm you up run out, along with plush and multi-coloured ones that are comfortable on your feet.”

Amadeo’s dream is to finish pay for land he has bought in order to build a house.

Amadeo wants to buy merchandise for his business, including all types of socks and shoes. This is Amadeo’s second loan with the institution in five years of having the business.

For the reasons above, Amadeo is applying for a loan in order to buy socks in bulk and shoes to offer his customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy socks in bulk and shoes to offer his customers more variety.

loans.name: Ester Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ester, de 28 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado académico, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a vender jugos, gaseosas y agua en los buses; tiene dos hijos, ambos van a la escuela.	

Ester, se dedica a la venta de tortillas con cuajada y bebidas  hidratantes en los buses; las tortillas se las compra a una hermana y la cuajada a un vendedor.

Es una mujer emprendedora ya que ella invento hacer este tipo de negocio en la zona y nadie más se dedica a eso, tiene 5 años de realizar esta actividad.

Al regresar a su casa les dedica tiempo a sus hijos, mientras ella trabaja, paga a una niñera para que se los cuide.- La distancia que recorre de su casa hacia donde trabaja, es de un 1 km, el recorrido lo hace a pie. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar agua, gaseosas, y cuajada.- Con este préstamo ella podrá continuar realizando esta actividad y obteniendo ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia.

Su sueño es, apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien y que sean personas preparadas y de bien.
texts.en:
Ester, 28 years old, did not complete any academic grade, is cohabiting, her partner makes a living selling juices, sodas, and water in the buses; she has two children, both go to school.

Ester makes a living selling tortillas with cuajada cheese and hydrating drinks on the buses; she buys the tortillas from a sister and the cuajada from a merchant.

She is an enterprising woman as she invented doing this type of business in the area and no one else makes a living doing that, for 5 years she has been doing this activity.

Upon returning to her house she dedicates time to her children, while she works, she pays a nanny to take care of them. The distance between her house to where she works is 1 kilometer, she makes the trip by foot.

The loan will be invested to buy water, sodas, and cuajada. With this loan she will be able to continue this activity and obtain income for the daily sustenance of her family.

Her dream is to support her children so that they study and can be qualified and good people.

loans.use: To buy water, sodas, and cuajada cheese

loans.name: Lustina

texts.en: Lustina, 51 years old with five children, lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been a farmer for seven years and earns an amount of PHP 7,000 monthly. She became a member of PMPC in the year 2009. Now she availed herself of a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 for her farm redemption. She is thankful for the financial assistance given by Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to pay for the redempted farmland.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Mila is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nippers, etc. needed for her manicure and pedicure service business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nippers, etc. needed for her manicure service.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 53-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Currently, Suriya has owned a dairy farm at her home since 1998. She produces milk with the help of her husband and sons. She is growing old and does not have enough energy to perform her tasks as she use to do in her younger age.
 
A few days ago, one of her cattle was stolen due to a lack of security and a lack of proper shelter for the cattle, which has needs to be improved. She wants to buy cattle and maintain a cowshed but she has insufficient savings. Therefore, Suriya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a cow, overcome the deficiencies and carry on her business smoothly. 

From the profit amount, Suriya will ensure the security for her cattle and buildup the shelter for the cattle so that she can avoid any theft in the future. 
Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for producing milk.

loans.name: Josel

texts.en:
Josel is 28 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josel has been farming sugarcane for two years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio nació en Matagalpa en el año de 1986 en el hospital de Matagalpa, Luego se fue a un lugar llamado bocaysito que era donde vivían los padres, ahí en este lugar vivió hasta los 20 años de edad el empezó a estudiar pero solo estudio hasta segundo grado en la escuela de bocaysito, se dedico también a trabajar en agricultura con el papa. Luego los padres se fueron a vivir a un lugar llamado el sardinal y él se fue con sus padres. El padre de Evelio tenía unas tierras y comenta Evelio que ya les heredo y a él le dio una área de café y el con mucho trabajo y dedicación lo ha cultivado y ha comprado mas tierras cerca de donde él vive, el se decidió hacer su casa en la que vive con Tania él dice que la casita es un regalo de Dios y le agradece mucho que vive bajo techo y tiene el alimento diario, además Evelio sabe conducir y un señor lo busca más que todo en tiempo de temporada de corte de café para que conduzca una camioneta y se gana otros centavos. En esta comunidad del sardinal no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder tener luz en su casa de habitación ya que cuando tiene que cortar café la esposa se tiene que levantar temprano para preparar el desayuno y se tiene que estar alumbrando con foco y por los noches encienden unas tres candelas para alumbrarse y el dice que es muy peligroso por algún incendio. Evelio agradecería mucho si le brindan este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar ya que sería de gran valor en la casa y de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Evelio was born in Matagalpa in 1986 in the Matagalpa hospital.  Then he moved to a place called Bocaysito which is where his parents lived, and he stayed there until the age of 20.  He only reached second grade in the Bocaysito school and worked in potato farming.  Then his parents moved to Sardinal and he went with his parents.  Evelio received from his father land with a coffee plantation which he has worked on with much effort and dedication.  He has bought more land near where he lives.  He decided to build a house where he lives with Tania.  He says the house is a gift from God and he is very grateful to have a home and food on the table every day.   

Evelio also knows how to drive and he is sought in coffee harvest season to drive a truck to earn a few cents.  There is no electricity in Sardinal, so Evelio is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system so he can have electricity at home.  When he harvests the coffee his wife must get up early to prepare breakfast and she now uses a headlight.  At night they light three candles for light which is dangerous and could cause a fire.  Evelio would be grateful for a loan to buy the solar system which would be of great value to the house and very useful.

loans.use: To buy a solar system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en: Hafeezan is the age of 39, living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a knife sales shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the main market and it is challenging for him to sell his products because of his competitors. This competition highly effects his daily sales. To grow his business and income and abstain from the competitors, he decided to offer more variety of knives. Hafeezan's husband hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will be attracted to his new products. Therefore, Hafeezan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy more variety of knives. She says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's knife sales business

loans.name: Kochalitas Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento Kochalitas está compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales todas son mujeres, todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios todas ellas se conocen entre sí ya que viven por la misma zona.
La presidenta del banco es la señora Nela es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varón de 6 y mujer de 4 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba que agrupa a comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de acomodar esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 20-30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Nela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo crespo, baja estatura, (en la foto esta parada de blusa ploma) su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela inicial, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, poleras manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre. “Nuestro trabajo empieza en la clasificación de la ropa, zapatos, complementos bolsos, cinturones, juguetes, etc, para ofrecer a nuestro clientes” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una tienda. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para incrementar su mercaderia y por ende su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Kochalitas” communal bank has eight members, all of whom are women. Each member has a different business, including: upholstering vehicles, and selling juices, mobile phone covers, perfumes, soft drinks and clothes. The members have come together to apply for a loan. They all know each other as they live in the same area.

The president of “Kochalitas” communal bank is 26-year-old Nela. She is single and has two children – one boy, six years old, and one girl, four years old. Nela has a business selling second-hand clothes.

Nela is a good mother and hard-working. She runs her business in the south of Cochabamba city in an area where bulk sellers come together to sell products for the city’s different markets. The climate here in Cochabamba is hot and very humid. The day-time temperature oscillates between 20 and 30º Celsius throughout the year.

Nela has dark skin, and long straight dark hair. (In the photo, she is standing at the back wearing a blue top). Her native language is Guaraní but she also speaks Spanish for some things, including at her business.

Nela shares her life with her children, who are in school. The family lives in a rented house built with bricks. The house has electricity, running water, and is connected to the sewer system. 

Nela has a business selling second-hand clothes, including trousers, belts, short-sleeved t-shirts, shorts and more. She works every day at an outdoor street stall. 

She says, “Our work begins when we put the clothes into different categories: shoes, bags, belts, toys, etc, in order to sell to our customers.

Nela’s dream is to improve her quality of life and to own a shop. Nela wants to buy second-hand clothes in bulk in order to stock up for her customers and provide for the demand that there is always is at this time of year.

For these reasons, Nela is applying for a loan in order to buy second-hand clothes in bulk to increase her merchandise and her working capital.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Lafia sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Fatoumata  debout au milieu sur la photo fait le commerce de soumbala à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 paniers de 20 kg de soumbala. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Kamelen Sirakoro et à Sikasso. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au  marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Lafia group are married women averaging 44 years of age, with five children. They live mainly in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a neighborhood in the outskirts of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali.
They are on their 22nd solidarity loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. Their goal is meeting customer demand.

Mrs. Fatoumata, the one standing in the middle of the photo, is the one who sells "soumbala" [ a traditional fermented beans dish]. She plans to use her loan to buy five 20-kg [44 lbs] baskets of soumbala. She stocks up locally in Kamelen Sirakoro as well as in Sikasso. She is sought out by customers because of the high quality of her merchandise. She sells mainly to female customers, for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the market.

Mrs. Fatoumata anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, a part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest and the rest to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs vingtièmes prêts solidaires avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Wassa  debout en première position de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo fait le commerce de tomate à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêts 5 paniers de 20 kg de soumbala. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Kamelen Sirakoro et  à Sikasso. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au  marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabaly group are married women averaging 30 years of age, with four children. They live mainly in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a neighborhood in the outskirts of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali.They are on their 20th solidarity loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. Their goal is meeting customer demand.

Mrs. Wassa, the first one standing from right to left in the photo, is the one who sells tomatoes. She plans to user he loan to buy five 20-kg [44 lbs] baskets of [tomatoes]. She has a steady customer following because of high quality of her goods. She sells mainly to female customers, for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the market.

Mrs. Wassa anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, a part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest and the rest to bolster her savings.
.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Victoriana Group

texts.es: Victoriana es un grupo solidario que por sexta ocasión solicita el financiamiento de ADIM para sus negocios, está integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras y con espíritu de superación, quien lo coordina es Pilar, una mujer emprendedora de 44 años de edad, acompañada, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos, cuenta con una experiencia de ocho años en lo que es la comercialización de estos productos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de blusa, camisetas, perfumes, vanidades, etc., una de sus metas es la comercialización de electrodomésticos como es abanico, plancha para el cabello, secadoras, ya que son productos que la clientela le demanda por lo que se ha propuesto invertir en estos productos lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, ya que existen temporadas bajas y al diversificar los productos ofrecidos atraería nuevos clientes, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, ya que compra al por mayor por lo que las ganancias son mayores, lo que le ayuda a aportar más a los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Victoriana is a solidarity group, which for the sixth time asks for financing from ADIM for its business. It consists of three determined women and with the desire to succeed. 

Pilar coordinates it, a 44-year-old enterprising woman, married, she makes a living by selling clothes and cosmetics, having experience of eight years commercializing these products. 

She is asking for the current loan to buy blouses, T-shirts, perfumes, compacts, etc. One of her goals is the commercialization of electrical appliances like fans, hair straighteners, hair dryers, now that they are products that the clientele demands. She has proposed to invest in these products, which will permit her to improve her income. Now that it is the off season, when she diversifies the products offered, she will attract new clients. 

With the previous loans, she succeeded in growing and diversifying the products offered, now that she buys wholesale so that the profits are greater, which helps her to contribute more to pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise and propel the sale of electrical appliances, in a way that will allow the business to grow

loans.name: Arzikan

texts.ru: Арзикан, 48 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Арзикан среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как об ответственной и трудолюбивой женщине. Арзикан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, где она выращивает пшеницу и малину для реализации. Экологически чистая, вкусная продукция пользуется большим спросом. Начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Арзикан, ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Арзикан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян риса, минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы, на оставшиеся средства она приобретет коров. Доходы от кредита Арзикан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Arzikan is 48 years, married and has 2 children. Arzikan has a secondary education and has very good references from her neighbors. They refer to her as a responsible and hardworking woman. To provide the primary income for her family, Arzikan has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 20 years. She has 2 cows and 0.50 hectares of owned and 1.0 hectares of leased land, where she grows wheat and raspberries for sale. Her ecologically-clean and delicious products are in high demand. Having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS), thanks to her hard work, Arzikan's business currently yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month, which provides the basis for covering expenses for food and basic family needs. In order to further develop her business, Arzikan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy rice seeds, mineral fertilizers for treating the land and cows with the remaining money. Arzikan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, mineral fertilizers for treating the land, and cows with the remaining money

loans.name: La Estrella Y El Lucero Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario La estrella y el lucero lo integran tres mujeres esforzadas en sus labores diarias, quien lo coordina es Erika una mujer que tiene la edad de 26 años, acompañada, dedicada a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos en su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace tres años con ayuda de su compañero de vida además ella se dedicaba a cultivar y por medio de las ganancias obtenidas impulsó su propio negocio, es el quinto ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio, este último lo invertirá en pantalones para damas y caballeros, bóxer, blúmer, brazier, tobilleras, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar los productos ofrecidos, mejorando los ingresos percibidos. Otras integrantes son las señoras, Tania quien tiene la edad de 28 años, y ofrece el servicio de venta de sopas en su domicilio desde hace tres años, y Juana de 32 años de edad dedicada a la comercialización de cosméticos en su comunidad desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The "La Estrella" communal loan bank is made up of three women who work very hard every day. The coordinator is Erika, who is 26 years old and lives with her partner. She works selling clothing and makeup in her community. She started this business three years ago with her partner's help. She also used to farm, and with the profits she started her own business. This is her fifth loan cycle in which ADIM has provided her with financing for her business. She will invest the most recent loan in pants for women and men, boxers, ladies underwear, bras, socks, etc. With the previous loans she was able to increase the number of products she offers, which improve her earnings. 

The other members are Tania, who is 28 years old and has been selling soups from her home for three years, and Juana, who is 32 years old and has been selling cosmetics in her community for two years.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise, which will allow her to diversify the products she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labor and hoeing.

loans.name: Tulimulugezi Group

texts.fr: Suite à l'insuffisance de moyens financiers, Benoit a été contraint d'abandonner l'école en 1975 et de se lancer dans l'agriculture avec l'assistance de ses parents et grands parents. Après toutes ces années, Benoit a fini par comprendre que l'agriculture fait partie de sa vie car qu'il en tire le nécessaire pour sa survie et espère de plus en plus améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants. Les problèmes qu'il rencontre actuellement est le fait qu'il ne possède qu'une petite étendue de terre, le paiement de la main d'oeuvre lors du sarclage et l'achat de produits phytosanitaires. Il préside le groupe TULIMULUGEZI et sur le photo il tient un carnet rose.
texts.en: Owing to insufficient financial means, Benoit was obliged to leave school in 1975 and begin farming with the help of his parents and grandparents. After all these years, Benoit has finally understood that farming is part of his life since he makes enough money to live on, and he hopes progressively to improve his family's living conditions and educate his children. He is currently faced with the problems of  having only a small area of land, the need to pay for labor for hoeing and buy phytosanitory products. He is president of the Tulimulugezi group and is holding a pink notebook in the photo.

loans.use: to transplant and hoe.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es una mujer de 53 años de edad, casada tiene un hijo de la edad de 21 años  y se dedica a la producción y venta de Queso.
Ella es una persona trabajadora, sencilla, humilde, honesta, madrugadora, puntual, emprendedora y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Pampa Chililaya’ a una altura de 3735 metros sobre el nivel del mar, distante a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad de la paz.
Carmela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura mediana, ojos obscuros, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta y pollera), su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su rutina comienza desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada, diariamente lucha para sacar sus productos frescos a la calle, son muchos los gastos que tiene que hacer para llegar al producto final. El proceso comienza con la leche recién ordeñada, los envases para almacenar el queso se elaboran con materiales de Totora, propia del lugar. “Este trabajo nos da para vivir honradamente y sin lujos. Con lo que ganamos pagamos las cuentas, compramos comida y seguimos trabajando ”, comenta Carmela.
El principal problema de Carmela es la poca producción de leche, la época lluviosa fue muy corta y no ayudó a que aumentara el pasto para alimentar a las ovejas y vacas. Esto repercutió de manera directa en la obtención de la leche, la provisión diaria es insuficiente para aumentar la producción de queso, dependiendo de la época del año, el pasto desmejora y esto merma la producción de leche.
Es por esos motivos que Carmela solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras como tambien ovejas, aumentar la producción de queso y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmela, age 53, is married and has a 21 year old son. She is in the business of making and selling cheese. Carmela is a hard-working woman: simple, humble, honest, early-rising, punctual, enterprising, and hard fighting. She runs her business in an area called Pampa Chililaya, some 3735 meters above sea level and about 65 km from the city of La Paz.

Carmela has dark skin, a long black braid, a medium build, and dark eyes. She dresses in traditional style with a shawl and full skirt. Her birth language is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish for business. She begins her daily routine at the earliest hours of dawn.

She struggles every day to bring her fresh products to the street. There are many expenses involved in bringing her final product to market. The process begins with the fresh milk. The packages to store the cheese are made with material from materials native to Totora. "This work allows us to live honorably and without luxury. With what we earn, we can pay the bills, buy food, and keep working." said Carmela.

Carmela's main problem is low milk production. The rainy season was very short and she wasn't able to get as much forage as she needs to feed her sheep and cows. This directly affects their milk production; their daily rations just aren't enough to increase her production of cheese. She is very dependent on the season; the forage will spoil and this decreases milk production. 

That's why Carmela is requesting this loan, which she will use to buy milking sheep and cows, expand her cheese production, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheep and cows

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rufina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. Rufina is borrowing 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, milk, and other items to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, milk, and other items to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a 16,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Ester has been in this business for 2 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ester would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosana works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Rosana is borrowing 13,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Santa Maria Ii-Papa Group

texts.es:
Clemente (al lado derecho de la fotografia) es  una  persona muy  optimista, el vive en Solola junto a sus siete hijos ya todos mayores de edad él es casado y tiene 59 años de edad. 

Clemente empezó con la agricultura cuando tenía 20 años de edad, porque desde pequeño estuvo trabajando al lado de su padre y  aprendió los procesos de la siembra de maíz, y hasta ahora el sigue realizando este trabajo, Clemente para poder  sembrar mas cuerdas  de  maíz,  y mantener la siembra que tiene, ahora está buscando un préstamo, que esto le serviría para  comprar fertilizante y poder mantener la siembra para que pueda darle una buena cosecha. 
  
El es muy responsable con su familia y para generar otros ingresos, actualmente cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, esto lo hace con el fin de poder  obtener más ingresos darle  una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos. 

El sueño de clemente es conseguir este préstamo y así pueda seguir cultivando mas cuerdas de maíz  con el apoyo de sus hijos realizan todo el trabajo necesario para poder sembrar
texts.en:
Clemente (to the right of the photo) is an optimistic person. He lives in Sololá with his 7 children who are all adults. Clemente is 59 years old and married.

Clemente started farming when he was 20 years old and still continues to farm. He worked at his father's side from when he was small and as a result learnt about the process of planting corn. In order to be able to plant more corn and maintain the crops he has, Clemente is now looking for a loan which would allow him to purchase fertilizer and be able to maintain his crops, which will therefore provide him with a good harvest.  

  
Clemente is very responsible with his family and to generate additional income he has a small grocery store. All this he does with the aim of earning more money to provide his children with a better quality of life. His dream is to receive this loan and therefore, with the help of his children, be able to carry on planting more corn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for crops.

loans.name: Mae Susaine

texts.en:
Mae Susaine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Mae Susaine has been in this business for 7 years. Mae Susaine earns more income from buying and selling gasoline and vegetables.

Mae Susaine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old and married with two children.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: A $600 loan is offered to Celestina to improve her business. Celestina lives in Suai and she is a business women. Most of her daily income comes from selling chickens, so she is still happy to do her business. She started her business in 2013, with her own working capital of $400. She was going to add money to her principal amount to buy other chickens, because it has become her activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more chickens in the future. She also has other animals like buffalo, cows, pigs, and goats.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 38-year-old woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She wants to save money so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.
Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 
Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy the moto rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a moto rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Nguong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguong, born in 1981, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children--one son and one daughter--in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is based on cultivation and animal breeding so the income is just enough to cover food for the whole family and save a small amount of money. Because she has to feed her children and pay for their education costs, the small amount saved is not enough to pay for their education fees, and that is the reason she wants to borrow a loan to cover her children’s education fees.
She will find an additional job to work to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI, and she hopes the loan will help her children have better conditions for studying in order to have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education fees

loans.name: Mary Gina

texts.en:
Mary Gina works hard to support her family. Mary Gina is married and has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines.
She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.
Mary Gina has been in this business for one year now.
In the future, Mary Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Letecia works hard to support her family.
She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising chicken. Letecia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.
Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.
Michelle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Michelle has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene 42 años de edad con dos hijos varones  mayores de edad que ayudan en las actividades de sus padres. 

Sabina es una mujer que ayuda mucho a su esposo, ella desde hace 7 años empezó  a conseguir espacio para trabajar con la agricultura, y sembrar diversidad de verduras, eligió esta actividad ya que cuenta con la experiencia que le habían inculcado sus padres,  pues cuando se caso dejo de hacerlo, pero ahora viendo la necesidad de generar más  de ingresos económicos nuevamente empezó a cultivar. Sabina ha logrado conseguir varios prestamos por lo que ya  conoce la metodología de los pagos, ella considera que es una de las formas de cómo prosperar en la vida. 

Sabina lo que necesita para seguir con sus siembras es incrementar sur capital de trabajo, para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, ella se considera capaz de pagar el préstamo, ya que sus hijos lo estarían apoyando en los trabajos de campo para no pagar jornales de trabajo, tanto en la preparación de la tierra así como en los días de siembra, el anhelo de Sabino es conseguir su préstamo lo mas antes posible para buscar y comprar las semillas que necesarios para todo lo que tiene planeado cultivar.
texts.en:
Sabina lives in a community in Sololá, she is 42 years old and has two grown-up sons who help their parents with their work.

Sabina is a woman who lends a lot of help to her husband. Seven years ago, she began acquiring land in order to grow a variety of vegetables. She chose farming because she already had experience of it from her parents. When she got married, she stopped farming, but in recent years, seeing the need to increase their earnings, she began growing crops again.

Sabina has managed to apply for various loans, so she is aware of the repayment system. She thinks that it is one of the ways to prosper in life.

In order to continue planting her crops, Sabina needs to increase her working capital, to buy seeds and fertilisers. She believes that she will be able to pay back the loan, as her sons will be helping her with the farm work so that she doesn't have to pay labourers. They will help her to both prepare the land and plant the crops. 

Sabrina wants to get her loan as soon as possible so that she can source and buy the seeds she needs for everything she plans to grow.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a rural farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is a mother of four and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, Magdaline offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her parents, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs," said Magdaline. Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Magdaline formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful) that produces milk daily, which Magdaline then sells to a co-operative. "The money from the milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Magdaline. The money Magdaline got from selling the milk was adequate to repay a loan. Today, Magdaline is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Magdaline is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam is a 40-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges from his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Mariyam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business. Mariyam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 24 years old and married with two children.
She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Joyce is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Joyce has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
Gloria, de 23 años de edad, está acompañada desde hace 4 años, su pareja  es motorista, tienen una hija y actualmente, viven en casa de sus suegros.

Gloria, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por medio de revista. Tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, cuando inicio lo hizo como vendedora, pero ahora es asesor de belleza.- El trabajo lo aprendió sola y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo porque le gusta y deseaba apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.

Gloria, desempeña su trabajo en tres municipio cercanos a su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día, según la demanda. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería como labiales, cremas, perfumes, cremas faciales, entre otros productos. Todo esto para mejorar el negocio. 

El préstamo le ayudara  a cubrir la demanda que tiene para esta época navideña y de fin de año.

Los sueños de Gloria son: en un futuro espera poner su propio negocio en un local, ya que actualmente la venta la hace viajando de lugar en lugar y sueña con formalizarse en un lugar propio.- 

Para su familia desea seguir apoyando a su esposo para sacar adelante a su hija, ella anhela que su hija estudie y tenga las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Gloria, 23 years old, has been with her partner for 4 years. Her partner is a driver, they have a daughter and are currently living with her in-laws.

Gloria works selling cosmetics from catalogues. She has been in this line of work for 7 years. She started as a saleswoman but now is a beauty consultant. She learnt this trade by herself and decided to get into this line of work because she likes it and wanted to support her family with the household expenses.

Gloria, works in three towns near her house and her daily work schedule is 5 hours a day, according to demand.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise such as lipsticks, creams, perfumes, face creams, etc. Everything is to improve the business.

The loan will help meet the demand she has during the holidays and New Year period.

The dreams Gloria has are: in the future she hopes to have her own business in a shop, as currently she is a traveling saleswoman going from place to place and she dreams of having her own proper store.

For her family, she wants to continue supporting her husband to bring up their daughter, she longs for her daughter to go to school and have the opportunities that she never had.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes, face creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens at wholesale.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es: Elías joven emprendedor de 22 años, se dedica a la siembra y venta de piña en su propio terreno agrícola. Antes de ello se dedicaba a la venta de pescado de manera ambulatoria es por ello que está empezando a ahorrar un pequeño capital para reiniciar en este negocio. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar productos agroquímicos (abono) para su sembrío de piña y poder así mejorar sus ventas de  producción. Elías viste polo de color amarillo, está muy satisfecho y seguro de contar con el  apoyo  de los inversionistas kiva.
texts.en:
Elías is a young entrepreneur. He is 22 years old and makes a living growing and selling pineapples on his own agricultural land. He used to sell fish door-to-door and he is starting to save some money so that he can begin to do this once again. 

He requires the loan in order to buy agrochemical products (fertiliser) to use on his pineapple crop. In this way he will be able to improve his sales. Elías is wearing the yellow t-shirt in the photograph, and he is very satisfied and confident in counting on the support of the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy agrochemical products (fertiliser).

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Christy is twenty-two years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Christy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Christy requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional assorted fish to sell.

Christy has been in this business for eight years. Christy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is forty-nine years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Irenia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irenia has been farming sugar cane for two years and also earns an additional income from working in a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jesselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and working in a general store.  Jesselyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jesselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is fifty years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Henrietta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Henrietta aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angel Michael

texts.es: Ángel Michael nació en una comunidad llamada el sardinal en el año de 1992. Ángel Michael es el hijo mayor de 4 hijos el estudio toda su primaria en la escuela de la comunidad, luego que el salió de estudiar primaria decidió estudiar su secundaria y se matriculo en la escuela de la sorpresa una comunidad que queda cerca de la comunidad el sardinal. pero comenta que por cosas de la vida solo estudio su primer año y lo estudio los dias domingos recuerda que para ese tiempo el estudiaba los dias domingos y los otros dias le ayudaba al padre en agricultura y así fue que el aprendió las labores agrícolas. Ángel ha trabajado con su padre y también ha trabajado en otros lugares el padre le dio un pedazo de tierra y el ha podido comprar también mas tierra en las que tiene sembrado café y también siembra granos básicos. Actualmente Ángel Michael está acompañado con la muchacha de nombre Yobileth ya tienen de estar juntos 4 años y han procreado 1 hija que tiene dos años. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo hacer su casa en la que vive con su familia y tiene su tierra en la que siembra y obtiene su dinero, en la comunidad donde vive Ángel no hay luz eléctrica y comenta que está bien difícil que ingrese la luz a ese lugar, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder tener luz en su casa y este sistema será de gran beneficio para todos los miembros del hogar y algunos familiares que lleguen a la casa, él le da gracias a Dios que le regalo la vida y le regalo su hija, comenta Ángel que estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Angel Michael was born in a community called El Sardinal in 1992. Angel Michael is the oldest son of 4 children. He went through primary school in the community, when he finished his primary education he decided to go to high school and he graduated from [elementary] school to the surprise of the community which is near to the El Sardinal community. He says that due to various things that happened, he only studied the first year and he studied on Sundays. He remembers that during that time, he was only at school on Sundays and the other days of the week he helped his father on the farm and that is how he learnt to do farm work. 

Angel has worked with his father and had also worked in other places. His father gave him a plot of land and he has also been able to buy more land, on which he has planted in coffee and also staple grains. Currently Angel Michael is in a relationship with a girl whose name is Yobileth. They have been together for 4 years and have a daughter who is two years old. With a lot of effort he has set up house where he lives with his family and he has his land which he farms and makes a living. In the community where Angel lives there is no electricity and he mentions that it is very difficult to get electricity there.  

This is his reason for requesting a loan, to buy a solar system and thus be able to have electricity in their home. The solar panels would be of great benefit for all the members of his family and some family members who visit him. He gives thanks to God who gave him life and his daughter. Angel remarks that he would be very grateful if they would give him the opportunity to take out this loan to buy this solar system.

loans.use: to buy solar panels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's graduation costs.

loans.name: Jacqueline Areli

texts.es: Nuevamente Jacqueline solicita un crédito a FUSAI, en esta ocasión para invertir en la construcción de las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual comprará adobes(ladrillo elaborado a base de tierra mojada y sácate seco) y madera. Espera poder contar nuevamente con este apoyo dado que no cuenta con el efectivo disponible para hacerlo por su cuenta, pero sí con la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito requiere. Agradece el apoyo  que recibió en el pasado para reparar el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en: Jacqueline is again applying for a loan from FUSAI on this occasion to invest in the construction of the walls of the home, for which she will buy adobes (brick made from wet earth and taken out to dry) and wood. She hopes to be able to have rely on this loan again since she doesn't have the necessary cash available to do it on her own, but does have the ability to make monthly payments that the loan requires. She is thankful for the help she received in the past to repair the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy: adobes (brick made from wet earth and taken out to dry) and wood to construct the walls of the home.

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Andrea ya lleva muchos años vendiendo comida de forma ambulante en las calles de Managua. Así ella y su esposo juntos mantienen la casa y los gastos familiares, ya que todavía tienen dos hijos menores a su cargo. Como sus ingresos no dan para hacer inversiones mayores, Doña Andrea solicita apoyo crediticio para realizar su gran sueño de mejorar su casita, que con tantos esfuerzos construyó. Con los créditos anteriores ya pudo construir unas divisiones para los cuartos, levantó un muro perimetral y compuso la cocina. Este cuarto préstamos ahora lo está solicitando para construir el cascote y instalar cerámica en la sala. Esta obra mejorará mucho las condiciones de vida de Doña Andrea y su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea has sold food on the streets of Managua for many years now. This is how she and her husband pay for the household and family expenses together, as they are still bringing up two children.

As her earnings do not allow her to make big investments, Andrea is requesting the help of a loan to achieve her dream of improving her home, which she built with a great deal of effort.

With the previous loans, she was able to build partition walls for the rooms, put up a boundary wall and decorate the kitchen. She is now requesting a loan to carry out further building work and tile the living room.

This building work will vastly improve Andrea and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reinerio tiene 52 años de edad, es casado. El vive en casa propia en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca,en la sierra norte del Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

La actividad que realiza Reinerio es la crianza y venta de ganado (vacas, chivos, entre otros), cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad y con clientela fija en la zona, quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará como capital de trabajo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno así como para la compra de alimento para el engorde de estos. Esta inversión lo ayudará a mejorar la productividad de su negocio lo que incrementará sus ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reinerio is 52 years old and married. He lives in his own house in the district of Querocotillo, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry as their primary economic activities. 

The work Reinerio does is raising and selling livestock (cows and goats, among others). He has 10 years of experience in this work and has regular customers in the zone who give him very good personal and work references. The loan will be used as working capital to purchase a larger number of cattle and also to pay for feed to fatten them. This investment will improve the productivity of his business which will increase his income and permit a better quality of life for him and for his family.

loans.use: to have working capital to purchase a larger number of cattle and also to pay for feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her neighborhood. Vilma has been in the business for more than a year now. Her husband is a tricycle driver.

 
Vilma is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as rice, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, bread, soap, toiletries, cooking, condiments, soda and beverages. This loan will enable her to improve her inventories which will attract more buyers. In the future, Vilma hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money to cover her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and canned goods, biscuits, bread, soap, toiletries, cooking, condiments, soda and beverages

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is thankful that he was granted an 10,000 PHP loan which he used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in his sewing business. Through his earnings he is able to support his family's  daily needs. 

He would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan, which he will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in his business. Filipinos love to redecorate their homes and have new curtains from time to time. He also makes school  uniforms of a school nearby their house. He earns a minimum of PHP 600 a day. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be giving him.

Danilo hopes to grow his business and put up another sewing shop someday. He aims to improve his family's standard of living.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and a sewing machine

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoriana is fifty-one years old and has one child who is still in school.

Victoriana has a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines. Victoriana requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell.

Victoriana has been in this business for five years. Victoriana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Margarita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is forty years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk and sugar.

Loreta has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for fifteen years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Janita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling veterinary supplies in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Janita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice barn for her veterinary supplies business.

Janita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice barn

loans.name: Bárbara

texts.es:
Bárbara es una señora muy entusiasta y amable que trabaja muy duro todos los días para darle lo necesario a su familia que se compone de 4 hijos y su esposo. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada.
